loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin nació en la comunidad de Paucarbamba y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, él tiene 62 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos.

Fermin desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Paucarbamba, él se dedica a la construcción de obras y casas, él también se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Fermin requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes. 

Fermin se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Fermin pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Fermin was born in the community of Paucarbamba and lives in the same community, he is 62, has common-law partner and three children. 

Fermin performs his daily and economic activities in the city of Paucarbamba, he works in the construction of houses and other projects, he also works in agriculture and raising livestock. It's been a few years since he started this business and he does well thanks to the effort he puts in his work.

Fermin needs the loan to buy more small animals like cuyes.

Fermin is thankful for the opportunity provided through this loan and commits to make the repayments according to schedule. Fermin belongs to the community bank "Immaculate Conception of Pachar" from the Arariwa Association in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy small animals like cuyes.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio nació en la provincia de Anta y vive en la comunidad  de Paucarbamba, él tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos.

Demetrio desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Paucarbamba, él se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Demetrio requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales como toros y vacas. 

Demetrio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Demetrio pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Demetrio was born in the Anta province and lives in the Paucarbamba community.  He’s 37 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has three children.

He works in Paucarbamba, where he farms and raises livestock.  He’s been doing this for several years and things are going well for him, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Demetrio needs this loan to buy more animals, such as bulls and cows.

He’s grateful for the opportunity given to him through this means and he is committed to making his payments on time.  He’s a member of the “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for a tortilla making business.

loans.name: Raymundina

texts.es:
Raymundina nació en la comunidad de Pachar y vive en la comunidad de Paucarbamba, ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.

Raymundina desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Paucarbamba, ella trabaja en la municipalidad de Maras en el área de desarrollo económico como responsable de varios proyectos agrícolas, ella también se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura en la comunidad donde vive. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Raymundina requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas como por ejemplo de maíz.  

Raymundina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Raymundina pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Raymundina was born in the Pachar community and lives in the Paucarbamba community.  She’s 43 years old, married, and has two children.

She works in Maras and is in charge of various agricultural projects.  She also raises livestock and farms in her own community.  She’s been doing this for several years and things have been going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Raymundina needs this loan to buy more seeds, such as corn.
 
She is grateful for the opportunity given her through this medium and is committed to making her payments on time.  Raymundina is a member of the “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido nació en la ciudad de Maras y vive en la comunidad  de Paucarbamba, él tiene 38 años de edad y no tiene hijos por el momento.

Guido desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Paucarbamba, él se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Guido requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales como toros y vacas. 

Guido se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Guido pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Guido was born in city of Maras and lives in the Paucarbamba community.  He’s 38 years old and doesn’t have any children yet.

He works in Paucarbamba, where he raises livestock and farms.  He’s been doing this for several years and things have been going well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Guido needs this loan to buy more animals such as bulls and cows.
 
He is grateful for the opportunity given him through this medium and is committed to making his payments on time.  Guido is a member of the “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia nació en la ciudad D. Maras y vive en la comunidad D. Paucarbamba, ella tiene 62 años D. edad y es viuda pero tiene ocho hijos.

Felicia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad D. Paucarbamba, ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como pollos, cuyes y otros mas, ella también se dedica la venta D. granos secos como maíz, cebada, trigo y otros mas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Felicia tambien venD. chicha D. jora. 

Felicia requiere el préstamo para comprar más chanchos y granos secos. 

Felicia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Felicia pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción D. Pachar” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad D. Urubamba.
texts.en:
She works in Paucarbamba, where she raises small animals such as chickens, Guinea pigs, and others.  She also sells dried grains such as corn, barley, wheat, and others.  She’s been doing this for several years and things have been going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She also sells chicha.

Felicia needs this loan to buy more pigs and dried grain.
 
She is grateful for the opportunity given her through this medium and is committed to making her payments on time.  Felicia is a member of the “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy pigs and grain.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
MatilD. nació en la ciudad D. Paucarbamba y vive en la misma comunidad donD. nació, ella tiene 56 años D. edad y es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene seis hijos.

MatilD. desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad D. Paucarbamba, ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como gallinas, chanchos, pollos, cuyes y otros mas, ella también se dedica a la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

MatilD. requiere el préstamo para comprar más abono, fertilizantes pesticidas.  

MatilD. se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. MatilD. pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción D. Pachar” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad D. Urubamba.
texts.en:
Matilde was born in the city of Paucarbamba and lives in the same community. She is 56 years old, married, and has six children.

Matilde engages in her everyday and business activities in the city of Paucarbamba. She raises small animals such as hens, pigs, chickens, guinea pigs, and other creatures. In addition, she engages in farming. Matilde has been in this business for several years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts forth in her work. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more compost, fertilizers, and pesticides.

Matilde is grateful for the opportunity that is being given to her. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments on schedule. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert has a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from LSU and an MBA from Southern University.  He is currently working as an electrical engineer for a large company, but he now wants to combine his two degrees to start RCP-3, an electrical contracting service, to install, inspect, repair, and/or maintain electricity in residential and commercial buildings in the New Orleans area.  
Although from New Orleans, during Hurricane Katrina, Robert was in Baton Rouge studying. He returned to New Orleans after Katrina for his electrical engineering job. He sees a need for good electricians in New Orleans and wants his own business, RCP-3, to be part of the rebuilding and restoration in post-Katrina NOLA. He will use his Kiva loan to purchase various electrical meters, tools, and marketing materials. Robert is a licensed electrician in the State of Louisiana. He loves to cook, play chess, and is an avid college football fan.

loans.use: to pay for various electrical meters, tools, and marketing materials for his new business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced. She lives with her grown son in Vodyanoye. 

Valentina owns two big and spacious greenhouses and two smaller ones. She grows vegetables for sale. She has been in this farming business for 12 years. Currently, she has 50,000 UAH invested in this venture. 

She usually spends about 20,000 to 25,000 UAH on seeds and plastic film every year. Valentina is seeking a 20,000 UAH loan to purchase three rolls of polyethylene film, tomato seeds and fertilizers for her greenhouses. 

She is very excited to see her business grow and provide a stable income for her family. Profits generated have helped them make enough savings to purchase a new house. Valentina is hoping to further expand her business and eventually finish all the remodeling in her recently purchased house.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 46 years old, married, and has four adult children.  She lives in the town of Papa Puleia.  To make a living, Elisa raises crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell.  Elisa has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2011, Elisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Elisa is requesting her first loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Elisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Refuge De Dumas 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Cantave  eS. le coordinateur de son groupe refuge. Il eS. marié mais il a 5 enfants. Cantave habite dans la ville de Dumas d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité eS. rare et de l’eau eS. très limitée.

Cantave a dirigé son business pendant les 5 dernières années. Cantave voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des boeufs. Cantave espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de les refuge ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Cantave dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve eS. l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les animaux.
texts.en:
Cantave is the coordinator of the group “Refuge”. He is married with five children, and he lives in the city of Dumas, in Haiti, where electricity is scarce and water supplies are very limited.

Cantave has been raising cattle for the past 5 years. He plans to use his loan to purchase oxen, and he hopes that this credit will help him to expand his business. Other members of the Refuge group require loans for such businesses as selling charcoal, rice and fish.

Cantave’s main goal is the expansion of his business, and his dream is to buy a motorcycle to transport animals.

loans.use: to buy oxen

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is 37 years old, married, and has four children who attend school.  She lives in the town of Aopo.  To make a living, Elisapeta runs a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling a variety of confections such as cookies and cakes in the local community.  Elisapeta has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 680 WST a month.

In 2011, Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting her first loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase baking equipment. Elisapeta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Sape

texts.en:
Sape is 48 years old, married, and has eight adult children.  She lives in the town of Samauga.  To make a living, Sape raises crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell.  Sape has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2011, Sape joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting her first loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Sape plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in the town of Zaporozhye. She earns a living by selling women’s outer clothing in one of the biggest marketplaces in her town. She owns her sales location and also rents two other places, where employees who she has hired also sell clothing.  She has been in business for more than 13 years and has an inventory worth about 30,000 Grivnyas. She is applying for a loan for 8,000 Grivnyas to buy seasonal footwear for winter. Svetlana is hoping to see her business grow and develop, and one day hopes to open a large and fashionable clothing store.

loans.use: to buy winter merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Rubiela

texts.es:
María Rubiela es una mujer emprendedora que desde pequeña aprendió a realizar diferentes productos alimenticios al lado de su abuela; la tradicional empanada, el pastel de pollo y las arepas de chócolo son algunos de los productos que esta luchadora sabe elaborar, conocimiento que aprovechó para empezar con su propio negocio, una venta de estos productos en su casa.

Desde entonces este ha sido un apoyo para la familia, pues sus ventas contribuyen a cubrir los gastos del hogar. Actualmente, necesita de un préstamo para comprar una fritadora, una nevera y algunos insumos básicos para elaborar sus productos, lo que le permitirá agilzar los procesos, realizar mayor cantidad de productos y así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Rubiela is an enterprising woman. As a young girl, she learned from her grandmother how to make different dishes such as traditional empanadas, chicken pot pies, and yellow corn cakes. Some of these dishes are a struggle to prepare. María took advantage of this knowledge to start her own business selling these products from her home.

Since that time, she has been able to support her family. Her sales allow her to contribute toward the household expenses. At the moment, María needs a loan to buy a deep fryer, a cooler, and some basic supplies used in preparing her products. This will allow her to be more efficient in her work so that she can improve the quality of her dishes and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer, a cooler, and basic supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Emilsen

texts.es:
Crear un restaurante es el sueño de Gloria Enilsen, una mujer emprendedora que a sus 33 años se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes platos para celebraciones especiales, tamales, obleas, así como a la venta de minutos a celular en su propia casa ubicada en Sonsón, municipio del norte de Antioquia, Colombia. 

Actualmente, esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar gas y carbón para la elaboracíón de sus productos, así como algunos insumos que le permitirán optimizar tiempo y recursos para generar mayores ingresos que son los que le permiten aportar al cubrimiento de los gastos del hogar y que espera que en un futuro gracias a su trabajo sus dos hijas puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Creating a restaurant has been the dream of Gloria Emilsen, an enterprising woman who is 33 years old. She spends her time preparing different foods for special occasions, such as tamales and wafers. In addition, she sells mobile phone minutes from her home in Sonsón, a town north of Antioquia, Colombia.

At the moment, Gloria needs a loan to buy gas and charcoal for making her products. In addition, she needs a few other supplies that will help her to be more efficient with her time and resources so that she can generate more income to cover the household expenses. In the future, she hopes that her work will enable her to provide her two daughters a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, gas, and other supplies.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Amelia solicita un préstamo para comprar más mercancía para vender ya que con la que cuenta, no es de temporada de invierno y lo que desea es ofrecer buena mercancía para no perder a sus clientes. 
Doña Amelia quedo viuda desde hace años lo cual tuvo que realizar algunas actividades para sacer adelante a sus hijos y lo único que funciono fue la venta de ropa y zapatos en diferentes partes de la ciudad , desde entonces de a dedicado a las ventas y ha logrado tener un patrimonio y ha ver educado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Amelia is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise to sell. Even though it is not yet winter, she wants to offer good merchandise so that she does not lose customers.

Doña Amelia has been a widow for several years, so she has had to engage in a few businesses in order to help her children move forward. The only business that has succeeded is selling clothes and shoes in different parts of the city. Since then she has dedicated herself to making sales so that she can build up assets and provide an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Saulelia

texts.en:
Saulelia is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Paia. She is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Saulelia owns and operates a business raising fruit and vegetables for sale. Saulelia has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 600 WST a month.

In 2010, Saulelia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment, and is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones. The loan will be the second taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Saulelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones

loans.name: José Libardo

texts.es:
A sus 68 años de edad, Libardo quien se dedica a la musica en el municipio de Sonsón al norte de Antioquia de donde es oriundo, este emprendedor espera montar una tienda de productos propios de la canasta familiar en un local ubicado en su propa casa, lo que le permitirá genrar mayores ingresos para su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Libardo, necesita de un préstamo para adecuar el espacio donde montará su tienda, así como para pagar la mano de obra que realizará dichos arreglos.
texts.en:
At age 68, Mr. Libardo is a musician in the city of Sonsón, north of Antioquia where he was born.  This entrepreneur wants to open a store that sells his own family products that he will set up and run from his home.  This will allow him to increase his income to improve his family’s quality of life.

Mr. Libardo needs a loan to be able to set up the space for the store and pay for labor to do so.
.

loans.use: to set up his store.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia ha sido cliente de CREDITUYO y el crédito fue para la construcción de unos cuartos no término de ampliar su casa, solo logro terminar una parte de las paredes y ahora le falta una pequeña parte para terminar los cuartos.
Con la señora Anastacia viven dos hijos mayores de edad, quienes desean tener su privacidad, y quienes le ayudan con los gastos de la casa. 
Doña Anastacia trabaja como empleada domestica y su esposo en albañil entre los dos han logrado un patrimonio seguro para su familia. Solicitan el préstamo para comprar el materia que es block, cemento, varilla y arena ya que el esposo de la señora Anatacia se encargara de terminar la mejora.
texts.en:
Sra. Anastacia has been a client of Credituyo and used her loan to build a few rooms, but she was not able to finish the expansion of her house. She was only able to finish part of the walls and now is missing a few small details in order to complete the rooms.

Sra. Anastacia lives with two grown children who want to have their privacy. They help with the household expenses. Doña Anastacia works as a housekeeper and her husband is a bricklayer. Between the two of them, they have built up a secure inheritance for their family. This loan will be used to buy materials such as blocks, cement, lumber, and sand. Sra. Anastacia’s husband will be responsible for completing these improvements.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for finishing the upper level of her house.

loans.name: Myriam Astrid

texts.es: A sus 42 años de edad y después de separarse de su esposo, Myriam empezó a trabajar con su madre para generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y ofrecerle a sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Esta emprendedora oriunda de Sonsón al oriente de Antioquia, Colombia desea iniciar con su propio negocio y para ello desea aprovechar la temporada navideña para venderle mercancía a sus conocidos en el municipio. Para ello necesita de un préstamo para comprar ropa interior, medias y cosméticos y así iniciar con este negocio que espera se convierta en un gran almacén con el paso del tiempo.
texts.en: At age 42, and after separating from her husband, Myriam began working with her mother in order to generate more income for her household and provide a better quality of life for her two children.  This enterprising woman is a native of Sonsón, west of Antioquia, Colombia, and wants to start her own business to take advantage of the Christmas season by selling merchandise to her acquaintances in town.  She needs this loan to buy undergarments, socks, and cosmetics.  She hopes that this business will grow into a large store over time.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maota

texts.en:
Maota is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Taga. She is married and has 6 school-aged children.  To make a living, Maota raises cattle for sale.  Maota has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1120 WST a month.

In 2010, Maota joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Maota has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD, used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell, and is now requesting a new loan of 1950 WST which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the third taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Maota plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Norma Leticia lleva poco tiempo con su tienda de venta de abarrotes y a logrado ir surtiendo de mercancía pero le esta haciendo falta mas espacio en el local para exponer su mercancía y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y además de ofrecerle variedad de mercancía.  
Dona Norma Leticia y su esposo son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos uno de 17 años y el otro de 13 años todos le ayudan en el negocio, su esposo es albañil  es quien se encargara de realizar la ampliación en el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma started a grocery store a short time ago and has been able to stock her business with merchandise. However, she lacks additional space in her shop so that she can expand her inventory and provide better service to her customers. Nonetheless, she still offers a variety of products.

Doña Norma Leticia and her husband are the parents of two children, ages 17 and 13. Both children help with the business. Her husband is a bricklayer and will be in charge of expanding the store.

loans.use: to pay the costs related to expanding her store.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Vailoa Palauli.  She is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Mareta owns & operates a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale. Mareta has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1200 WST a month.

In 2009, Mareta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mareta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, used to purchase fertilizers such as manure, and is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. The loan will be the third taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Mareta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Betza Betzabe

texts.es: La señora Betza es una cliente nueva se dedica al ensamblado de computadoras como también al cableado de red de distintas oficinas,  solicita crédito para la compra de cables y partes para realizar su trabajo de ensamblado de computadoras, la Sra. Betza es casada y tiene una hija pequeña, su esposo también se dedica a lo que es el cableado y armado de computadoras, pero su esposo esta en otro departamento realizando este trabajo por contrato para una institución , viven en casa familiar y tienen su oficina en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad de La Paz, La Sra. Betza es una persona joven con ganas de superación desea con el tiempo crecer en su negocio y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias, se siente muy feliz y agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Betza is a new member that works assembling computers and installing network cables at different offices, she requests a loan to purchase cables and parts for computers, Betza is married and has a small daughter, her husband also works setting up network cables and assembling computers, but he is in a different department working on a contract with a different institution, they live at home and have their office in a central location of the city of La Paz, Betza is a young person with hopes to improve and wishes to grow her business over time and this way increase her income, she is very happy and thankful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy cables for network connections

loans.name: Luaipou

texts.en:
Luaipou is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Uta. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Luaipou owns & operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Luaipou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Luaipou is requesting (for the first time from SPBD) a loan of 1000 WST to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Teresa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Teresa Margarita de dedica a la venta de ropa usada y zapatos quiere invertir en compra de material para empezar a realizar accesorios ya que es una buena oportunidad para un ingreso extra, ya que además estará al pendiente de sus hijos en los estudios y en la casa. 
Para así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ya que el se dedica a la reparación de carros en el mismo domicilio, están los dos al pendiente de sus hijos y del negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa Margarita sells used clothing and shoes. She wants to invest in materials to start to make accessories, since it is a good opportunity to make extra income. She can also attend to her children's studies and her home. 
 
In this way, she will help her husband with the family expenses. He repairs cars at their home, so both of them attend to the children and the business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as winter clothing and materials to make accessories.

loans.name: Lotolelei

texts.en:
Lotolelei is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Uta. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lotolelei owns & operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lotolelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, used to purchase baby livestock to raise, and is now requesting a new loan of 1450 WST to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the third taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Lotolelei plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Celia Solanda

texts.es:
Celia de 38 años, empezó con esta actividad hace mucho tiempo atrás, una prima le ofreció el trabajo y el acepto y desde ahí le ha ido muy bien en esta actividad.

Recorre a vender su mercadería a su familia, amigos y también a los pueblos de la ciudad, y los fines de semana viaja a otras ciudades a entregar pedidos de sus clientes.

Su único problema es la delincuencia que afecta el trabajo que realiza. Está casado su esposo es repartidor y tienen 3 hijos de 16, 9 y 4 años.

Su meta es poder seguir adelante con su negocia para así establecer una boutique y seguir adelante para con el tiempo tener una distribuidora de ropa.
texts.en:
Celia is 38 years old and began this business a long time ago.  One of her cousins offered her work, she accepted, and things have gone well ever since.

She sells her merchandise to family, friends, and also to people in the city.  She travels to other cities on the weekends to deliver orders to her customers.

The only problem she faces is with the crime that affects her work.  She’s married and her husband is a delivery man. They have three children, ages 16, 9, and 4.

Her goal is to continue moving forward with her business and set up a boutique to eventually have a clothing distributorship.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Aliadas Group

texts.es: Duo Mujeres Aliadas:este duo esta integrado por dos señoras muy luchadoras que con esfuersos e ilucion venden dia a dia esperando superarse dia con dia, una de ellas es la señorita Mayra ella se dedica a la venta y confeccion de tejidos tipicos,esta contenta porque a tenido la oportunidad de un credito que esta segura que le ayudara mucho en aumentar su negocio,ella esta solicitando el credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos,al igual que la suguiente socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos. esperan que kiva les pueda apoyar por medio de un credito.
texts.en: The Allied Woman Duo is formed by two very hardworking ladies that with effort and optimism sell day to day hoping to get ahead, one of them is Mayra she makes and sells traditional textiles, she is happy because she has been given the opportunity to get a loan that she is sure would help a lot in growing her business, she is requesting a loan to buy raw materials for textile confections, similar to the other lady who also requests a loan for raw materials to make textile confections.   They hope that Kiva can support them through this loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for textile confections.

loans.name: Yasmin Eugenia

texts.es:
Yasmin es una joven emprendedora que a sus 25 años de edad se dedica a la venta de chance en las afueras de una tienda, venta de postres y de peluches que exhibe en la tienda en la que trabaja. 

Actualmente, necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de peluches para la temporada navideña y así obtener mayores ingresos con sus ventas y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yasmin is a young entrepreneurial woman who at age 25 sells desserts and stuffed animals in the store where she works.

She needs this loan to buy stuffed animals in quantity for the Christmas season.  In this way she can increase her income with her sales, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris

Puntarenas 
500000

	Damaris tiene 47 años de edad vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en la zona de Fray Casiano, Puntarenas, es un barrio pobre  y como muchas limitaciones. La clienta  se presenta como una persona con muchos deseos de superarse, se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades y artesanías desde hace 10 años. Ella está  en constante capacitación para ofrecer a sus clientes productos de mayor calidad. Además de adornos elaborar bolsos,  ropa para artículos electrodomésticos y para el baño y productos para fiestas de cumpleaños y otras actividades como primera comunión y bautizos manejando productos de calidad, es ampliamente conocida en la zona por dedicarse a este trabajo, por lo que no le falta clientela durante el año.

	Inició comprando una pequeña cantidad de material con ayuda de su esposo hace 10 años, empezó a capacitarse y mejorar las técnicas y por ende diversificar su producción, aumentando su clientela y mejorando sus ingresos, el objetivo de este préstamo es comprar materia prima y reparar una máquina para ofrecer una mejor calidad en el producto confeccionado.

	 Ella se dedica a su trabajo durante la mayor parte del día, su hija mayor está en la Universidad y los menores de edad se encuentran estudiando, por lo que su primer labor del día es prepararles la comida para que vayan al colegio y escuela, debido a la gran cantidad de encargos trabaja hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que realiza el trabajo de forma manual, pero una vez reparada la máquina este se agilizará incrementando así su producción y el tiempo que comparte con su familia.

	La limitante principal ha sido la falta de dinero, pero esta oportunidad de crédito le va a permitir contar con capital para comprar materia prima y poder así incrementar su producción, y cumplir así el sueño de arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Damaris is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Fray Casiano, Puntarenas zone, a poor neighborhood with many limitations.  She’s been doing arts and crafts for 10 years and presents herself as being someone with a great desire to succeed.  She constantly trains to offer her clients high quality products.  She embroiders purses, appliance covers, bath items, and quality decorations for birthday parties and other events, such as first communions and baptisms.  She’s widely known within the zone, for being dedicated to this work and she is not short of customers throughout the year.

She began by buying a small quantity of materials with her husband’s help.  She started training herself and improving her techniques and ended up diversifying her production, increasing her number of customers, and increasing her income.  The objective of this loan is to buy supplies and repair a sewing machine to be able to offer better quality products.

She works throughout most of the day.  Her oldest daughter studies at university and her younger children attend school.  Her day begins with her preparing their lunches for school.  Because of the large number of orders, she works late into the night.  She has to work by hand, but once the sewing machine is fixed, she will be able to speed up and increase her production, and have more time to spend with her family.

The main limiting factor has been lack of money, but this opportunity for a loan will allow her to have the capital she needs to buy supplies, increase her production, and make her dream of fixing up her house come true.

loans.use: to buy art supplies.

loans.name: Carolina Concepcion

texts.es:
Carolina de 32 años, empezó vendiendo ropa y zapatos ayudando a su familia, luego se independizo e invirtió su capital para trabajar y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Trabaja junto a su esposo y viajan los fines de semana a vender su mercadería a los pueblos.

Sus dificultades son la delincuencia y el transporte ya que es costoso coger bus para sus viajes.

Si está casada y su esposo es panificador, tiene 4 hijos de 13, 8, 7 que estudian en establecimientos fiscales y su último hijo que tiene 1 año.

Su meta es poder establecer un lugar donde pueda ofrecer  toda su mercadería cómodamente.
texts.en:
Carolina, at age 32, began selling clothing and shoes to help out her family.  She later became independent and invested her own capital.  Thanks to God things have gone very well for her.

She works with her husband and they travel to sell merchandise in different towns on the weekends.  Their problems are with the crime and transportation.  Taking the bus is costly.

She is married and her husband is a baker.  They have four children, ages 13, 8, and 7, who attend public school, and the youngest child who is a year old.

Her goal is to set up a location where she can offer all of her merchandise comfortably.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Manuela Benedicta

texts.es:
Manuela de 46 años, empezó como costurera y gracias a sus esfuerzos decidió aumentar su trabajo, ahora también vende productos de uso personal.

Realiza su trabajo sola, por la mañanas vende en el colegio donde estudia su hijos y por las tarde recorres donde familiares y amigos vendiendo sus productos.

Sus dificultades son la delincuencia y el traslado a sus lugares de trabajo. No está casado pero tiene 1 hijos de 16 años que estudia en un colegio fiscal.

Su meta es poder seguirá adelante con su negocio para de esta manera salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Manuela is 46. She started as a seamstress, and because she is a hard worker, she decided to expand her business. Now she also sells products for personal use. She works on her own. 

In the mornings, she sells at the school where her son studies, and in the afternoon travels to the homes of family members and friends to sell her products. The challenges she faces are crime and getting to the places she works. She isn't married, but has a 16 year-old son who is in high school.

Her goal is to keep moving forward with her business, so that she and her son can get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy purses, lotions and lipsticks.

loans.name: Giovani

texts.es: Giovani, de 26 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor y dinámico, además de tener muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero, vive en compañía de su madre y sus dos hermanas de 18 y 16 años de edad, instalado es la casa de su madre. La actividad que realiza Giovani es el servicio de mototaxi, para esto se compró un motocarro de segundo uso a un bajo costo con un préstamo que recibió de MFP hace 2 años. Desde entonces se levanta muy  temprano y saliendo en la búsqueda de pasajeros por la ciudad de Pucallpa durante toda la mañana hasta el medio día, luego se dedica a sus estudios universitarios. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera para poder apoyar en los gastos de su hogar y solventar sus estudios, además de lograr conocer zonas nuevas por toda la ciudad. Lo que no le gusta de su actividad es cuando llueve, las calles se vuelven difíciles de transitar. Por otro lado tiene planes de incursionar en otro negocio que consiste en la venta de repuestos para motos al por mayor, siendo sus clientes las tiendas de ventas de repuestos de sus amistades y conocidos. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero para concretar su objetivos, desea continuar contando con ese apoyo, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además de gustarle su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 3,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos  para motos y motocarro al por mayor desde la ciudad de Lima a menores precios, para así tener mayores ganancias e incursionar en éste nuevo negocio.
texts.en: Giovani is 26 years old. He is a dynamic and enterprising young man. He really wants to get ahead. he is single and lives with his mother and two sisters, aged 18 and 16, in their mother's house. Giovani's activity is a motorcycle taxi service. For this he bought a second hand motorcycle car at a good price with a loan he received from MFP 2  year ago. Since then, he gets up very early to look for passengers in the city of Pucallpa every morning until noon. Later he studies at the university. What he likes about his activity is the income it generates to be able to help with the household expenses and pay for his studies. He also gets to know different areas throughout the city. What he doesn't like about his activity is when it rains, it becomes hard to get through the streets. He also has plans to go into another business, which is selling replacement parts for motorcycles wholesale. His customers would be the stores that sell replacement parts to friends and acquaintances. This would be loan number 4 with the MFP institution. He is grateful for the financial support in achieving his goals. That is why he is committed to making his payments as he did with the previous loans. In addition to liking his communal bank, he considers the members to be good people. With the 3,000 nuevos soles he has asked for, he will invest in buying replacement parts for motorcyles and motorcycle cars in Lima at lower prices. In this way, he will have more profit and can make inroads in this new business.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for motorcycles and motorcycle cars.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 40años, empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos yambal ya que vive solo y de esta manera sale adelante con sus hijos.

Trabaja sola todos los días sin horarios fijos, recorriendo las casas de los amigos, y familiares.
La delincuencia es el mayor problema que presenta en su trabajo. Es madre soltera quien trabaja muy duro para salir adelante con sus 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años que estudian en escuela fiscal.

Quiere seguir con su negocio por eso quiere el prestamo para comprar perfumes, cosmeticos. Su meta es poder seguir adelante con su negocio para de esta manera ascender en su trabajo y tener una oficina de trabajo y su propio carro.
texts.en:
Ana is 40. She started selling Yambal products, as she is on her own, and this is a way for her and her children to get ahead in life. She works on her own every day, without set hours, visiting the homes of friends and family members.  Crime is the greatest problem that arises in her work. 

She is a single mother who works very hard to move forward with her two children, ages eleven and nine, who go to high school. She wants to continue with her business, and that's why she wants the loan to buy perfumes, and cosmetics. 

Her goal is to be able to keep her business going, so that she can move up in her work, have an office, and her own car.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and lipsticks

loans.name: Freddy Fernando

texts.es:
Freddy de 21 años, empezó a trabajar como comerciante desde muy pequeños a los 13 años, con esfuerzos y con la ayuda de Dios pudo salir adelante.

Trabaja todos los días, realiza su trabajo solo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Su dificultad solo es la delincuencia. Está casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, y tiene un hijo de 9 meses quien es su propósito para seguir adelante con su trabajo.

Tiene muchas aspiracion con su ventas por eso quiere seguir vendiendo helados, ropa etc. Para mejorar sus ingresos el quiere comprar con el prestamo helados y ropa. Su meta es poder tener un negocio estable para sí poder darles un buen futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Freddy is 21. He started to work as a small businessman from an early age, at 13. With hard work and God's help, he managed to get ahead. 

He works every day, and carries out his work on his own, from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening.  His only challenge is the crime problem. He is married, and his wife does the household chores. They have a nine month-old son who is the reason he keeps working.

He has many ambitions for his business. That's why he wants to continue selling ice cream, clothing, and other things. To improve his income, he wants to use the loan to buy ice cream and clothing. His goal is to have a steady business, so that he can provide his family with a good future.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as ice cream and clothing.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: Blanca Azucena tiene 29 años, a pesar de ser muy joven ha logrado aprender las experiencias necesarias en este negocio. Ella tiene un hijo de cuatro años bajo su cargo, el cual le tiene que proveer alimento, vestimenta, educación y amor. Como toda madre responsable tiene que levantarse temprano para empezar la labor en su vivienda de cocinar, limpiar, lavar y dedicarle tiempo a su hijo, para después salir a realizar la venta de sus productos. Ella solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar calzado, cremas, ropa interior, sabanas, bolsos, cosméticos y ropa en general. Desea establecer su negocio en su vivienda pues así podrá brindarle a su hijo una mejor atención.
texts.en: Blanca Azucena is 29, even though she is very young she has the necessary experience for this business.  She has a four year old son under her care, she has to provide for him food, clothing, education and love.  Like every responsible mother she has to get up early to begin the day at home cooking, cleaning, doing laundry and spending time with her son, later she goes out to sell her products.  She requests a loan to buy shoes, lotions, underwear, sheets, handbags, cosmetics and other clothing.   She wishes to set up her business at home to provide more attention to her son.

loans.use: to buy shoes, lotions, underwear, sheets, handbags, cosmetics and other clothing.

loans.name: Iver

texts.es: El Joven Iver de 22 años soltero sin hijos, con ocupación principal agricultor, vive en la comunidad de Espejitos lugar donde nació y actualmente tiene cultivado maní y café. El Joven Iver solicita el crédito para el arado Manual, fumigado y cosecha de maní de su propiedad, en la cual también cría vacas, ovejas y chanchos, esta es su única actividad que le genera ingresos, en su tiempo libre piensa estudiar una carrera universitaria, es un joven responsable y trabajador con ganas de superación se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado  ya que le da un oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Young Iver is 22 years old.  He’s single, has no children and works as a farmer.  He lives in Espejitos, where he was born and has a peanut and coffee plantation.  Iver is asking for this loan to plow, fumigate, and harvest his peanut crop.  He also raises cattle, sheep, and pigs.  This is the only business that generates income.  He plans to study at the university in his spare time.  He is a hardworking, responsible young man with a desire to get ahead.  He is grateful to the institution for the support because it gives him the opportunity for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his peanut crop.

loans.name: Bertha Leonor

texts.es:
Doña Bertha sigue su labor de operador de equipo en el hospital, su esposo sigue trabajando de mecanica y su hijo estudiando english, para un futuro mejor. Para Bertha la economia de su pais, cada dia esta ah altos costos, lo que tiene que equilibrar bien sus gastos para poder balacearce.
Su objetivo es poder hacer mejoras a su casa, con el credito anterior era para hacer baño e inodoro, el cual comenzo pero no termino ya que no ajusto con los materiales,solo logro levantar una pared, la compra del inodoro, tubos para la tuberia, es por eso con este nuevo financiamiento podra hacer la construccion de ambas paredes, e instalar equipos para mejorar su higiene personal y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha continues working as an equipment operator in a hospital. Her husband continues working as a mechanic, and her child studies English to have a better future. 

Everyday expenses are very costly for Bertha due to the economy of the country. She has to carefully budget to be able to keep her expenses in balance. 

Her goal is to be able to make improvements to her house. Her previous loan was to install a bathroom and toilet. She started but did not finish since she did not adjust for the materials. 

She was only able to put up a wall and purchase the toilet and pipes for the plumbing. With the new loan, she will be able to complete the construction for the two walls and install equipment to improve her personal hygiene and that of her family.

loans.use: finalize the installation of a bathroom and toilet and achieve better hygiene for her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Daisy Paola

texts.es:
Daisy de 30 años, vende productos de uso personal, empezó con este negocio por recomendaciones de los vecinos, se dedico a aprender esta actividad y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Trabaja sola por las mañana vende en la escuela de los hijos y por las tarde pos su barrio. Sus dificultades son la falta de capital para invertir en mercadería, y la delincuencia del sector en el que vive. Está casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer de un taxi, tiene 3 hijos de 9, 8, y 7 que estudian en escuela particular.

Quiere comprar con el prestamo perfumes y cosmeticos para un mayor ingreso. Su meta es poder seguir adelante con su negocio para así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
30-year-old Daisy sells personal care products, and first started her business via referrals from her neighbors. She has been learning the business and thanks God that it has been a success.

Daisy sells her products at the children's school in the mornings and in her neighborhood in the afternoons. Her main challenges are the lack of capital available to invest in merchandise, and the crime level in the sector in which they live. She is married and her husband works as a taxi driver. They have three children aged seven, eight and nine who attend private school. 

With the loan, Daisy wants to buy more perfumes and cosmetics to achieve a higher income. Her goal is for her business to progress successfully so that she can help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and cosmetics for subsequent sale

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi is a 21-year-old woman living in the town of Asau.  She is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Emi owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting taro for sale. Emi has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Emi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emi is requesting a loan for the first time from SPBD. The loan of 1,000 WST will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. Emi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: David Felipe

texts.es: David es un emprendedor quien desde hace 12 haces lucha por sacar su negocio adelante, una legumbrería ubicada a las afueras de su casa, allí trabaja diariamente con la ilusión de mejorar las ventas e incrementar sus ingresos, actualmente David ve la necesidad de surtir más su negocio pues es conciente que comprando mas frutas, verduras y legumbres en general podrá obtener mejores utilidades, sin embargo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar dichas compras por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar la mercancía, posicionar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida notablemente.
texts.en: David is an entrpreneur who for the last 12 years has been determined to get ahead with his business, a vegetable stall located outside his house. He works there daily with the hope of improving sales and increasing his income. Currently David sees the need of stocking up his business more as he realizes that by buying more fruit, vegetables and legumes in general he will obtain better profits. However, he does not have enough capital to make such purchases which is why he is asking for a loan with which to buy the goods, positioning his business and substantially improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit and legumes in general to stock his business.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a 20-year-old woman living in the town of Asau. She is married and does not have any chlidren. To make a living, Lorena owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods to the local community.  Lorena has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Lorena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  This is the first time Lorna is requesting a loan from SPBD. She has asked for 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase an oven, utensils and food items to freeze including mutton flaps, chicken quarters, sausages and sacks of rice. 

Lorena plans to use the additional revenue that she will generate from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, utensils and food including mutton flaps, chicken quarters, sausages and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Venicio

texts.es: El señor Venicio nació en Valle grande,   hace 29 años que vive y trabaja agricultura, en villa florida distante a 20 km de el torno, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra: maíz, maní y camote, todo lo que el produce lo vende en el mismo lugar donde vive y trabaja ya que el vende sus productos directamente del productor al consumidor , el señor Venicio ya viene trabajando 6 secuencias con la institución, esta es su única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia, solicita el crédito para el arado Manual de la tierra compra de semillas para la siembre de maíz , fumigado y cosecha de maní el por lo cual se siente muy agradecidó por el apoyo que la institución le brinda para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Venicio was born in the Valle Grande. He has been living and working as a farmer for 29 years in Villa Florida, 20 kms from el Torno. He is a farmer and plants: corn, peanuts and sweet potatoes all of which he sells where he lives and works as he sells his products directly from producer to consumer. Señor Venicio has already had 6 loan cycles with the institution. This is his sole source of support for his family. He is asking for the loan to hand plough the land, buy corn seeds for planting, crop-spray and harvest the peanut crop. He is very grateful for the support that the institution is giving him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, spray and harvest the peanut crop.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: el señor Marcos nacido en Valle grande, convive con la Sra. Adela tienen tres hijos pequeños, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos, el vive  hace 37 años en la comunidad llamada Villa Florida a 20 km de el Torno,  el se dedica a la agricultura siembra: maíz, camote, y un poco de yuca para el consumo con su familia, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la siembra de Camote y la cosecha de maní, también se dedica a amansar caballos, el señor marcos hace 6 secuencias  que viene trabajando con emprender y esta muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza  que le han dado para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Marcos was born in the Valle Grande. He lives with Sra. Adela with whom he has 3 small children. His partner takes care of the children. He has lived for the last 37 years in Villa Florida, 20 kms from el Torno. He is a farmer who plants: corn, sweet potatoes and a little cassava for his own family's consumption. He will use the money from the loan to plant sweet potatoes and harvest peanuts. He also breaks in horses. Señor Marcos is in his 6th loan cycle with Emprender and is very grateful to the institution for the confidence placed in him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to plant sweet potatoes and harvest peanuts.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”HUCHUY QOSQO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Lamay en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Narciso;  El socio tiene 77 años de edad, El socio es casado, El socio tiene 4 hijos ya son independientes; el socio tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, el socio tiene terrenos de cultivo de maíz, papa, frejoles. El socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de semillas de maíz para sembrar. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de maíz para la siembra.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "HUCHUY QOSQO", which is in the district of Lamay in the province of Calca, department of Cusco.

Mr. Narciso is 77 years old, married and has four independent children.  His main source of income is agriculture and he owns land where he cultivates corn, potatoes and beans.  He is requesting a loan to buy corn seeds to plant.

He is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds for planting.

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Manuela sigue con su venta de tortilla, frijoles cocidos, el cual desde horas tempranas esta palmiando para lograr la clientela de la mañana, en este año ha sido dificil ya que su mama se le enfermo de presion, resultandoles azucar, lo que se complico y ayudo economicamente, desviando su prestamo, pero por una buena razon.
Hoy comenzara de nuevo este proyecto, al poder hacer una pared interna de su casa de concreto, logrando mejor seguridad, y privacidad para su familia, ya que la que tiene no es segura, y desea mejorar esta condicion, que sera de gran beneficio e higiene personal.
texts.en:
Doña Manuela continues to sell tortillas and cooked beans from the early hours of the morning, clapping out loud to attract the mornings customers. This year has been difficult as her mother became ill with blood pressure problems which resulted in high blood sugar levels which complicated matters and meant that she had to help financially. This meant that her loan was used for another but good reason.

Today she is starting the project again. Putting up concrete walls inside her house will improve safety and privacy for her family as what they currently have isn't safe and she wants to improve the situation. This will be of great benefit and also improve personal hygene.

loans.use: to build interior walls, for rooms, improving safety and privacy.

loans.name: Loida Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Loida Elizabeth, es una señora trabajadora que dia a día se dedica a su negocio  para darle una vida mejor a su familia, desde hace años ella a empezado su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa típica que lo realiza en el mercado municipal de su localidad en los días de mercado y también sale a vender a otros municipios en los días de mercado porque ella esta apoyando a su esposo para poder sacar adelante a su familia ya que están bajo su responsabilidad sus ocho hijos que necesitan el cuidado y el apoyo de sus padres, en los tiempos libres que ella tiene se dedica a elaborar tejidos típicos a mano para después venderlos, gracias a dios todo le ha salido bien y ahora necesita un capital para poder surtir mas su negocio con diferentes trajes típicos y obtener un poco mas de ganancia. en si el credito lo esta solicitando para compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
Loida Elizabeth is a hard-working woman who works at her business on a day to day basis in order to give her family a better life. Years ago she started her business buying and selling traditional clothes in her local town market on market days. She also goes to other municipalities to sell on their market days because she is supporting her husband in order to help her family get ahead. She has eight children under her responsibility who need the care and support of their parents. 

She spends her free time hand making traditional fabrics to later sell. Thanks be to God everything has worked out fine and she now needs a loan to be able to stock her business with different traditional costumes and obtain a little more profit. In itself she is requesting the loan to buy supplies to make traditional fabrics.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Karol Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Karol vive en la zona del plan 3000 en casa familiar. La Sra. Karol se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo,  los cuales vende al crédito y al contado ella vende de forma ambulante por diferentes barrios de la zona del plan 3000 Visitando oficinas centros comerciales, el crédito que esta solicitando es para aumentar su capital de trabajo para comprar mas productos cosmeticos por mayor,  ya que ha incrementado sus pedidos por esta época de fin de año. La Sra. Karol es una persona joven amable y trabajadora   con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por  el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Karol lives with her family in the Plan 3000 area.  She sells cosmetics by catalogue, working as a street vendor the in the different neighborhoods of the Plan 3000.  Her customers pay in cash or credit.  She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital so she can buy wholesale products to fill the orders for the holiday season.  Mrs. Karol is a kind young woman who is a hard worker and determined to get ahead.  She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: To buy wholesale cosmetics.

loans.name: Maelega

texts.en:
Maelega is a 57-year-old woman living in the town of Asau.  She is married and has ten adult children.  To make a living, Maelega owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Maelega has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Maelega joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1970 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Maelega is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and taro rhizomes (roots to start new taro plants).  The loan will be Maelega's fourth loan from SPBD.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and taro rhizomes.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está  ubicada en el caserío Santa Elena caserio ubicado a unos 25 km en la parte rural de este distrito, su padre lo apoya en las actividades que realiza existe una buena relación familiar.

La actividad que desarrolla Juan es la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, teniendo 10 cabezas y 12 pavos, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local a sus vecinos y comerciantes que llegan a la zona, además cuenta con 0.50 has de terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia donde tiene limón en producción, generándole ingresos semanales para cubrir sus obligaciones crediticias.

Juan desea comprar alimento balanceado para el engorde de su ganado.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.  Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo  y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 22 years old, single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in the rural community of Santa Elena which is about 25 kms from the same district.  His father helps him with his business and the family enjoys a good relationship.

Juan raises sheep and turkeys (he has 10 sheep and 12 turkeys) which he is fattening to sell at the local market to neighbors and merchants in the area.  He also has a half fanega of land that his father gave him where he grows lemons.  This generates a weekly income to cover his loan payments.

Juan wants to buy balanced feed for his livestock and has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  This investment will allow him to continue growing and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Koreta

texts.en:
Koreta is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Foailalo.  She is married and has five children.  To make a living, Koreta owns and operates a business raising crops.  While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Koreta has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Koreta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a loan of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  This will be Koreta's first loan from SPBD.  Koreta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”HUCHUY QOSQO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito D. Lamay en la provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Nicolasa;  La socia tiene 59 años D. edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 7 hijos los cuales todos son independientes; la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, la socia siembra frejoles, maíz, verduras; también cría junto a sus esposo vacas, toros, y animales menores, la socia tiene cuyes y gallinas. La socia venD. los cuyes pelados para los restaurantes turísticos entre otros, ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra D. 20 cuyes y 50 gallinas, la socia venD. las gallinas a las señoras que hacen en el mercado caldo D. gallina, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y siempre esta activa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. 50 gallinas y 20 cuyes. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas D. acuerdo al cronograma D. pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "HUCHUY QOSQO" which is located in the Lamay District in the province of Calca, department of Cusco.

Mrs. Nicolasa is 59, married and has seven children who are all independent.  Her main source of income is agriculture and she grows beans, corn, and vegetables.  She and her husband also raise cows, oxen and small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens.  She sells skinned guinea pigs to tourist restaurants.  She wants to use the loan to buy 20 guinea pigs and 50 hens.  The hens are sold to the women in the market who make broth.  The member is very hard-working and always active.  

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy 50 hens and 20 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 22-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga.  She is married and has one small child. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale. Rosa  has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 760 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Rosa  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  This is the first time Rosa has requested a loan from SPBD.  She has asked for 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Rosa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Sonia Alexandra

texts.es:
Sonia de 31 años, le gusta trabajar muy duro para así poder salir adelante con su familia, y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.

Trabaja sola como comerciante desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Se le dificultad al momento de salir a comprar mercadería para su venta ya que es muy lejos el lugar donde compra de su casa.

Está casada y tiene 4 hijos de 10, 9, 5 y 4 años que estudian en escuela fiscal. 

Su prestamo lo quiere para poder comprar cemento, arnea y bloques y asi mejorar su negocio y casa. Su meta es poder terminar de construir su casa para vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is 31 years old and enjoys working hard so her family can get ahead and she can help her husband cover household expenses.

She works alone as a merchant from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  Her greatest difficulty is having to go buy the items she sells because where she does her shopping is far away from home.

She is married and has four children, ages 10, 9, 5 and 4 who are in school.

Her loan will be used to buy cement, sand and blocks to improve her business and house.  Her goal is to finish building her house so the family has better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Patamea.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elisapeta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Elisapeta has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elisapeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. The previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Elisapeta is now requesting a second loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and gromozones (herbicide). Elisapeta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and gromozones (herbicide).

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Circuncicion sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Circuncicion sigue dedicándose a la venta de verduras y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. 

Circuncicion con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Circuncicion requiere el préstamo para comprar mas verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, tomates, cebollas y pepinos. 
 
Circuncicion se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Circuncicion is still participating in the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” [Enterprising Women] communal bank of the micro-lenind unit of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cuzco. Circuncicion still sells vegetables and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business. 

With the previous loan things went very well for Circuncicion and she really benefitted from it. That is why she wants another loan, because it really helps her.  

Circuncicion needs the loan to buy more vegetables such as carrots, tomatoes, onions and cucumbers. 
 
Circuncicion is grateful for the opportunity that has been offered in this way and she is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 22 years of age and married. She owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business. Susana needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Susana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Susana's first loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score". For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Aide

texts.es: La Sra. Aidé vive en la zona del plan 3000 en casa propia. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo  uno esta a su cargo ya que los demás son independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches y por el día vende asaditos, panza y refrescos. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus  nueras. El crédito que esta solicitando es para construir un techo vara la venta de comida ya que en esta época es de lluvia y no puede vender por las lluvias. La Sra. Aidé es una mujer muy trabajadora, es activa le gusta estar siempre haciendo algo, es amable y se siente muy feliz por el apoyo que le brinda para salir adelante y crecer en su negocio y por ende incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Aidé lives in the area of Plan 3000 in her own house. She has 4 children, of which only one is under her care, since the rest are independent. She sells food days and evenings. She sells grilled meat, tripe and soft drinks. She has the help of one of her daughters-in-law. The loan she is asking for is to build a roof for the place where she sells the food since it is rainy season and she can't sell anything. Aidé is a hard working woman. She is active and always likes to be doing something. She is friendly and happy with the support she has been given to get ahead and to grow her business, thus increasing  her income.

loans.use: to buy construction material for a roof for her business.

loans.name: Maimoaga

texts.en:
Maimoaga is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Sataua Tai.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children. Maimoaga owns and operates a business making and selling fried foods in the local community.  Maimoaga has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,200 WST a month from it.

In 2010, Maimoaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
