She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  Maimoaga is now requesting her second loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Maimoaga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters and french fries

loans.name: Faavale

texts.en:
Faavale is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Asau Vaovai. She is married and has no chlidren. Faavale owns and operates a business making and selling fried foods in the local community.  Faavale has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from it.

In 2010, Faavale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faavale has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD, which was used to invest in expanding the business.  Faavale is now requesting her second loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Faavale plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Maota

texts.en:
Maota is 67 years old and married with 3 children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Maota needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Maota joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Maota's 4th loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score". For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Rosario Regina

texts.es:
Rosario de 44 años, es cliente del banco D-miro desde su fundación y con la ayuda del banco pudo terminar de construir su casa y después estableció un negocio.

Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en su negocio. Está casado y su esposo trabaja como maestro constructor, y tiene 1 hijo de 17 años que estudian en colegio fiscal.

Tiene muchas aspiraciones de su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando y asi mejorar su estilo de vida con mayores ingresos a su familia. Su meta es poder comprar mas mercadería para así poder incrementar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario is 44 years old. She has been a client of the D-Miro bank since it was founded. With the bank's help, she was able to finish building her house and later she opened her business.   

Thankfully, she hasn't had any problems with her business. She is married and her husband works as a builder. She has one 17 year old who is in high school.  

She has many aspirations for her business and because of this she wants to keep working and thus improve her quality of life with more income for her family. Her goal is to be able to buy more merchandise to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, paper and picture frames

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is 61 years of age and married with 9 children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Lupe needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Lupe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lupe's 1st loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score". For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Gertrudis Alexandra

texts.es:
Doña Gertrudis, sigue en el comercio en venta de ropa y bisituria, el cual junto a su esposo, siguen esforzandose para una vivienda mejor, sus hijos estudiando. 
Gertrudis, con este nuevo financiamiento hara cambio de techo, comprara laminas de zinc, y perlines para reforzar mas el techo, el cual ira por parte con esta mejora, ya que los materiales esta ah altos costos, y su capacidad de pago es poca, es por tal razon ira por parte, hasta lograr el objetivo de una mejor vivienda, en donde no se le pase el agua en tiempo de invierno.
texts.en: Doña Gertrudis continues selling clothes and costume jewelry. Together with her husband, she continues to work hard for a better home and education for their children. With this new loan, Gertrudis will change the roof, buying zinc sheets and metal purlins to further reinforce the roof, which will go part way to making the improvements as building materials cost a lot and her ability to pay is small. This is the reason why she will make only part of the improvements until achieving her goal of an improved home without leaks for the winter.

loans.use: to change the roof and improve her home.

loans.name: Judith Estrellita

texts.es:
Judith de 24 años, trabaja vendiendo desayunos por la mañana y por la noche se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como hamburguesas, hot dog y salchipapas…etc. 

Trabaja solo desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días. Gracias a dios no ha tenido ningún problema con la delincuencia en su trabajo. Es soltera y no tiene hijos.

Tiene muachas aspiraciones con su restaurante por eso quiere comprar una cocina y cemento, arena para mejorar su local. Su meta es poder estudiar y así ser profesional, y con el tiempo hacer una familia feliz.
texts.en:
Judith is 24 years old. She works selling breakfasts mornings and nights she sells fast food such as hamburgers, hot dogs and sausage with french fries, etc.  

She works from 10 in the morning until 10 at night every day. Thankfully, she has had no problem with crime at her job. She is single and has no children. 

She has a lot of dreams for her restaurant and that is why she wants to buy a stove and cement and sand to improve her locale. Her goal is to be able to go to school and get a degree and in time have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a stove and do some repairs in her locale.

loans.name: Tepa

texts.en:
Tepa is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai. She is married and does not have any children. 

To make a living, Tepa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Tepa has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tepa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tepa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.
  
Tepa is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as snack food, candies, soft drinks, freezers and an extra refrigerator.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  

Tepa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as snack food, candies, soft drinks, freezers and an extra refrigerator

loans.name: Duo Carisma Group

texts.es: Doña Gabina, es una persona que se dedica a la elaboración D. tejidos típicos a mano y a la compra y venta D. leña desD. hace años ella se ha dedicado a estas actividades para poder  mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y darles lo necesario para vivir, ella quiere que sus  hijos puedan terminar sus estudios y poder tener una vidas mejor, por eso necesita un capital para engrandar mas su negocio y comprar mas  materia prima para sus tejidos,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos tipicos Doña Yolanda ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio D. venta D. ropa, y venta D. productos AVON, tiene bajo su responsabilidad  a su hijo menor D. edad que necesita el cuidado  D. ella, por eso ella necesita un capital porque el anhelo D. ella es tener mas variedad D. productos y tener un negocio  mas granD. para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gabina makes typical weavings by hand.  She also has been buying and selling firewood for years.  She has devoted herself to these business activities in order to be able to send her children to school and to give them the necessities of life.  She wants her children to be able to finish their education and be able to have better lives.  To do so she needs capital to expand her business and to buy raw material for her weavings.  She is requesting this loan to buy raw material to make typical weavings.

Yolanda has a small business selling clothes and Avon products.  She has a young child under her responsibility, and he needs her to care for him.  That is why she needs capital; her desire is to have a greater variety of products.  She also yearns to have a larger business in order to be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make weavings.

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en:
Vasati is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Fusi Safotulafai.  She is married and has 6 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Vasati owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  The main source of income from the business comes from planting and harvesting taro to sell. Vasati has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 800 WST per month from these activities.

In 2008, Vasati joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vasati has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.
 
Vasati is now requesting a new loan of 2,400 WST, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Vasati from SPBD. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto, de 53 años de edad divorciado con 4 hijos, ellos viven en la comunidad de Monterrico, del distrito de Sivia. Alberto es un gran hombre de mucho talento para los trabajos en el campo, pues a los 14 años ya contaba con una pequeña extensión de cultivo de café donde le dedicaba su tiempo con la finalidad de obtener los frutos luego comercializarlos y de esta manera obtener un ingreso económico con el que ya podían cubrir su alimentación y algunos gastos en su educación. Al pasar los años Alberto prosiguió con los trabajos dejando de lado los estudios por falta de recursos económicos, fue así que él único camino que le quedaba era trabajar en su parcela, seguir cultivando café que gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres puede en la actualidad producir una buena cantidad de granos de café. Generalmente trabaja solo, pero en épocas de cosecha siempre requiere del apoyo de los peones.
Alberto esta agradecido y contento por quienes en la actualidad es un buen agricultor, que gracias a ello viene logrando buena estabilidad económica que hace que el y sus queridos hijos puedan tener una vida digna. Este será  su primer credito con MFP,  por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Alberto, agradece a los integrantes de su banco comunal por desarrollar una buena labor juntos. Con los 1000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que limpien y saquen la maleza de su campo agrícola de café
texts.en:
Alberto is 53 years old, divorced with 4 children. They live in Monterrico in the district of Sivia. Alberto is a great man, very talented when it comes to farmwork as at the age of 14 he already had a small coffee-growing area where he spent his time with the final objective of obtaining the fruits and subsequently selling them and in this way obtaining an income with which to cover his food costs and some of his education expenses. Over the years Alberto continued with his farmwork setting aside his studies for a lack of economic resources. Thus the only option he had was to work his plot of land, continue growing coffee and, thanks to his parents' instruction, currently produce a large amount of coffee beans. Generally he works alone but at harvest time he always needs the help of manual labourers.

Alberto is grateful and happy for now being a good farmer as thanks to this he is managing to achieve economic stability which means that he and his 4 children can have a dignified life. This will be his first loan with MFP and he agrees to make the repayments on time.

Alberto is grateful to the members of his communal bank for developing a good working relationship together. With the 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) he will hire manual labourers to clear and remove the weeds from his coffee field.

loans.use: to employ manual labourers.

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline is 43 years old, married, and has six children.

Karoline owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro to sell.  She has many years of experience in this business.   Karoline needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Karoline joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Karoline's first loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university. 
 
About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Nestor Oswaldo

texts.es:
Néstor de 47 años, empezó a trabajar como costurero desde su niñez y desde entonces le ha gustado mucho esta actividad, trabaja en un local donde alquila por más de 9 años.

Trabaja solo todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en su negocio.

Esta separado de su esposa, pero tiene 3 hijos de 15, 8 y 6 años que estudian en instituciones fiscales. Quiere comprar con el prestamo telas, hilos para mejorar sus ingresos.  Su meta es poder establecer un local en su propia casa, para así trabajar cómodamente.
texts.en:
Néstor is 47 years old and started working as a tailor as a young child and since then has always enjoyed sewing. He has worked in rented premises for the last 9 years.

He works alone every day from 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. "Gracias a Dios" (thanks to God) he has not had any difficulties with his business.

He is separated from his wife but has 3 children, 15, 8 and 6 years of age who study in state schools. With the loan he wants to buy fabric and thread to improve his income. His goal is to establish a working area in his own house in order to work comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is 55 years old, married, and has nine children.

Makerita owns and operates a business venture, providing dressmaking services to local community members.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Makerita needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Makerita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Makerita's first loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.
  
About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Selepa

texts.en:
Selepa is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai. She is married and has two school-aged children.
  
To make a living, Selepa owns and operates a business venture raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Selepa has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 720 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Selepa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Selepa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  

Selepa is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones (herbicide). The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. 

 Selepa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones (herbicide).

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa pero actualmente se está dedicando a la elaboración de tejidos, ella teje chompas, chalinas, chalecos y otras cosas más. 

La socia con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca para elaborar sus tejidos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member continues to participate in the communal bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” of the Unidad de Micro Finanzas of the Asociación Arariwa belonging to the city of Cusco. 

The member previously sold clothes but currently she is focusing on weaving, knitting sweaters, scarves, vests and other things.

With the previous loan the member did very well and was able to obtain good benefits which is why she wants another loan as it helps her a lot.

The member wants the loan to buy alpaca wool to weave her garments.

The member is grateful for the opportunity afforded by this means and thus agrees to make her repayments on a timely basis.

loans.use: to weave her fabrics.

loans.name: Milton Eduardo

texts.es:
Milton de 41 años, empezó con esta actividad porque toda su niñez le ha gustado la carrera corte de cabello y confección y puso sus habilidad es este negocio, y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Su trabajo lo realiza de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, también se ayuda vendiendo cosméticos de belleza. Hasta ahora no ha tenido ningún problema ni de robos ni de salud. No esta casado y no tiene hijos.

Quiere el prestamo para poder comprar tintes y maquinas para cabello para su peluquería. Su meta es poder tener su propio local para asi no pagar arriendo, y poder establecer sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Milton is 41 years old and started this business because as a child he liked the hairdressing profession. He applied his skill in this area to set up his own business and "gracias a Dios" (thanks to God) he is doing very well. 

He works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening. He also supplements his income selling cosmetics and beauty products. So far he has not had any problems with thefts or his health. He is not married and has no children.

He wants the loan to buy hair dyes and machines for his hairdressing salon. His goal is to have his own locale so as not have to pay rent and be able to stabilize his income.

loans.use: to buy dyes and machines.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena de 41 de edad casado con Antonia de 46 años de edad, que fruto de este amor tienen 6 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Monterico del distrito ecológico de Sivia. Para filomena, el factor más relevante en la agricultura es “ sacrificio, y perseverancia continua”; desde luego que lo pone en practica en su diaria labor realizando los trabajos en su  parcela  agrícola, donde tiene plantas de cacao injertados exclusivamente para producción de yemas, que servirán como semillas para continuar su propagación en otras parcelas. Así ella se dedicará a expender yemas de cacao injertadas, ya que la mayoría de los vecinos de su localidad están empezando a sembrar más plantaciones de cacao pero hace falta unas yemas de garantía que resulte con una buena producción. Es por esta razón que ella empezó a implementar una parcela de cacao injerto. Pero conjuntamente  a ello se dedica  al cultivo de café orgánico y producción de cacao tradicional.
Ella esta contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le agrada desde muy pequeña, generalmente trabaja con su querido esposo quien es el apoyo constante en estas labores, quien lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Este será su tercer credito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete por tercera vez en cancelar su credito puntualmente así podrá garantizar para otros prestamos venideros. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que limpien su campo agrícola donde está instalado su cacao injerto.
texts.en:
Filomena, age 41, is married to 46 year old Antonio.  Their love has produced six children.  They live in their own house in the Monterico community in the ecological district of Sivia.  

To Filomena the most important thing about farming is “sacrifice and the perseverance to continue”.  She puts that into practice in her daily work on her plot of land.  She has cacao plants that are grafted in order to produce buds.  The buds will serve as seeds to continue propagation on other parcels of land.  

She will devote herself to selling the seeds from the cacao grafts.  She will do this because most of her neighbors are starting to plant more cacao, but they lack the grafts that guarantee a good production as a result.  That is why she started to establish a plot of land with grafted cacao.  She also grows organic coffee and produces regular cacao.

She is happy with the work she does because it has pleased her ever since she was very little.  She generally works with her beloved husband, who is her constant support in her work.  He does this in order improve the welfare of their family.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  For the third time she pledges to make her payments punctually.  That way she will be able to warrant future loans.  She will use the 1,000 soles to contract workers to clear the field where she has established her cacao grafts.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Alaviga

texts.en:
Alaviga is 36 years old and married with two kids.

Alaviga owns and operates a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Alaviga needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 Samoan talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Alaviga joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Alaviga's first loan with SPBD. 


*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Soteria

texts.en:
Soteria is a 21-year-old woman living in the town of Vailoa Palauli. She is married and does not have any chlidren. To make a living, Soteria owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Soteria has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately WST 800 a month from these activities.

In 2011, Soteria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Soteria is requesting a loan of WST 1,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be her first loan from SPBD. Soteria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Tutulu

texts.en:
Tutulu is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Fagamalo. She is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Tutulu owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Tutulu has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately WST 600 a month from these activities.

In 2011, Tutulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tutulu is requesting a loan of WST 1,000, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from SPBD. Tutulu plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, vive en casa propia que está ubicada en el caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco Alto del Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la  Región Piura a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.  El Caserío Hualtaco es un caserío mediano con deseos de superación.

La actividad que desarrolla Felipe es la Agricultura contando a la fecha con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón, el cual cosecha semanalmente.  Cosecha 8 bolsas de limón por semana, además cuenta con 8 cabezas de ganado con lo cual asume sus obligaciones familiares, su esposa cría aves de corral y lo apoya en las actividades que realiza, existe una buena relación familiar. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos personales y familiares. 

Felipe desea comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón y así poder obtener una mejor producción y por lo tanto logra un mejor precio de sus productos y seguir creciendo en su actividad. Para ello ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Felipe is 38 years old and lives with his partner and 3 children. He lives in his own house which is located in the village of El Porvenir Hualtaco Alto in the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the region of Piura, 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the departament of Lambayeque.  El Caserío Hualtaco is a medium sized village with a desire to excel.

Felipe is a farmer with so far 1.0 ha of agrictural land, planted with lemon trees which he harvests on a weekly basis. He harvests 8 bags of lemons a week and in addition has 8 heads of cattle with which he covers his family obligations. His partner breeds poultry and supports him in whatever he does. They have a good relationship. With the income he covers both his personal and family expenses.

Felipe wants to buy fertilizers for his lemon trees to thus obtain a better harvest and a better price for his produce and so continue to grow the business.
For now he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN).

loans.use: to buy fetilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel de 41 años de edad casado con María de 34 años de edad, fruto de este amor tiene 5 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Monterrico del distrito de Sivia. Manuel es un hombre que no se da  por vencido fácilmente, al contrario es cauto, primero los analiza luego le busca la solución exacta. Desde entonces cuando inicio su trabajo como agricultor, se dedico al cultivo de café, actualmente tiene extensiones de terreno y con las ganancias ayuda a sus 2 hijos que estudian en la universidad de huamanga, enviándoles dinero constantemente para sus gastos de alimentación y estudio.
Manuel está feliz por todo los logros que viene obteniendo pero él sabe que la fuerza ya se le va decayendo por la edad es por esta razón que ahora piensa en abrir una tienda de agroquímicos. Este será su tercer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles comprará una fumigadora y algunos insecticidas para eliminar la plaga de insectos que aquejan su cultivo de café
texts.en:
Manuel, age 41, is married to 34 year old María.  Their love has produced five children.  They live in their own house in the Monterrico community in the district of Sivia.  Manuel is a man who does not give up easily.  To the contrary, he is prudent.  First he analyzes, and then he looks for the exact solution.

Ever since he started his work as a farmer he has been growing coffee.  He currently has tracts of land.  With the income he helps his two children attend the University of Huamanga.  He continually sends them money for their food and educational expenses.

Manuel is happy about all of the profits he is getting.  However, he knows his strength is diminishing with age.  That is why he now plans to open an agrochemical store.

This will be his third loan with MFP.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  He will use the 1,000 soles to buy a fumigator and some insecticides to eliminate the pest infestation that afflict his coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy a fumigator and insecticides.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel, sigue en el comercio de chatarra, pues hasta ahora al comprar mas, sus ventas han sido exitosa, lo que ha tenido mas ingreso para los gastos de  estudios y salud para sus hijos.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara mas hierro, bronce, aluminio cobre, logrando cumplir la demanda con sus clientes, ya que la competencia es mucha, lo que esta sastifecho al poder invertir mas y crecer en su comercio. Comprando a un precio de costo bajo y los revende a costos altos, teniendo sus ganancias a mayor margen.
texts.en:
Miguel continues with his junk business.  So far he is buying more, and his sales have been successful.  He has had more income for his children’s educational and health expenses.

With this new loan he will buy more iron, bronze, aluminum, and copper.  Then he will be meeting his customers’ demand.  There is a lot of competition.  He is happy to be able to invest more and to grow in his business.  He buys at a low price, and he resells at a higher price.  Then he has a greater profit margin.

loans.use: to buy more iron, bronze, aluminum, and copper to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Randall Francisco

texts.es:
Randall es un señor de 27 años de edad el cual vive con su familia, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

El tiene la motivación y la ayuda de sus familiares, lo cual le facilita seguir con su vida. Además  le es muy importante adquirir este medio de transporte, ya que la demanda es cada vez más fuerte y los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado, ya que Randall es obrero de construcción.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Randall es un micro crédito de ¢596,000(quinientos noventa y seis mil colones), para comprar una motocicleta para movilizarse a su trabajo todos los días, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Randall es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Randall is a 27 year old man who lives with his family in Osa, which is located in Caña Blancal, in the province of Puntarenas. This area is known for being a rural zone much visited for its beaches. Its main economic activities are tourism and agriculture.

He has both the motivation and the support of his relatives which makes it easy to get on with life. In addition, it is very important to him to acquire this form of transport as the demand is getting stronger and the residents have been satisfied with the service provided, as Randall is a construction worker.

What Randall is currently asking for is a microloan of ¢596,000 (five hundred and ninety six thousand coronas) (CRC) to buy a motorcycle to get to work every day and to give the best possible service and support to his project.

Randall is a member of  the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, one of the 150 member organisations of EDESA in Coasta Rica. With this loan he hopes to grow on a personal and economic level. He also notes that thanks to these kinds of organisations and their loan facilities he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his work.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 45 años casado con Bernabé de 43 años con quien tiene 4 hijos, ellos viven en la comunidad de villa vista. María cuando apenas tenia sus 19 años se casó, y juntos decidieron dedicarse a la agricultura cultivando cacao y café en su parcela agrícola ubicado en la jurisdicción de su comunidad. Ambos trabajan de madrugada con mucho esmero con el deseo de poder educar a sus 3 queridos hijos. En la actualidad se están dedicando a la siembra de café donde todos los días están realizando gastos en el pago al personal que diariamente vienen laborando con la finalidad de culminar el sembrío muy rápidamente. Ella está contenta con esta labor que realiza, gracias a que ha obtenido un buen capital con ello y por tanto desea construir su vivienda. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles comprará cemento para realizar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: María is 45 years old, married to 43 year old Bernabé, and has four children.  They all live together in the Villa Vista community.  María married when she was barely 19 and together they decided to become farmers and raise cacao and coffee on a parcel of land in their community.  Both work from dawn with great enthusiasm and with a desire to move their three loving children ahead.  They’re currently raising coffee and are using all of their money to pay their field hands.  She’s happy about her work because she’s made good money and for now wants to build a home.  This will be her first loan through MFP and she’s committed to making her payments on time.  She will use the 2,500 PEN ($925) from this loan to buy cement to pour the floor for her home.

loans.use: to buy cement.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia sigue dedicándose a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y entre otros productos. 

La socia con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member continues to participate in the communal bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” in the Unidad de Micro Finanzas of the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Cusco. The member continues selling staple products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil among other products.

The member did very well with the previous loan and was able to obtain benefits and for this reason wants another loan as it helps her a lot. 

The member wants the loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale.

The member is grateful for the opportunity afforded her by this means and thus agrees to make her repayments on a timely basis.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo de 24 años de edad casado con Elva de 24 años de edad, fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Monterrico del distrito de Sivia. Adolfo es un joven con gran valor y lleno de fuerza para las labores agrícolas. Él recuerda cuando era un niño paso las inclemencias de la pobreza, por los problemas sociales que pasaba el Perú. Esto le sirvió para que él se hiciera fuerte y de frente a los problemas. En la actualidad se dedica al cultivo de café en las alturas de Sivia, donde tiene un excelente clima para éste producto, el café que produce es netamente orgánico que preparado es un delicioso producto, por lo que los grandes acopiadores prefieren comprar su granos por el buen aroma que tiene. Para que el café sea de calidad Adolfo realiza un buen manejo agronómico y dedicación con su cafetales. él está contento por las buenos adquisiciones que hizo gracias a las ventas de café, ahora cuenta con casa propia. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete otra vez en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos contratará peones para que limpien y saquen la maleza de su campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 24 years old, married to 24 year old Elva and they have a son.  They live in a home of their own, located in the Monterrico community of the Sivia district.  Alvo is a young, courageous man, full of energy for farming.  He recalls when he was poor as a child because of social problems in Peru.  This taught him how to be strong and confront problems.  At the moment he raises coffee in the mountains of Sivia, where the climate is excellent for this product.  He produces organic coffee, which is delicious when prepared, and large suppliers prefer to buy his beans because of their wonderful aroma.

Adolfo manages his plantation well and with great dedication, so that his coffee will be of good quality.  He is happy with the acquisitions he made, thanks to his coffee sales.  Now he has a home of his own.  This will be his third loan through MFP and once again he is committed to making his payments on time.  He will use the 1,000 PEN ($375) from this loan to hire field hands to clean and weed his fields.

loans.use: to hire field hands.

loans.name: Talalelei

texts.en:
Talalelei is a 62-year-old woman living in the town of Lalomalava. She is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Talalelei owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taamu for sale. Talalelei has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately WST 720 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Talalelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Talalelei has successfully repaid a previous loan of WST 1,000 from SPBD. This earlier loan was used to buy general farm supplies and equipment. Talalelei is now requesting a new loan of WST 1,500, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and Gromozone. This loan will be her fourth loan from SPBD. Talalelei plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa pero actualmente se está dedicando a la elaboración de tejidos, ella teje chompas, chalinas, chalecos y otras cosas más. 

La socia con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca para elaborar sus tejidos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The client continues participating in the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) communal bank with the micro finance unit of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

The client used to sell clothes, but she is currently devoting herself to knitting sweaters, scarves, vests, and other items.

Her previous loan went very well for her.  She was able to get good profits.  That is why she wishes to have another loan, which will help her a lot.

She needs the loan to buy alpaca wool in order to make her textiles.  The client is grateful for the opportunity provided to her, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool in order to make her textiles.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.

Desde hace tres años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales y venta de comidas.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción (ladrillos). 

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de cinco millares de ladrillos panderetas y ladrillos mecanizadas. En el negocio trabaja junto con su hermano, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Tacna.

La señora desea tener un negocio de servicio de internet ya que genera buenas ganancias.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Alida is a member of the “Brisas del Lago” (Lake Breezes) communal bank in the district, province and department of Puno.  She is 37 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a post high school education.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  She used her first loan for 300 soles to increase the capital in her business of selling handicrafts and food.  She currently sells construction materials (bricks).

She is requesting a new loan for 3,000 soles.  She will use the loan to buy five thousand bricks for walls and machine made bricks.  She works with her brother in the business.  He husband works in the city of Tacna.

She wishes to have an internet service business because it generates good income.

What she likes best about her communal bank are the easy terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy five thousand bricks for walls and machine made bricks.

loans.name: Seira

texts.en:
Seira is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Avao. She is married and has one infant. Seira owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Seira has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 720 WST a month from it.

In 2011, Seira joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Seira is requesting her first loan from SPBD, for 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Seira plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Ericka Yorleny

texts.es:
Yalaguina municipio de Estelí, es originaria Ericka de 30 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 3 años de edad. Ella nos cuenta que inicio su pulpería con sus ahorros de 2 años trabajando como conserje de una escuela primaria localizada en su comunidad, pues necesitaba un negocio que le permitiera generar mejores ingresos a su familia  y que mejor que una pulpería y al mismo tiempo que solventara muchas de las necesidades básicas de su comunidad pues no hay muchas pulperías cercas.  
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, aceite, maíz, papel higiénico, detergentes, jabones, desinfectantes, pan dulce y simple, avenas, enlatados y azúcar.  Con esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir por cantidad mayor estos productos y ofrecer algunos nuevos que antes no vendía por falta de capital. Una de sus próximas metas es reunir dinero para comprar y vender pollo, carne.
texts.en:
Ericka is originally from Yalaguina, in Estelí.  She’s 30 years old, has two children, ages 12 and 3, and works as a merchant.  She tells us that she started her general store with her savings of two years, working as a school counselor at the local elementary school.  She needed a business that would allow her to generate a better income for her family, and what better than a general store?  At the same time she could provide for the community’s needs because there are not many general stores nearby.

She needs this loan to buy basic grains, cooking oil, corn, bathroom tissue, detergents, soaps, disinfectants, sweet and basic bread, oatmeal, canned goods, and sugar.  This investment will help her to acquire these items in bulk and also to offer some new ones the she didn’t have before because of a lack of capital.  One of her next goals is to save money to be able to buy and sell chicken and meat.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ynes Yennyna

texts.es:
Ynes es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago” ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo a su cargo.  Tiene estudios de educación superior.

Desde hace un año y medio trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanía. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercaderías como: dos docenas de chompas, casacas y otros.  En el negocio le ayudan su hija y su mamá.

La señora desea tener una tienda grande donde pueda vender prendas de vestir para niños, adultos, etc.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el apoyo y la unión entre las socias
texts.en:
Ynes is a member of the “Brisas del Lago” (Lake Breezes) communal bank in the district, province and department of Puno.  She is 23 years old, single, and she has one child under her care.  She has a post high school eduction.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years.  She used her first loan of 300 soles to invest in her business of selling handicrafts.  She currently devotes herself to selling clothes.

With this new loan for 1,000 soles she will buy merchandise like two dozen sweaters, jackets, and other items.  Her daughter and her mother help her in the business.

She wishes to have a big store where she would be able to sell clothes for children and adults.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the support and the unity between the members.

loans.use: to buy two dozen sweaters and jackets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia sigue trabajando en la discoteca.  

La socia con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el gasto familiar. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para hacer mejoramiento de la casa. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The client continues participating in the Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank, of the mircrofinance unit of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She continues working in the discotheque.

The previous loan went very well for this client and she managed to benefit.  For this reason she wants another loan since it helps her a lot with family expenses.

The client needs the loan to make improvements to her house.

She is grateful for the opportunity this loan offers and so she is committed to making her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio es un señor de 51 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Tiene el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposa le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Eladio es un micro crédito de ¢596,000(quinientos noventa y seis mil colones), para compra de terneros, para mejorar su negocio y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Don Eladio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Eladio, 51, lives with his wife and children in a community called Osa, located in Caña Blancal in the province of Puntarenas.  This community is notable for being an area that receives a lot of visitors, due to its beaches.  The main economic activities here are tourism and agriculture.

Eladio has the support and help of his wife, and this makes it easier for him to continue with his business ventures.   In addition, he says that this business is very interesting, since he has seen it gradually grow, and the demand for his products is ever increasing because the neighbors in his community have been satisfied with the service he has provided.

At this time, Eladio is requesting a loan of 596,000 colones to buy calves.  This will improve his business and help him with his business plans.

Eladio is a member of the Caña Blancal communal bank, one of the 150 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica.  With this loan, he hopes to grow at the personal and financial level.  In addition, he notes that thanks to this type of organization which facilitates credit, he can spend more time doing productive activities.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Ruth Delia

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en la  provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene dos hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.

La señora Ruth trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde más de seis años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta y alquiler de vestidos.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará más vestidos, productos de belleza y accesorios.  También piensa comprar algunos adornos navideños.  

La señora sueña tener una empresa constructora y consultora.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo de la cuenta interna y las charlas educativas.
texts.en:
Ruth’s a member of the “Brisas del Lago” (Lake Breezes) communal bank located in Puno Province and Department.  She’s 33 years old, has a spouse and two children.  She completed higher education.

Ruth has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than six years.  Her first, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her grocery sales business.  She currently works renting and selling dresses.

She will use her new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy more dresses, beauty products and accessories; she also plans to buy some Christmas decorations.  She dreams with having a building contracting firm.  What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is the ease of the loan from the internal account and the educational talks.

loans.use: to buy dresses, beauty products, accessories, hooks and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Desiderio

texts.es: Desiderio de 29 años de edad convive con fortunita de 32 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada, en la comunidad de Monterrico del distrito de Sivia.  Para Desiderio en esta vida nada es imposible, ya que a pesar de que estuvo económicamente decaído, sacó a relucir su entusiasmo y fuerza para salir adelante. Él siempre  estuvo pendiente de su trabajo, por lo que para él “siempre hay algo que hacer” y eso lo convierte en una persona perseverante y digna de imitar. Aparte de tener su cultivo de cacao y café, también trabaja para otras personas como obrero en el campo, cuando está desocupado de su trabajo. De esa manera tiene un ingreso extra para su familia. Generalmente trabaja de manera independiente, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia, y la de sus peones en tiempos de cosecha para que lo puedan facilitar en la extracción de sus productos. Normalmente su producto los vende en su misma localidad a precio de mercado y sus ventas vienen mejorando de manera consecutiva. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su sembrio de café en un terreno virgen, con el propósito de cosechar mayores volúmenes de granos de café. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.  Con los 2,000 comprara más fertilizantes para aplicar a su cultivo.
texts.en:
Desiderio is 29 years old and lives with 32 year old Fortunita.  They have four children.  This family lives in a home of their own, located in Monterrico, within the Sivia district.  For Desiderio, nothing in life is impossible.  Despite the fact that he was financially broke, he renewed his enthusiasm and strength to get ahead.  He was always attentive to his work, because for him “There is always something to do,” and that makes him a person of perseverance and dignity to be emulated.

Besides having his crop of cacao and coffee, he also works as a farm laborer for others, whenever he doesn’t have work to do in his own fields.  In this way he has an extra income for his family.  He generally works independently, but sometimes his family helps him.  He also gets help from his field hands during harvest season.  He sells his products in the same area, at market prices, and his sales are improving consecutively.  His plans for the future are to expand his coffee plantings on a piece of virgin land, in order to harvest larger quantities of coffee beans.  This will be his second loan through MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time.  He will use the 2,000 PEN ($750) to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Paulina Vigilia

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene dos hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación secundaria.

La señora Paulina se dedica a la producción de chompas, chalinas, medias, etc, trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de tejidos.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de diez conos de lanas,  helios de diferentes colores, para su fabricación de prendas, en el negocio le ayuda su mamá.

La señora desea tener una maquina de tejer y tener un local propio para poder vender lanas al por mayor.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión, la puntualidad y la solidaridad
texts.en:
Paulina’s a member of the “Ahorro es Progreso” communal bank located in Puno Province and Department.  She’s 47 years old, single and has two children.  She attended secondary school.

Paulina makes sweaters, shawls, stockings, etc.  She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her first loan was in the amount of 300 new soles which she invested in her knitwear business.

She will request a new, 800 new sol, loan to buy ten cones of wool yarn and Helios thread [polyester] in various colors to make her items; her mother helps her in the business.

She would like to own a knitting machine and to have a place of her own to sell wool at wholesale.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the unity, the punctuality and the mutual support.

loans.use: to buy ten cones of yarn and thread in assorted colors.

loans.name: Rosa Marisol

texts.es:
R. tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, la casa está ubicada en el Caserío Cruz Verde en el Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque. R. vive en la parte rural  de este distrito pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

R. se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo para lo cual cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, las cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local a sus vecinos y comerciantes de la zona.  Su esposo es agricultor con 1.0 has de terreno agrícola en la cual tiene mango y limón en producción.  Con los ingresos que perciben de estas actividades logran cubrir sus gastos personales y familiares.

R. desea comprar más productos de belleza para vender a su clientela, quienes por estas fechas compran más de estos productos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 41, is married and has three children.  She lives in her own house with her husband and children.  The house is located in Caserío Cruz Verde, Tambogrande District which belongs to Piura Region and is four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque Department.  Rosa lives in the rural part of this district but she does have electricity.

Rosa sells beauty products via catalogue and has a well-established clientele in the zone.  She also raises barnyard fowl which she sells in the local market to her neighbors and local merchants when they reach ideal size and weight.  Her husband is a farmer with 1 hectare of farmland planted with mangoes and lemons.  Income from these activities allows them to cover personal and family expenses.

Rosa wants to buy more beauty products to sell to her customers who buy more of these products around these dates.  Because of this she’s thought it advisable to request a 500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia se sigue dedicando a la venta de ropa como por ejemplo pantalones, chompas, blusas y otras ropas más. 

La socia con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo pantalones y chompas. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The client continues participating in Mujeres Emprendedoras Communal Bank, of the microfinance unit of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She continues working selling clothing such as, for example, pants, sweaters, blouses, and other clothes.

The previous loan went very well for her and she managed to get good profits.  For this reason she wants another loan since it helps her a lot.

The client requires the loan to buy merchandise such as pants and sweaters.

She is grateful for the opportunity this loan offers and so she is committed to making the payments in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants and sweaters.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 66 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con tres hijos independientes, la señora estudio educación secundaria.

Trabaja hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que incremento en su negocio venta D. carne.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra D. cinco degollados D. carne ovino, también comprara leche, queso y huevo, la señora dice que venD. en el mercado D. ambulante.

La señora desea continuar en el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las ganancias D. ahorro y los incentivos.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a member of the Ahorro es Progreso communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Puno.  She is 66 years old and married, with three independent children.  She studied at the high-school level.

She has been working for four years with the Manuela Ramos movement.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 PEN, money that increased the sale of meat in her business.

She will request a new loan for the sum of 1000 PEN, money she will invest in buying five slaughtered sheep.  She also will buy milk, cheese, and eggs.  She says she sells in the market as a street vendor.

She wants to continue with her business.

What she likes most about her communal bank are the profits in savings and the incentives.

loans.use: to buy five slaughtered sheep, milk, cheese, and eggs.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: Nicanor de 33 años casado con julia de 33 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Monterrico del distrito de Sivia. Cuando Las necesidades se hicieron constantes en la vida de Nicanor desde el momento que contrajo matrimonio con su adorada julia ellos aún no contaban con ningún bien, menos tenían suficiente economía, es donde ambos decidieron trabajar con el único fin de ver crecer su estatus familiar, al principio trabajaron de peones en las tierras de cultivo de sus vecinos sembrando y cosechando café, que después de un tiempo tuvieron su primer hijo quien les lleno de satisfacción y las ganas de seguir trabajando con més entusiasmo. De un tiempo adquirió un pequeño capital que le sirvió para comprarse una pequeña parcela de terreno agrícola donde ahora se dedican juntamente con su esposa en el cultivo de café y árboles maderables, ellos están contento con los logros que vienen obteniendo. Este será su tercer credito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente su tercera cuota. Con los 500 nuevos soles Nicanor comprará abono orgánico para fertilizar su campo agrícola de café
texts.en: Nicanor is 33 years old, married with Julia, has three children, and they all live in their own home in the Monterrico community, Sivia district. When his needs became constant after marrying his beloved Julia they had no resources to count on. They did not have enough money either and decided to begin working in order to improve their family's conditions. First they began working as farmers in neighbor's crops sewing and growing coffee beans. Soon after, they had their first child who brought them much satisfaction and a stronger enthusiasm to continue working. At one time he was able to have the funds to buy a small plot of land where he and his wife now grow coffee beans and timber-yielding trees. They are happy with the achievements they are accomplishing. This will be their third loan with MFP with which he commits to punctually cancelling his third payment. Nicanor will use the 500 Peruvian Soles loan to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee bean crops.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 57 años de edad casado con Maura de 50 años de edad, fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos viven en la comunidad de Monterrico del distrito de Sivia. Samuel, es bueno y bondadoso pero de carácter fuerte para los retos, cuenta que hace un tiempo atrás recayó de salud donde descuido su trabajo, cuando ya recuperado regreso a sus labores vio que las maleza había invadido todo su campo agrícola, que por momentos pensó en dejarlo. Pero mas fue su entusiasmo, laboriosidad y amor a la agricultura que decidió empezar a quitar las malezas, juntamente con su querida esposa e hijos. Una vez que terminó de sacar toda la maleza de su cultivo de café empezó a fertilizarlos ya que el crecimiento de la maleza succionaron los nutrientes del suelo. Pero su salud aún es delicada, por ello ha decidio emprender otro nuevo giro de negocio que es la venta de abarrotes en su propia casa por lo que requiere un nuevo capital. Por tanto será su tercer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Samuel is 57 years old.  He’s married to 50 year old Maura, they have three children, and live in the Monterrico community within the Sivia district.  Samuel is a good, kind man, but with a strong character for meeting challenges.  He says that his health got bad some time ago and he paid less attention to his work.  When he recovered, he started working again and saw that so many weeds had invaded his farmland that at times he wanted to give them up.  But his enthusiasm, a desire to work, and a love for farming were greater and he had to begin removing the weeds, with the help of his loving wife and children.  Once he finished removing all the weeds from his crops, he started fertilizing them because the weeds had taken all the nutrition from the land.

His health is still delicate, so he decided to start another business; selling groceries out of his home.  This requires new capital.  He will use the 1,000 PEN ($375) from this loan to buy primary needs products to stock his store.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Niu

texts.en:
Niu is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Sili. She is single and has one infant. Niu owns and operates a business raising crops, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Niu has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 600 WST a month from it.

In 2011, Niu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Niu is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  This will be Niu's 1st loan from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es una joven de 22 años de edad el cual vive con su familia, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Tiene el apoyo y la ayuda de todos sus familiares, lo cual le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Karina es un micro crédito de ¢596,000(quinientos noventa y seis mil colones), para comprar pollos de granja, para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto. Y también de esta manera tener más ingresos económicos para sostener su núcleo familiar.

Doña Karina es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Karina is a young woman who is 22 years of age. She lives with her family in the community of Osa, which is located in Caña Blancal in Puntarenas Province. This community is known for being in a rural area with beaches that are frequented by many visitors. The main business activities are tourism and agriculture.

Karina has the support and assistance of her entire family, which makes it easier for her to continue her business. In addition, she says that her business is very interesting because she has seen her venture gradually grow. Demand gets stronger each time and her neighbors in the community are satisfied with the service she provides.

At the moment, Karina is requesting a microloan in the amount of 596,000 CRC in order to buy chickens. This will enable her to maintain her business in the best way possible. In addition, she will have more income to support her family.

Doña Karina is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Caña Blancal, one of the 150 organizations that are part of EDESA in Costa Rica. She hopes this loan will help her grow on both a personal and financial level. Karina also expresses her appreciation that these types of organizations and credit facilitators dedicate most of their time to productive activities.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Manino

texts.en:
Manino, a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Sili, is engaged and has nine grown children. To make a living, Manino plants and harvests taro for sale. Engaged in this business for over three years, she earns approximately 720 WST a month.

In 2010, Manino joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST that was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment, she is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones. Manino plans to use the additional revenue arising from the loan to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones.

loans.name: Faatafa

texts.en:
Faatafa is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Patamea. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Faatafa owns and operates an agriculture business. While not her only means for generating revenue, her business is based primarily on planting and harvesting taro to sell. Faatafa has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 1400 WST per month from these activities.

In 2008, Faatafa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1950 WST from SPBD, which she used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Faatafa is now requesting a new loan of 2450 WST, which she will use to purchase land to expand her taro plantation. This will be her fourth loan from SPBD. Faatafa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase land to expand her taro plantation.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Doris es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora se dedica  a la venta de comida, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde vende menú y otros platos típicos de la región. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Doris requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más.     

Doris agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Resourceful Women), a Communal Bank whose members meet every thirty days in the town of Cusco.

Doris is a resourceful and hardworking mother who engages in selling meals. She owns a small restaurant where she sells menus and other typical dishes of her region. She has been engages in this activity for a few years already, and things are going very well for her thanks to the dedication she works with.

In this occasion Doris is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as bags of sugar, bags of rice, noodles and oil among other articles.

Doris is thankful for and gives great value to the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her monthly dues.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, noodles and oil.

loans.name: Robertina

texts.es: Robertina, de 44 años,  una mujer  muy sencilla , vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Melecio, de 57 años y sus 03 queridos hijos Romeo de 16 años, Rafael de 14 años y Edgar de 11 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Robertina, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de frutas como plátano, palta, entre otros; con la ayuda de su esposo se van a la chacra de sus vecinos para que puedan comprar las frutas a un precio mínimo y llevarlas a vender a su pueblo, donde sus frutas son rápidamente vendidas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder animar a la gente que compre la fruta que produce en su localidad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus frutas hasta el pueblo, ya que corre el riesgo de que se puedan malograrse. Con el tiempo piensa en comprar frutas a mínimo precio ya que en su localidad se vende barato y vender en su pueblo a un precio que pueda solventar sus gastos. Este será su préstamo número 02 con MFP, por lo cual está muy contenta por la colaboración que le brindan. En su banco comunal trabaja responsablemente y se siente tranquila de poder trabajar con personas responsables. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar frutas como plátano y palta.
texts.en:
Robertina is 44 years old and a simple woman.  She lives in a home of her own with her husband, 57 year old Melecio, and her three children, 16 year old Romeo, 14 year old Rafael, and 11 year old Edgar, to whom she wants to provide a better future.
Robertina has been selling fruits and vegetables, such as bananas, and avocados, among other things.  With her husband’s help, they work in their neighbors’ fields so that they can share the fruits at lower prices, and take them to town where they are quickly sold.  What she enjoys most is to be able to motivate people to buy the fruits that she produces in her area.  She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her fruit to town because there’s a risk that they will get bruised.  She eventually wants to buy fruits in her area at lower prices, and sell them in town at prices that will allow her to cover her expenses.
