This will be her second loan though MFP.  She is grateful for their cooperation.  She feels safe and works responsibly with her communal bank, and is happy to be able to work with responsible people.  She will use the 1,000 PEN ($375) from this loan to buy fruits such as bananas and avocados.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Faafili

texts.en:
Faafili is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Papa Sataua. She is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Faafili owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not her only means of generating revenue, selling fried foods in the local community is her main source of income. Faafili has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 400 WST per month from these activities.

In 2011, Faafili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Faafili is requesting her first loan from SPBD in the amount of 1000 WST. She will use the loan to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products.  Faafili plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Teresa es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora se dedica  a la venta de ropa, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Teresa requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo pantalones y blusas. 

Teresa agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Resourceful Women), a Communal Bank whose members meet every thirty days in the town of Cusco.

Teresa is a resourceful and hardworking mother who engages in selling clothes. She owns a small stand in one of the most popular markets in Cusco. She has been engages in this activity for a few years already, and things are going very well for her thanks to the dedication she works with.

In this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy clothes such as trousers and blouses.

Teresa is thankful for and gives great value to the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her monthly dues.

loans.use: To buy items of clothing such as trousers or blouses.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es: Apolonia, de 33 años convive junto a Efraín, de 36 años; viven en su casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos Romari de 14 años y Nayeli de 06 años, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Apolonia, se levanta muy temprano para poder preparar  el desayuno de sus hijas y luego enviarlas al colegio. Luego y en compañía de su pareja se van a la chacra para poder ver sus plantas de cacao, ya que es el sustento de sus vidas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver a diario como va el avance de su cultivo para luego esperar la cosecha; lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mas difícil es no poder combatir con la plagas de insectos que lo aquejan. Con el crédito solicitado podrá hacer el mantenimiento respectivo de su chacra, comprará sacos de abono y con el resto contratará peones para ayudar a sacar la maleza y fertilizarla. Este será su préstamo numero 03 con MFP, por tanto espera su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos de trabajo. En su banco comunal es participe de las reuniones y se lleva bien con sus compañeros de su banco. Los 500 nuevos soles, invertirá comprando sacos de abono y contratará peones para que le ayuden a sacar la maleza y aplicar abono a su cultivo de cacao.
texts.en:
Apolonia is 33 years old and lives with 36 year old Efraín.  They live in their own home along with their two children, 14 year old Romari and 6 year old Nayeli, who are their reason for their efforts.  Apolonia arises early to make breakfast for her daughter and then send them to school.  Later, she and her husband go to the farm to check their cacao plants, since they provide their life’s sustainment.

What they most enjoy about their work is to be able to see the daily growth of their crops, then await the harvest.  She’s been doing this for five years and considers the most difficult part to be combatting the blights and insects that threaten them.

She will use the money from this loan to maintain the fields, buy sacks of fertilizer, and use the rest to hire field hands to help weed and apply fertilizer.  This will be her third loan through MFP and she awaits your cooperation to be able to continue her work objectives.  She participates in the meetings of her communal bank and she gets along well with her fellow members.  She will use the 500 PEN to buy sacks of fertilizer and hire field hands to weed and apply the fertilizer to her cacao crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire field hands.

loans.name: Letuaina

texts.en:
Letuaina is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Iva. She is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Letuaina owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is the harvesting of ocean-caught fish, which are sold in the local community. Letuaina has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 800 WST per month from these activities.

In 2010, Letuaina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation her and ability to engage in business activities.  Letuaina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which she used to purchase a canoe. She is now requesting her second loan of 1500 WST to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.  Letuaina plans to use the additional revenue generate  to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” y las reuniones de los socios del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Ruben es una padre emprendedor y trabajador que tiene una agencia de viajes donde brinda servicio de paquetes turísticos del valle sagrado de los incas, valle de sur del Cusco, visita a la ciudadela de Machupicchu y otras mas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Ruben requiere el préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos. 

Ruben agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ruben is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Resourceful Women), a Communal Bank whose members meet every thirty days in the town of Cusco.

Ruben is a resourceful and hardworking father who runs a travel agency where he sells package holidays to the Incan sacred valley, to the Cusco southern valley, guided tours of the town of Machupicchu and many others more. He has been engaged in this activity for a few years already, and things are going very well for him thanks to the dedication he works with.

In this occasion Ruben is requesting a loan to buy tourist coupons.

Ruben is thankful for and gives great value to the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his monthly dues.

loans.use: To buy tourist coupons.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 25 años es una mujer muy alegre, convive junto a Candel, de 29 años viven en su casa propia junto a su único hijo Luís, de 05 años quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Carmen ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Ella cultiva café, producto que posteriormente lleva a vender en su misma localidad, donde las vende al por mayor a sus compradores, quienes esperan sus cultivos debido a la buena calidad que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su chacra hasta su localidad, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea comprar fertilizantes y abono para hacer el mantenimiento de su cultivo y seguir obteniendo buenos productos de café. Este será su préstamo numero 02 con MFP y esta muy alegre por el apoyo financiero que le brindan ya que así puede cumplir con su trabajo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará  fertilizantes y abono para hacer el mantenimiento de su cultivo y  seguir obteniendo buenos productos de café.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 25 year old happy lady who lives with 29 year old Candel.  They live in a home of their own, together with their only son, five year old Luis, to whom they want to provide a better future.  With lots of effort, Carmen has been able to work her land and make it productive.  She raises coffee, a product that she later sells for greater prices to buyers in her area.  They wait for her products because of its good quality.  What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops, and she does it with great enthusiasm.  She’s been doing this for six years and she considers the most difficult part to be transporting the products from her farm to her location, because the sacks are heavy and they tire her out very much.  In the future she wants to buy fertilizer to maintain her crop and continue to produce good coffee products.

This will be second loan thorough MFP and she is happy about the financial support she is getting.  It will allow her to complete her work.  She will use the 1,500 PEN ($575) from this loan to buy fertilizer, maintain her crop, and continue to obtain good coffee products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y con 2 hijos, Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Juan Velasco Alvarado Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque. Milagros vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y  no cuenta con servicios básicos.

Milagros se dedica a la crianza de animales menores contando con 20 pavos, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local.  Asimismo cría gallinas.  Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura contando con 1,50 has de terreno agrícola el cual tiene limón que cosecha semanalmente, existe una buena relación familiar.

Milagros desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de aves y para realizar mejoras en el corral de los pavos y gallinas, esto con la finalidad de que logren un mejor peso y tamaño y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio en el mercado, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.  Para esto ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Milagros is 30 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. She lives in her own home in the village of Juan Velasco Alvarado in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Piura region and located four hours away from Chiclayo, the capital of the Department of Lambayeque. Milagros lives in the rural section of the district and does not receive basic services.

She raises small animals, which includes 20 turkeys. Milagros raises and fattens her animals before selling them at the local market. She also raises chickens. Her husband is a farmer who has 1.5 hectares of farmland for growing lemons, which are harvested on a weekly basis. They have a good family relationship.

Milagros wants to buy balanced feed for fattening her birds and to make improvements to the coops that house the turkeys and chickens. In the end, she wants her birds to reach a good size and weight so that they can be sold at the market for a good price. This investment will enable her to continue growing her business so that she can improve her quality of life. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced poultry feed and to make repairs to the coops.

loans.name: Eliecer Gerardo

texts.es:
Eliecer  tiene 45 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, la cual pertenece a la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace varios años que Eliecer quiere hacer unos cambios en su casa.

Actualmente Eliecer está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para  poder comprar materiales de construcción (cerámica, cemento y zinc), para asi arreglar la infraestructura de su hogar. Con esto el espera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ya que quiere estar más tranquilo, que sus hijos vivan más cómodos y tengan un techo digno.

Eliecer es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Francisco, una de las 150 organizaciones socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Eliecer is 45 years old and he lives with his wife and children in San Carlos, a community located in Alajuela, the second major province of Costa Rica. This area holds first place nationally for the production of coffee and sugar cane; basic grains (rice, beans, maize), fruit, pulses, tubers, and vegetables are also produced. Juan Santamaría International Airport, the most important of the country, is also located here.

Eliecer has desired making a few changes to his house for a few years.

Eliecer is currently asking for a loan of ¢500.000 (five-hundred thousand colones) to buy construction materials (ceramics, cement and zinc) to fix the structure of his house. He hopes that this will allow him to provide his family with a better standard of living: he wants to feel more at ease, and he wants his children to live more comfortably and have a proper roof on their heads.

Eliecer is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of San Francisco, one of the 150 member organization that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. He will keep on growing on a personal and economic level, and he will also keep on being an active participant in his local credit organization.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Foailuga. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ray owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means of generating revenue, her main source of income is selling fried foods in the local community.  Ray has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 600 WST per month from these activities.

In 2011, Ray joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ray is requesting her first loan from SPBD, in the amount of 1000 WST. She will use the loan to purchase freezers such as mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, foam cups and cooking utensils. Ray plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, foam cups and cooking utensils

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Kelly sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Kelly sigue dedicándose a la venta de cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, aretes, collares, pinta labios y otras cosas más. 

Kelly con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Kelly requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes. 
 
Kelly se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Kelly continues to participate in the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” communal bank of “Unidad de Micro finanzas” of the Arariwa Association in Cusco.  She continues selling cosmetics such as perfumes, earrings, necklaces, lipsticks, and other things.

The previous loan went well for her and she was able to get good benefits from it.  She would like another loan because it will be very helpful.  She needs this loan to buy more merchandise, such as perfume.

Kelly is very grateful for the opportunity given her through this medium and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Don Rodolfo de 38 años de edad,originario de Esteli,nos comparte su experiencia vivida atravez del prestamo Kiva, pues fue muy positivo el lo utilizo para sembrar frijoles las ganancias por la cosecha obtenida fueron buenas a pesar de las lluvias que pasaron. El esta muy agradecido por el apoyo recibido. Ahora el solicita un segundo credito para sembrar papas, comprar insumos, semillas y pago de mano de obra para sacar una cosecha con muy buena calidad y un producto que sea competitivo en el mercado y le permita darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Rodolfo is 38 years old and originally from Esteli.  He shares his experience with his first Kiva loan.  It was very positive and he used it to plant beans.  He got a good income from the harvest, even though the rains passed.  He is very grateful for the help he received and is asking for a second loan so that he can plant potatoes, buy supplies and seeds, and pay for labor so that he can have a quality harvest and a good product that will be competitive in the market.  This will allow him to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Andrea Aurora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San salvador en la provincia de Pisac y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Andrea;  La socia tiene 40 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 25, 18, 8 años de edad; la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, la socia siembra quiwicha, quinua, maíz, ella también se dedica  la crianza de animales menores, la socia compra y vende cuyes, gallinas; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para sembrar y en la compra de animales menores como aumentar las gallinas.
 
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR” communal bank, located in the San Salvador district of the Pisac province, within the Cusco department.

She’s 40 years old and has three children, ages 25, 18, and 8.  She’s a farmer who raises herbs, quinoa, and corn.  She also raises small animals and buys and sells Guinea pigs and chickens.  She is asking for this loan to invest in seeds and small animals, to increase her number of chickens.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para sembrar y en la compra de animales menores como aumentar las gallinas.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su  conviviente Justiniano de 39 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Domitila se dedica, es el cultivo de cacao y plátano. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. En adelante, espera contratar jornalero para que realicen el mantenimiento de sus productos como sacar la maleza y fertilizar sus cultivos, para obtener mejores ingresos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Con los 500 nuevos soles, contratará  jornalero para que realicen el mantenimiento de sus productos como sacar la maleza y fertilizar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Domitila is 30 years old and is a simple hardworking woman.  She lives in a home of her own with her husband, 39 year old Justiniano, and her three loving children, to whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  Domitilia raises cacao and bananas.  She gets up very early each morning and works her fields.  She knows that the money she gets for her harvest depends very much on the quality of her products.

What she likes the best is harvesting the land; the fruits of her many months of work.  She’s been doing this for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part to be fumigating her land.  She hopes to hire field hands to maintain her crops, including weeding and fertilizing them to obtain greater income.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very happy to know that she will have financial backing that will allow her to advance her work.  She will use the 500 PEN to hire field workers to maintain her crop, such as weeding and fertilizing.

loans.use: to hire field workers

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 25 años, es una mujer muy  trabajadora, convive junto a Pedro de 26 años y sus 02 hijos menores Britney de 07 años y Teddy de 05 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Irma comienza con el cuidado de sus tierras, ya que sabe que de la calidad de sus productos dependerán las ganancias que obtenga por su venta. Sus cultivos de cacao los lleva a vender en su misma localidad, ya que es donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha alegría, lleva 07 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su localidad, ya que los sacos son muy pesados. Con el crédito solicitado desea hacer el mantenimiento de su cultivo comprando abono y fertilizantes para que pueda obtener mejores resultados de su producción. Este será préstamo numero 02 con MFP, por tanto espera su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes de trabajo. Con los 500 nuevos soles, podrá realizar el mantenimiento de su cultivo comprando abono y fertilizantes para que pueda obtener mejores resultados de su producción.
texts.en:
Irma, 25, is a very hardworking woman living with Pedro, 26, and their two minor children, Britney, 7, and Teddy, 5, who she wants to provide a better quality of life for. Very early in the morning every day Irma starts caring for her fields because she knows that the quality of her products determines the profits she’ll earn when they are sold.  

She sells her cocoa bean crops in her same community because that’s where she gets the best prices.  What she likes best about her work is planting her fields, something she does with much joy.  She’s been doing this type of work for seven years and considers the most difficult part transporting her products from her field to the location because the sacks are very heavy.  

She intends to use the requested funds to provide care for her crops buying manure and fertilizer so that she can obtain the best results in her harvests.  This will be MFP loan #2 and she hopes to get your collaboration so that she can realize her work plans.  With the 500 new soles she’ll be able to care for her crops buying manure and fertilizer so that harvests will be the best possible.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San salvador en la provincia de Pisac y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Antonia;  La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 2 hijos de  18, 14 años de edad; la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, la socia también tiene su tienda en la cual vende chicha y cerveza, la socia también cría animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de cervezas para implementar su negocio.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR” communal bank, located in the San Salvador district of the Pisac province, within the Cusco department.

She’s 38 years old, single, and has two children, ages 18 and 14.  She farms and also has a store where she sells chicha (fermented corn drink) and beer.  She also raises small animals such as chickens and Guinea pigs.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more beer to stock her business.

She is grateful for this loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: Katiuska Antonieta

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Katiuska, ella tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela, el esposo es profesor de una escuela en Manta.
 
Ella además de trabajar como empleada publica también tiene un bazar en su casa, en el cual vende todo tipo de productos de bazar, como ropa, zapatos, tarjetas, peluches, entre otras cosas  y también realizan trabajos en serigrafías, bandas, cintas de reinas, entre otros trabajos. Por sus ocupaciones ella tiene a una chica que es la encargada de atender el local a quien le pagan un sueldo mensual por su trabajo. Su mercadería compra en Guayaquil y en Ambato, tienen más de 10 años con su negocio y que les va muy bien.

Este  crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, peluches y bisutería. Esta desde hace 11 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido aumentando su negocio. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso (Hope and Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and for its nationally and internationally known arts.  It’s also a place known for its famous straw hats.

Katiuska lives here, is 39 years old, married, and has two children, ages 10 and 8.  The children attend school and her husband is a teacher at a school in Manta.

Besides working as a public employee, she also has a shop in the home where she sells all types of products, such as clothing, shoes, cards, stuffed animals, among other things.  They also make silk-screens, sashes, and other things.  She has a young girl to whom she pays a monthly wage and who works in the shop and serves customers.  Katiuska buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and Ambato.  She’s had this business for more than ten years and things have gone well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, shoes, stuffed animals, and costume jewelry.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for 11 years and enjoys it because the loans have helped her to grow her business.

Her dreams are to move ahead with her business and personal life.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Elena De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Elena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde hace 10 años inicio su negocio con un balde de fresco actualmente tiene una refresquería con buenas condiciones; además comercializa cosméticos. Ella tiene dos hijos de 15 y 10 años quienes le ayudan en el negocio junto con su madre.
Elena con este crédito comprará ropa por la temporada de diciembre y su meta es crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking and enterprising lady who started her soft drink business with a single bucket ten years ago.  Now she has a well-kept refreshment stall and also sells cosmetics.  She has two children, ages 15 and 10, who help her in the business, along with her mother.

She will use the money from this store to buy seasonal clothing for December.  Her goal is to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San salvador en la provincia de Pisac y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Regina;  La socia tiene 43 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 4 hijos de  23, 22, 16, 10 años de edad; la socia compra al por mayor maíz amarillo seco y lo fermenta para elaborar la chicha de jora, la socia solo vende la jora  las diferentes picanterías o chicherías, ella lleva  a Pisac y otros poblados cerca para vender su jora. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz amarillo para preparar la jora.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Regina is a member of the ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR” communal bank, located in the San Salvador district, within the Pisac province and Cusco department.

She’s 43 years old, single and has 4 children, ages 23, 22, 16, and 10.  She buys dried yellow corn in bulk to make chicha (fermented corn drink).  She only sells to taverns or chicha bars.  She takes it to Pisac and other nearby towns to sell.  She is asking for this loan to invest in yellow corn to make chicha.

She appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz amarillo para preparar la jora.

loans.name: Rosi

texts.es: Rosi, de 31 años, es una mujer muy amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Ever de 25 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. La tienda de abarrotes de Rosi es una de las más concurridas en su localidad. El gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 04 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su pueblo. Este será su préstamo numero 02 con MFP y se siente muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le dan para continuar con su trabajo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá incrementar más productos para su negocio como: arroz, azúcar, conservas, fideos, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosi, 31, is a very kind woman living in her own house with Ever, 25, and their two beloved children that she wants to provide a better future for. 

Rosi’s grocery store is one of the busiest in her location.  Her pleasant personality and kind treatment have made her the favorite among her neighbors who don’t hesitate to make their purchases starting very early since they know that her store is the first to open and the last to close.

What she likes best about her work is chatting with her neighbors about what’s going on in town.  She’s been in business four years and considers the most difficult part having to stay inside her store all day because she has to stay open continuously so that sales don’t drop.  For later on, she hopes her business will grow and become her town’s main store.

This will be MFP loan #2 and she is very happy because of the financial support she’s getting to stay in business.  She will use the 2000 new soles to increase stock merchandise for the store like: rice, sugar, canned goods, noodles and milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Voaesea

texts.en:
Voaesea is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Falealupo Uta. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Voaesea owns and operates a tailoring business. While not her only means of generating revenue, her income comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Voaesea has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 840 WST per month from these activities.

In 2010, Voaesea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Voaesea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which she used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. Voaesea is now requesting her second loan, in the amount of 1500 WST,  to purchase a new sewing machine. Voaesea plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Toatele

texts.en:
Toatele is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Faala Palauli. She is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Toatele owns and operates a farming business. While not her only means of generating revenue, her income comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. Toatele has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1000 WST per month from these activities.

In 2010, Toatele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which she used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Toatele is now requesting her second loan, in the amount of 1400 WST, to purchase sacks of fertilizer and herbicide. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Marilis Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso que se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marilis, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno ya mayor de edad y dos de 15 y 12 años, todos estudian en Universidad el mayor y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es maestro de escuela.

Ella trabaja de maestra  en una escuela de la localidad, pero además de esto también se dedica al comercio, pues en sus ratos y días libres vende ropa de todo tipo, la mayoría de la mercadería la entrega bajo pedido que sus clientes le realizan con anticipación, ella vende a crédito  y cobra cada quince días, la mercadería que vende se la envían  desde Panamá, lleva con este negocio por más de 18 años y le va muy bien ya que la mercadería que vende es de muy buena calidad.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos y ropa de niños. Es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a bajos intereses.

Su sueño tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza y Progreso” (Hope and Progress) communal bank meets in Montecristi every two weeks.  The town is known for its rich culture and its pre-colonial artistry is known nationally and internationally.  It’s also known for its famous straw hats.

Here we meet Marilis. She’s 49 years old, married and has three children.  One is fully grown and the others are 15, and 12 years old.  The eldest attends university and the younger ones attend school.  Her husband is a school teacher.

She also works as a schoolteacher in town and has a clothing business and sells all types of clothing in her spare time.  Most of her sales are through orders that her customers place in advance.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  Her merchandise is shipped from Panama.  She’s been running this business for the past 18 years and things are going well for her because she sells good quality merchandise.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, and children’s clothing.  This will be her third cycle with the communal bank and she likes the quick loans with low interest rates. 
Her dream is to open her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe is a 61-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa Iuopapa. She is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Pepe raises crops. Her  income comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. Pepe has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 400 WST per month.

In 2011, Pepe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from SPBD, in the amount of 1000 WST, to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Pepe plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 19 años, es una joven muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Edilio de 19 años y su única hija Sully, quien es su principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Reyna abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos que le hacen falta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 01 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. En adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para poder vender más productos. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar con sus planes de trabajo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, invertirá comprando más productos para incrementar su negocio como: conservas, arroz, fideos, gaseosas, galletas, etc.
texts.en:
Reyna, 19, is a very kind, hardworking young woman living in her own house with her spouse, Edilio, 19, and her only daughter, Sully, who is the main motivating factor behind all her efforts.

Reyna opens her grocery store very early every day to take care of her neighbors.  She is a very skilled seller; she knows how to treat her customers and always convinces them to buy something extra.  Her store is very well-stocked because she always focuses on stocking whatever she needs.  What she enjoys the most about her work is chatting with her customers.  She’s been in business a year and considers the most difficult thing having to stay in the store all day without being able to go out.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store’s installations to sell more products.

This will be MFP loan #1 and she hopes for your support so that she can realize her work plans.  She will use the 1000 new soles to buy merchandise to increase stock inventory like: canned goods, rice, noodles, soft-drinks, cookies, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a Karina, tiene 26 años de edad está soltera y vive en la casa de los padres, ella tiene una niña de 7 años que es de una prima que falleció y la quiere como que si fuera de ella y estudia en escuela.

Ella es una joven muy trabajadora pues  para ganarse la vida y para que a su niña no le falte nada trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta. Con este crédito ella quiere empezar un negocio de venta de zapatillas, quiere empezar en esta época ya que se viene la época de Navidad y Año Nuevo y las ventas son muy buenas en esta temporada, ya tiene varios encargos que le han hecho sus amistades y conocidos.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para ir a Guayaquil y comprar zapatillas para la venta. Es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les da la institución. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso (Hope and Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi, known for its rich culture and pre-colonial art known nationally and internationally.  It’s also known for its famous straw hats.

Here we meet 26 year old Karina.  She’s single and lives with her parents and takes care of her seven year old niece since her mother passed away.  She loves her as if she were her own daughter.  She attends school.

She’s a very hardworking young lady who earns her own living so that her little girl wants for nothing.  She works in a factory in Manta and will use the money from this loan to start a shoe business.  She wants to begin this season, now that the Christmas and New Year season is approaching and sales are good during this season.  She already has some orders from friends and acquaintances.

She will use the money from this loan to travel to Guayaquil to buy shoes to sell.  This is her third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the help she gets from the institution.

Her dream is to continue moving forward with her business and personal life.

loans.use: to buy shoes for sale

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer, de 31 años vive en casa de sus padres junto a su pareja Yasmina de 23 años y su pequeña hija Angeli, a quien desea un mejor futuro. Hace 08 meses que Wilmer, empezó a trabajar como conductor para una empresa de taxis. Desde entonces, Wilmer se levanta muy temprano para poder ir a su trabajo, él hace transporte dentro de su localidad. Lo que mas le gusta de trabajo es llevar a la gente y conversar con los pasajeros sobre las experiencias que cada uno de ellos tienen. Con el tiempo desea abrir un cafetín en el colegio para que su pareja pueda trabajar junto a su pequeña hija y así ayudar con los gastos de su familia. Este será su préstamo número 04 con MFP; por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con su objetivo; asimismo se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. En su banco comunal es una persona responsable y solidario con sus compañeros. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, invertirá abriendo un cafetín en el colegio de su localidad y comprará productos como: galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, etc.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 31, lives in his parents’ house with his spouse, Yasmina, 23, and his little girl, Angeli, that he wants a better future for.  

Eight months ago Wilmer started working as a driver for a taxi company.  Since then, Wilmer rises very early to go to work; he provides transportation within his location.  What he likes best about his work is moving people and chatting with his passengers about the experiences each one of them has had.  In time, he wants to open a snack bar in a school so that his spouse can work near their little girl and help with household expenses.

This will be MFP loan #4 and he hopes he’ll get your cooperation to reach his goal; he promises to continue making his payments like he’s done with previous loans.  He is a responsible, supportive member of his communal bank.  He will use the 2000 new soles to open a snack bar at his local school.  He will buy merchandise like: cookies, candy, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San salvador en la provincia de Pisac y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Evangelina;  La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 6, 3 años de edad; la socia compra y vende animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, la socia también tiene terrenos de cultivo de quiwicha y maíz, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de 100 cuyes, ella actualmente tiene 200 cuyes y los venderá en dos semanas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Evangelia is a member of the ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR” communal bank, located in the San Salvador district in the Pisac province and Cusco department.

She’s 28 years old, married, and has two children, ages 6 and 3.  She buys and sells small livestock, such as Guinea pigs, and chickens, and has farmland where she raises herbs and corn.  She will use the money from this loan to buy 100 Guinea pigs; she currently has 200 and she will sell them in two weeks.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs.

loans.name: Liseth Katherine

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a Liseth, tiene 20 años de edad está soltera y vive en la casa de los padres, ella estudia en para licenciada en un Instituto de la localidad. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas  y organizadas.

Ella además de dedicarse a sus estudios también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, además de productos Yanbal y Esika (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, ella sale a recorrer por su localidad dos o tres días a la semana y en su centro de estudios vende todos los días que tiene clases, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva en este negocio dos años y su mercadería la comprar en Huaquillas.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos y ropa de niños. 

Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y ser profesional.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza y Progreso” (Hope and Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture, and its pre-Columbian art, known nationally and internationally.  It’s also known for its famous straw hats.

Here we meet Liseth.  She’s 20 years old, single, lives with her parents, and is a law student at a local law school.  This is her second cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because her fellow members are very reliable and organized.

Besides studying, she also sells all types of clothing and Yanbal and Esika products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, accessories, and other things).  She sells door to door and takes orders.  She works around her neighborhood two or three days a week, and around her school every day she has class.  She sells on credit and collects every week.  She’s been doing this for two weeks and buys her merchandise in Huaquillas.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, and children’s clothing.

Her dream is complete her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rosario Cecibel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora, Rosario  tiene 39 años de edad está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 16, 15, 12 y 9 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los  dos menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que en sus momentos libres se dedica al igual que su esposo al comercio, ella y su marido venden zapatillas, ropa de todo tipo e interiores. Mientras su marido se va a otras ciudades a  vender sus productos ella se dedica a realizar sus ventas por la localidad, ella vende puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, llevan más de 15 años dedicados a esta actividad y su mercadería la compran en Guayaquil ya que allá les sale más barato.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa,  ropa interior y zapatillas. Esta casi desde que se creó el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido de mucho para sacar adelante su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un almacén de ropa en el centro de la ciudad
texts.en:
The communal bank San Vicente meets bimonthly in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a city known for being very commercial, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo and for the friendliness of its people.  

Here we meet Señora Rosario.  She is 39 years old, married and has four children ages 16,15,12 and 9 from this relationship.  The two older children attend secondary school and the younger ones are in primary school.  Her husband is a merchant.  

She is a fabulous homemaker who, in her free time, also helps her husband with the business.  They sell shoes, all types of clothing and undergarments.  While her husband travels to other cities to sell his products, she stays in town to sell.  She sells door to door, extending credit and collecting every weekend.  They have been doing this for more than 15 years.  They buy their merchandise in Guayaquil as it is cheaper there.   

She will use this loan to buy clothing, undergarments and shoes.  She has been a member of the communal bank almost since the beginning and she likes it because the loans have really helped her to get ahead with her business.  
 
Her dream is to have a clothing store in the downtown area.

loans.use: purchase clothing, undergarments and shoes.

loans.name: Alicia Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Alicia, tiene 35 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 11 años que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres y estudia en una Universidad a distancia para licenciada en ciencias de la educación. 

Ella trabaja en una escuela de la localidad como maestra, además en la misma escuela en sociedad con su papá son los encargados del bar de la escuela en el cual venden bocadillos, jugos naturales y varios productos saludables para los niños que llegan a este centro de estudios.  También en su casa se dedica a la venta de tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Lleva 5 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y los créditos son de gran ayuda.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Vicente meets every 15 days in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a place that is known for its commercial activity, its traditional patron saint San Pedro and San Pablo festivities, and the happiness of its people.

Here we meet Alicia, 35, who is a single mother of an 11 year-old daughter who is in school.  She lives in her parent's house and is completing a degree in Education via distance learning.

She works in a local school as a teacher.  In addition, she and her father are in charge of a snack bar at the same school where they sell snacks, natural juices and a variety of healthy products for the children who come to the school.  She also has a business selling calling cards and cellular phone recharges from her house.  She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to buy groceries to make her food.  She has been with her communal bank for 8 years, and she likes it because her group is very close knit and the loans have been very helpful to her.

She dreams of finishing her education and becoming an accomplished professional.

loans.use: to buy food for her business

loans.name: Yobannis Vicente

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a don Yobannis, tiene 44 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos de 20, 18 y 3 años de edad, los dos menores aun viven en su casa uno de ellos estudia el último año de colegio. Su mujer es comerciante.

El para ganarse el sustento diario y el  de su familia se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y ropa interior, una vez por semana  se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a comprar la mercadería para luego trasladarse con la mercadería hasta Esmeraldas lugar donde realiza  sus ventas en forma informal o puerta a puerta, en esa ciudad se queda dos  a tres días o hasta que vende todo o la mayoría de su mercadería, lleva más de 15 años en este negocio y que le va muy bien ya que allá hay menos competencia para sus ventas.
p>
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa de todo tipo e interiores. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que le han brindado en el Banco para recibir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para ir a realizar sus recorridos
texts.en:
The communal bank San Vicente meets every 15 days in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place that is known for its commercial activity, its traditional patron saint (San Pedro and San Pablo) festivities, and the happiness of its people.

Here we meet Yobannis, 44, who is in a common-law marriage and has 3 children aged 20, 18 and 3.  The two youngest still live in his house, and one of them is in the last year of school.  His wife is a merchant.

In order to provide daily sustenance to his family, Yobannis has a business selling all types of clothing and undergarments.  Once a week he sets out toward the city of Guayaquil to buy the merchandise that he later brings back to Esmeraldas, the place where he makes his sales.  He sells on the street or door-to-door.  He stays in this city 2 or 3 days, until he has sold everything or at least most of his merchandise.  He has had this business for 15 years and it is going very well, since in Esmeraldas he faces less competition for his sales.

He will use this loan to buy all types of clothing and undergarments.  He has been in his communal bank for 5 loan cycles, and he appreciates having the opportunity to receive these loans. 

His dream is to have a car to get around with.

loans.use: to buy clothing and undergarments

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 31-year-old married woman with two children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Alicia has been growing and selling rice for ten years. She is able to support her family through her business.

Alicia has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future. She also hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a married woman with five children. She lives in the town of Trinidad in the province of Bohol with her family.

Demetria earns a living selling ready-to-wear clothes to her community. She sells mens and ladies shirts and jeans. Demetria is also a Natasha (a Filipino-owned direct sales company) dealer. She works hard to support her family.

Demetria has requested this loan to buy more items, such as shirts and jeans, to sell. She hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as shirts and jeans, to sell.

loans.name: Fátima Narcisa

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fátima,  tiene 52 años de edad está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y aún viven en su casa junto a sus respectivas familias. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo el cual se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo,  una vez por semana  se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a comprar la mercadería para luego con la misma trasladarse hasta la ciudad de Esmeraldas lugar donde realiza  sus ventas puerta a puerta, allá se queda dos  a tres días y luego regresa a su hogar, lleva más de 28 años en este negocio y en ocasiones ella lo acompaña en sus recorridos.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa de todo tipo  y ropa interior. Lleva más de cuatro años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que le han brindado para poder ayudar a su esposo con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The “San Vicente” communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.


We met Fátima here.  She’s 52 years old, married and has three children who are all now adults but still live at home with their respective families.  Her husband is a merchant.


She is a great housewife who is taking out the loan for her husband’s business.  He is a merchant; he sells all types of clothes.  Once a week he goes to the city of Guayaquil to buy merchandise to then take to the city of Esmeralda which is where he sells it door-to-door.  He stays there two or three days and then returns home.  He’s been in this business for more than 28 years and sometimes she accompanies him on his routes.


This loan will be used to buy all types of clothes and underwear.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because of the opportunity it’s given her to help her husband with the loans.  Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothes and underwear.

loans.name: Ramona Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ramona, tiene 56 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  seis hijos,  cinco de ellos mayores de edad y el menor de 11 años que  estudia el último año de escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella lava ropa ajena para ganarse la vida y además junto a su marido se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería, todos los días su marido sale a recorrer la ciudad vendiendo los billetes de lotería y ella de igual forma lo hace en sus momentos que está desocupada o en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local en el cual también vende sodas, aguas, bebidas y helados. Lleva con su negocio por más de 15 años y gracias a estos negocios sacaron adelante a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar detergentes, billetes de lotería, sodas y otras cosas que vende en su local. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “San Vicente” communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.


We met Ramona here.  She’s 56 years old, in a common law relationship and has six children; five of them are adults and the youngest who is 11 years old is attending the last grade of elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.


She takes in laundry to earn a living and with her husband she also sells lottery tickets.  Her husband goes out every day to walk the streets of the city selling lottery tickets and she does the same when she’s not otherwise occupied or at home where she has a small locale where she sells soft-drinks, water, beverages and ice-cream.  She’s been in business for more than 15 years and thanks to these businesses they raised their children to become upstanding citizens.


She will use this loan to buy detergent, lottery tickets, soft-drinks and other things she sells in her locale.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans have helped her very much in her business.  Her dream is to stay healthy to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy detergent, lottery tickets, soft-drinks,etc.

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en: Baasanjav is 59 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Hovsgol province of Mongolia. Her five kids are all employed and independent. She started her business in 1990 by selling garments from cart. Now she rents a counter in a market. Now that her kids are all employed and independent, she wants to expand her business by renting another counter in the market. However, she does not have enough in stock to supply the whole counter. Therefore, she is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It has been a wonderful journey to raise children. Now it's time to concentrate on my business."

loans.use: To buy supplies for her garment business.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a married woman from the town of Trinidad in the province of Bohol. She and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow crops of rice to sell. Prima does her best to improve their business and take care of their children.

Prima requested this loan to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. Prima hopes to have a bigger farm in the future. She also hopes to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Carmen Anabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 22 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos  5, 3 y 2 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en jardín de infantes. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en su negocio realiza el crédito, el vende productos de temporada ya que son los que más se venden, él tiene un puesto en el centro de la ciudad en el cual realiza sus ventas, llevan más de 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar manteles, focos y adornos navideños. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con estos  créditos ella ayuda a su esposo para salir adelante. 

Su sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “San Vicente” communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

We met Carmen here.  She’s 22 years old, in a common law relationship and has three children who are 5, 3 and 2 years old; the oldest attends Kindergarten.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good housewife who is taking out this loan to help with her husband’s business.  He sells seasonal items which are what sells the best.  He has a stand downtown where he carries out his sales.  He’s been in business for more than six years and he does very well.

She will use this loan to buy tablecloths, light bulbs and Christmas decorations.  She’s been in the communal bank two years and likes it because the loans help her husband get ahead.  Her dream is that her children never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, light bulbs and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en: Erdenebileg is 52 years old and lives with her husband in a Mongolian yurt and fence in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She has a four kids and they are all employed and live on their own. Her husband operates taxi service business. Erdenebileg operates meat trading business. She started her meat retailing business in 2000 by renting a counter in the market. She is very experienced on her field. She has many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to save up some supplies before prices hit their high point as they usually do. She is a sharp and hardworking women who says, "I have raised four children and I never had a chance to expand my business. Now that I have, I will concentrate on it. Also, we would like to purchase own house." She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more meat at whole sale price.

loans.use: To buy more meat.

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en:
61-year-old Pompia runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol.  She is married and has children.  Pompia sells items like oil, soy sauce, soft drinks and canned goods to her community.  She works hard to earn more and to be able to continue supporting her family.

Pompia is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, water, and canned goods.  Pompia hopes to expand her store in the future.  She also hopes that her children who still go to school will finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, water, and canned goods.

loans.name: Virginia Carolina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Virginia, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es guardián en una escuela de la localidad.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio,  vende sobrecamas, sabanas y ropa interior tanto de hombres como de mujeres, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días, tres días sale a recorrer y los otros días vende en su casa, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Ella empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco hace 15 años y  gracias a esto pudo ayudar a sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar sabanas y ropa interior. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo se ha mantenido y sus socias son muy cumplidas.
 
Su sueño es tener un local bien construido.
texts.en:
The “San Vicente” communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

We met Virginia here.  She’s 58 years old, married and has five children all of which are now adults but three of them still live with her.  Her husband is a watchman at a local school.

Besides being a great housewife, she’s also a merchant; she sells comforters, sheets and underwear for both men and women.  She sells door-to-door and also has a small home- based store.  She works every day.  Three days she goes out selling and the other days she sells at home.  She sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She started her business with the first loan she got from the bank 15 years ago and was able to raise her family with this.

She will use this loan to buy sheets and underwear.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the group has persisted and the members are very responsible.  Her dream is to have a well-built locale.

loans.use: to buy sheets and underwear.

loans.name: Oyunzul

texts.en:
Oyunzul is 44 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Dornod province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, and her son is a student. 

Oyunzul started her grocery shop business in 1997 by renting a counter in a market. Her customers are increasing rapidly due to the many buildings being constructed in the area. Therefore, Oyunzul is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "Now that my customers have increased, I believe it is my chance to expand my business."

loans.use: to buy more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Mirella Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mirella, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y aun no ha podido tener hijos, ella vive sola con su esposo el cual trabaja en un casino de la ciudad.
 
Ella para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y  para obtener algo por su propia cuenta hace tres años atrás puso en su casa un pequeño bar en el cual vende helados, golosinas, bocadillos, tarjetas y realiza recargas telefónicas, este negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco y poco a poco lo ha ido surtiendo aun mas, en él además de ganarse algo se entretiene y se olvida de tanta soledad.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar galletas, helados, caramelos, recargas y tarjetas telefónicas. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella puso su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un hijo para sentirse realizada como mujer.
texts.en:
The “San Vicente” communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

We met Mirella here.  She’s 43 years old, married and has not been able to have children yet.  She lives alone with her husband who works in a casino in the city.

To help her husband cover household expenses and to earn a bit on her own, she opened a small snack bar at home where she sells ice-cream, sweets, fast food snacks, phone cards and recharges.  She started the business with the first loan she got from the bank and gradually has been stocking it even more.  Aside from earning a bit from the business it also helps her to feel less alone and she can keep herself busy at it.

She will use this loan to buy cookies, ice-cream, candy, phone cards and recharges.  She’s been in the communal bank three years and likes it because thanks to the loans she was able to open her business.  Her dream is to have a child to feel fulfilled as a woman.

loans.use: to buy cookies, ice-cream, candy, phone cards and recharges.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 39 years old and is a married woman with five children, ages 8 to 19.

Victoria started her farming business five years ago. She tills her land to grow rice crops to sell. Victoria does her best to support her husband in providing for their needs and sending their children to school. 

Victoria has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. Victoria hopes for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with one child. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Maria primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns 4,000 PHP per month by farming. Maria works hard to take care of her family and help provide for their needs.

Maria has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies. Maria hopes for this loan to help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tsogt-Erdene

texts.en:
Tsogt-Erdene is 55 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife runs a grocery shop business, and his two children are employed and live independently. 

Tsogt-Erdene started his auto repair business in 2000 in his own garage. His business is fairly profitable. However, now that he's older, he wishes to expand his wife's grocery shop and work there. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I am getting old, and I am beginning to lose my skills and powers as a repairman. I need to do something less physical." He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to build an extension to the shop and buy supplies.

loans.use: to build an extension to his wife's shop and buy supplies.

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Enhjargal is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Govi-Altay, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. Her elder child is a college student, and the younger one is a student. 

Enhjargal started her grocery retailing business in 1998 by renting a counter. She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy supplies. She needs more supplies because she recently bought another counter. She wants to purchase supplies to save for the long winter before prices get too high. Enhjargal is a sharp and hardworking woman who says,"I need to do everything I can to pay my daughter's college fees."

loans.use: to buy more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Bonna

texts.en:
Bonna is 30 years old and is a married woman with a two-year-old child. She has had a sari-sari store business, or convenience store, for six months. Bonna sells items like bread, water, and canned goods. She earns 4,000 PHP per month with her business.

Bonna is requesting a loan to buy materials for store renovation, such as wood, cement, and nails. Bonna hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy materials for store renovation, such as wood, cement, and nails.

loans.name: Chimeddorj

texts.en: Chimeddorj lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan, Mongolia. His wife is employed, his eldest child is in school and the younger one is in kindergarden. Chimeddorj started his deel (Mongolian traditional clothes) sewing business in 2008 by taking a sewing class in the same year. His deels are very stylish and of high quality. He provides customized service and is a trusted supplier by many. With his profits, Chimeddorj has already bought his own ger. Due to his machinery, his work is slow and he is not meeting customer demand. Therefore, he is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 43 years old and is married with 6 children. Her children are between the ages of 11 and 23 years old. Evelyn's husband is a fisherman. Evelyn sells fish for a living, including dried fish, which she sells in her community. Evelyn does her best to support her family. She has requested this loan to buy salt and more fish to sell. Evelyn hopes her business will be successful.

loans.use: to buy salt and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Shirheeregvaa

texts.en: Shirheeregvaa is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his two kids are school students. He started his deel (Mongolian traditional clothes) sewing business in 2008.  His deels are very stylish and of high quality.  Shirheeregvaa provides customized service and is a trusted supplier to many. Now that winter is approaching, the demand for his products are increasing.   Therefore, he is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Mrs. Teng is a 41-year-old married woman who has five single children. She lives in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has spent most of her life cultivating rice crops alongside her husband for their livelihood. In the photo, she is shown standing at the side of her thatched house that is built for temporary living. Teng intends to rebuild it again and add zinc roofing. She has saved some money to start to rebuild her shelter, and now she would like to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva to supplement her capital to get it done. She hopes her family will get a comfortable living from her new house. She is thankful to all lenders.

loans.use: to supplement her capital to start to rebuild her shelter.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa is 63 years old and is married with children. She has a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. Generosa is able to help provide for her family through her business. She works hard to improve her business and earnings. Generosa plans to use her loan to repair her fishing boat and buy fishing materials. Generosa hopes for her business to succeed.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat and buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is 29 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan, Mongolia. Her husband sells firewood and coal, and her son is a kindergarden student. She started her mongolian traditional boot making business in 2008. She learned to make shoes from her father and her shoes are stylish and the quality is excellent. Over the years, she has become a trusted supplier to many. Due to a lack of equipment and raw materials, Uranchimeg is not meeting her customer's demands. Therefore, she is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to buy equipment. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I am happy that I can continue my father's work. I think my business has a bright future and I'll do everything I can to make that possible".

loans.use: to buy equipment for her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with three children. She is 29 years old and resides at Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
