Conchita owns and operates a vegetable farm, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month she earns 7,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Conchita has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Conchita wants to make improvements to her house and to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Gezardo

texts.en: Gezardo is a 42-year-old married man with one child. He is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. Aside from fishing, Gezardo also is a seaweed farmer. He works hard to support his family and save for his child's future education. Gezardo has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and seaweed farming materials. He also plans to register his wife to be an Avon dealer. Gezardo hopes to earn more and be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and seaweed farming materials.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is kind and patient man who lives in Estefania with his family. He enjoys his work in his farming business though he encounters some hardships in maintaining his cornfield, especially when drought or flood occurs. He plants and harvests corn and sells it to traders in the village. 

In order to keep producing good harvests, Danilo is now asking for a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use to maintain good crop standing. He would like to use this to earn more income.

He has four children that attend school, and he aims to keep producing good output for their college education.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use to maintain good crop standing

loans.name: Yieng

texts.en: Mr. Yieng is a 43-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and five children in the Ang Snoul area of Cambodia. When younger, he was a soldier but now earns about $3 a day. One of his sons helps support the family by working at a job where he earns $90 a month. Yieng is applying for a loan from Kiva and HKL to buy a second-hand motorcycle for his son to use when commuting to and from work. In the future, Yieng hopes to open a store where his wife can sell groceries to people who live in their area.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for his son to use when commuting to work.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by running a shop where she sells lotions, milk and candies. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso is 52 years old, and is married with two children. He is from Cavinte, Ozamis City. 

Narciso has been farming for 20 years and he earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month.

In 2011, Narciso joined GDMPC for the ability to engage in business activities and to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation. Narciso is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy powdered milk, beverages, and powdered juices.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband works as a farmer. Gloria earns a living buying and selling seaweed. She said she can earn as much as 16,000 PHP per month with this business. Gloria works hard to send her children to school. She requested this loan to buy more seaweed to sell. Gloria hopes her business will prosper. She also hopes to venture into other kinds of business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and to pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

loans.name: Tuvshinbayar

texts.en: Tuvshinbayar is 37 years old and lives with his mother, wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul, Mongolia. His mother is a retired woman who stays at home, his wife runs a small second-hand clothing shop and his daughter is a kindergarden student. He started his taxi service business in 2009 using his own car. Due to his lack of finances, he bought an old rusty car. Now his car is giving him a lot of technical problems and customers are avoiding using his service for that reason. Tuvshinbayar is requesting MNT2,438,000 to buy a new car. He has already found a buyer of an old car. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "My business is slowing down rapidly and I have to do something."

loans.use: to buy a new car for his taxi service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman having one child. Maricel is 29 years old, residing at Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.

Maricel owns and operates a gardening plot, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 6,800 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Maricel has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She wants to make improvements to her house and to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en:
Benigno has been raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn, for almost 15 years. Benigno is very proud to be a farmer. With his farming business, he can provide a good education for his three children. He has nine children in all but the others have settled into marriage and live separately from him. 

As of now, he lacks funds to sustain his cornfield. Profits earned from the last crop was used for his family's expenses in meals, tuition fees, and paying credits from traders. Benigno is now asking for a loan of 35,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

In the future, Benigno would like to make his crop more productive for additional profits and someday improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children.

Carmencita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles, and spices. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and spices.

Carmencita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and spices.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en:
Sergelen is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. One of her kids is a school student and the other two kids are in college. Sergelen has a meat retailing business that her husband helps with. 

Sergelen started the business in 2001 by renting a counter in the market. Her income has been about the same since she started the business. Because she has many regular customers and trusted suppliers, she rented another counter in the market. She needs more supplies in order to run another counter, therefore she is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy them. 

She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My two kids are in college, therefore I need to act aggressively in order to pay their college fees."

loans.use: To buy meat for her butcher stall.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Letecia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Letecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Falealupo Uta. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sala owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for this business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. Sala has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 720 WST a month.

In 2010, Sala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sala has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Sala is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and herbicides. Sala plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa. She is married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eseta owns and operates an agriculture business, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell. Eseta has been in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month.

In 2011, Eseta  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to continue her business activities. Eseta is requesting a first-time loan from SPBD of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, such as a new fence. Eseta  plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, such as a new fence.

loans.name: Haydie

texts.en: Haydie is 35 years old and is married with 7 children. The oldest child is 19 years old. Haydie and her husband have been running a fishing business for 19 years. This business provides for their needs and helps send their children to school. Haydie  requested this loan to purchase a boat engine and nylon. She does her best to take care of her family and improve their income. Haydie hopes to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine and nylon.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Maria Fe has a food shop that sells hard-boiled duck eggs, known as balot. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of duck eggs for making balot.

Maria Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Fe  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of duck eggs for making balot.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 36 years old, married, with 5 children, and 4 of them are in school. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 20 years, Analyn has been in  the agricultural business, raising pigs. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs. She has previously borrowed 16 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sosoli

texts.en:
Sosoli is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa Iuopapa. She is single and does not have any children. To make a living, Sosoli owns and operates a business venture, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community. Sosoli has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2011, Sosoli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her business. Sosoli is requesting a first-time loan from SPBD of 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase cooking utensils and an oven for her business. Sosoli plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils and an oven.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is a single mother of three who lives with her mother and kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her mother is a retired woman who stays home. The elder two kids are school students and the youngest is a kindergarten student. 

Oyunchimeg started a garment retailing business in 2009 by selling garments to the rural area shops. Now that she has run her business for a quite a while, she is a trusted supplier of many shops. However, her supply is not quite enough for all of her customers. She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more supplies.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her garment retailing business.

loans.name: Joyceryn

texts.en:
Joyceryn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Joyceryn has a shop that sells electronic loads (pre-paid cell phone credits) from several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of electronic loads for resale.

Joyceryn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joyceryn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of electronic loads for resale.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines with his wife and five children. For the last five years, he has earned a living by running a shop where he sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to his customers.  He joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: En

texts.en: Mrs. En is 25 years old and lives in Baray with her husband and child, who attends school. She cares for her home and also helps her husband raise pigs. Her husband supplements his income as a pig farmer by also working as a goldsmith in a booth in a local market. Mrs. En is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy some raw materials to support in her husband’s business. Her goal for the future is to open up a small jewelry shop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's jewelry-making business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 49 years old and married with 6 children. Lucy works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 3 years, as well as earning an income from rice retail.

Lucy has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like groceries and shampoo, in her sari-sari store. Lucy has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Lucy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items such as groceries and shampoo to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Love Joy

texts.en: Love Joy is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by running a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Lilibeth runs a general store, selling a variety of food items and household goods in the local community. Lilibeth has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Lilibeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and/or to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en: Enhtur is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and both children are school students. He began his carpentry business in 2009 by working at home. He now has his own small workshop. He works primarily on small projects like wooden souvenirs and door handles. His business has been increasing steadily. However, since he is the only one generating revenue in the family, the income is not sufficient. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to buy equipment and raw materials.

loans.use: To buy equipment and raw materials.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with four children. 

Analy has a shop that sells canned goods, eggs and beverages.  She has been in business for five years.  She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, eggs and beverages.

Analy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Analy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs and beverages.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with three children. 

Gemma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has been in business for 10 years.  She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Reynante

texts.en:
Reynante is 23 years old and single. He was unable to pursue a college education due to financial problems. He is a responsible son and, in order to help his parents earn a living, he began farming.  For the past four years, he has cultivated a hectare of land, planting and harvesting corn to sell to traders.

Reynante hires additional laborers to help him cultivate the field and plant corn seeds. Because this is an additional expense for him, Reynante is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for land cultivation and buy corn seeds to grow. He hopes this loan will be granted to him, as it is his only hope to improve the yield of his cornfield.

Though he did not finish his education, Reynante hopes to help his family live comfortably by increasing his corn production.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy corn seeds to grow.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Gemma has a shop that sells detergent, canned goods, and spices. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy spices, detergent, and canned goods to sell.

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, detergent, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Amaan

texts.en:
Amaan is 25 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife is a clerk and his son is a kindergarten student. 

Amaan started his transportation business in early 2010, using his own vehicle, transporting between cities. His business income is enough to support his family. However, his vehicle is now having problems and it needs to be serviced. Amaan is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to service his vehicle. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I'm having a crisis. My engine is giving me problems and it could shut down at any time."

loans.use: To service his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergent, and beverages

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with eight children. She is 44 years old, residing at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Josephine owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month she earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements to her house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yellow and green bananas

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru: Галина давно пользуется кредитами, т.к. это удобно и быстро. Предыдущий кредит был использован для закупки купальников к летнему сезону. В данный момент нужны дополнительные средства для закупки более дорогого товара - шапок с натуральным мехом. Подобный товар достаточно редкий на данном рынке, поэтому у Галины мало конкурентов и много клиентов, что делает ее бизнес успешным.
texts.en: Galina has been using the KIVA loans for a while since they are convenient and fast. She used her last loan to purchase a batch of swimsuits for the summer season. Currently Galina needs additional money to purchase a batch of a more expensive accessory - hats from natural fur. This clothing item is rarely sold at the local market and as a result Galina will have very little competition and a lot of clients, which will make this venture very successful.

loans.use: to purchase winter hats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Nuevo Caribe Group

texts.es:
Doña Leticia es la Tesorera de Banco Mujer Nuevo Caribe, una mujer muy trabajadora, microempresaria exitosa, pero sobre todo una madre abnegada, tiene 3 hijos, una niña de 11, y gemelos de 13 años, uno de ellos con Parálisis Cerebral, y que por su discapacidad física y mental requiere de cuidado y ayuda total; Ella es madre jefa de hogar, no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de los hijos, pero eso no le ha impedido salir adelante, y especialmente darle todos los cuidados especiales que su hijo necesita. Sus otros 2 hijos son su principal apoyo a pesar de su corta edad  y conforman un verdadero equipo que unidos buscan el bienestar familiar y principalmente brindarle a su hermano todo el amor y las atenciones que necesita. 
Doña Leticia se debe levantar muy temprano todos los días, para poder atender a su hijo, preparar la comida de los que se van a la escuela, hacer la labores domesticas, y para cuando ellos regresan de estudiar, poder salir a vender sus productos por toda la comunidad. Ella comercializa ropa, lencería, perfumes, cosméticos y otros productos, que gracias al préstamo de Fundación Mujer va a poder  invertir en más mercadería a para la temporada navideña. 
Esta mujer  tan luchadora tiene sus metas bien definidas, y piensa lograrlas a mediano plazo, tales como; tener su propia tienda en la casa, pero sin dejar de vender productos en forma ambulante, además de comprarse un automóvil, para que le sea más fácil trasladarse a vender su mercadería  así como llevar a su hijo al doctor y otras terapias que son indispensables para él, y lo más importante darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, principalmente a su hijo con discapacidad. 
Junto a Leticia están en el grupo 7 señoras más, todas muy emprendedoras,  con deseos de salir adelante  y que desarrollan actividades comerciales y de pequeña industria.
texts.en:
Leticia is Treasurer of the “Mujer Nuevo Caribe” communal bank; she’s a very hard working woman and successful micro businesswoman.  But, above all, she’s a self-sacrificing mother.  She has three children, a girl, 11, and twin, 13-year-old boys one of which has cerebral palsy and because of his physical and mental disability requires care and total help.  She is mother and head of household; she does not get any help from her children’s father but this has not kept her from getting ahead nor especially has kept her from providing her son with all the special care he needs.  Her other two children are her greatest support system despite their young age; they form a true team united for their family’s wellbeing primarily to provide their brother with all the love and attention he needs.

Leticia must rise very early every morning to tend to her son, prepare meals for those that are heading to school, to do her household chores so that when they return home from school she can go out into the community to sell her products.  She sells clothes, lingerie, perfume, cosmetics and other products which thanks to her loan from Fundación Mujer she will be able to invest in more merchandise for the Christmas season.

This very determined woman has her goals very well defined and she intends to reach them in reasonable time.  Among them are: having her own home-based store while continuing to sell her products door to door; to buy a car so that it will be easier for her to move from place to place to sell her merchandise as well as to take her son to the doctor and other therapies that are indispensable for him and, the most important thing, to give her children a better quality of life, especially to her disabled son.

There are seven more members with Leticia who are all very enterprising and who wish to get ahead; they carry out commercial and small industry activities.

loans.use: to buy clothes, lingerie, perfume, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
A very responsible and loving father, Joselito is from the village of Maluno Norte. He is 52 years old. Joselito is married with three grown children. Joselito is a farmer. His main source of income is from planting and harvesting corn.

Joselito has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately P 10,000 a month. Joselito is requesting a loan of P 15,000 which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve and expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sleepers, canned goods and detergents to sell.

loans.name: Rino

texts.en:
Rino is 29 years old and lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. He has had this business for 5 months. Rino earns about 10,000 PHP from this business.

Rino requested this loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. Rino hopes to have a stable business. He also hopes to continue supporting his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon, 42, is a married woman who lives in Kompong Cham province. She has three children, one of whom is already married. Farming is her livelihood and she typically earns about $2.50 per day. One of her children contributes to the family’s income by selling sweet iced drinks with syrup near her house. This business is doing well. She wants to expand it gradually. 

Mrs. Phon would like to request some funds from Kiva’s lenders to purchase a sugar cane squeezing machine for her daughter to provide natural soft drinks and satisfy her customers. She is thankful to all lenders who continually help in this business.

loans.use: to purchase a sugar cane squeezing machine.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo is married with four children. He grows corn. Rodrigo wants to expand his business and ensure a good return for his children. His wife and children help him in his business. Rodrigo is asking for a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and pesticides for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
Melinde is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Melinde has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more stock.
Melinde has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Melinde hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Jeana has a shop where she sells snacks, bread and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more stock.
Jeana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jeana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, bread and beverages.

loans.name: Desiderio

texts.en:
Desiderio pours out all his strength on his farm to make it profitable every harvest season. He had been raising crops on his 1.5-hectare rice field for almost 20 years and earns P30,000 every six months. According to him, it is just enough to pay for tuition fees for his four children. Two of them are in college while the rest are getting their high school education.

Desiderio aims to improve his corn production to provide for all their needs so he is asking for a loan of P45,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides. 

In the future, Desiderio would like to have good finances and enable his family to live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир постоянно пользуется кредитами, так как считает кредитование удобным способом пополнения оборотных средств. В данный момент ему нужно закупить пуховики, куртки на синтепоне, зимние кроссовки.

Предыдущий кредит помог Владимиру расширить ассортимент товара, приобрести новых покупателей и получить дополнительную прибыль. Владимир любит садоводчество, поэтому он тратит часть полученных денег на закупку новых деревьев и кустарников, которые он высаживает возле своего дома.

Владимир в 2003 году купил магазин, в котором сейчас торгует, и начал продавать табак для кальянов и трубок, сигары, сигареты, а также дорогие вина и коньяки. А потом через год, перепрофилировал магазин на спортивную одежду.
texts.en:
Vladimir regularly uses the KIVA loans as this is a handy way to supplement his businesses' cash flow. Currently he needs to purchase a batch of down lined and other insulated winter jackets as well as winter sneakers. 

Vladimir's last credit has helped him to expand his store's inventory and attract new clients, resulting in higher profits. Vladimir loves gardening so he has spent some of the earnings to purchase new trees and bushes to plant in front of his house. 

In 2003 Vladimir purchased a store where he is selling tobacco for water pipes and pipes, as well as cigars, cigarettes and expensive wines and liquors. After a year he has changed the focus of the store to sell sport clothes instead.

loans.use: to purchase warm jackets and sneakers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en: Romulo is 55 years old. He is married with three children. He has been a farmer for ten years. He has agricultural lands where he grows different types of corn. He needs a loan of P 30,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer. He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.en:
Maria Reyna is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Maria Reyna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Maria Reyna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Reyna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is married and is a loving father of four children. He is smart and purposeful man. He has been growing agricultural crops for more than eight years. He has two hectares of land where he grows corn. He also raises livestock; at this time he has two heads of pig. Martin plans to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds for sowing. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for this purpose. He is thankful in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for sowing for his farm

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара пользуется кредитными услугами "Надежды Украины" почти 10 лет; за это время сложились хорошие отношения, которыми она дорожит, так как ей нравятся условия кредитования и обслуживание. В этот раз Тамаре нужен кредит, чтобы закупить женскую верхнюю одежду - куртки и пальто. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Тамара получила дополнительную прибыль и приобрела новую бытовую технику для дома.
texts.en: Tamara has been using the lender "Hope Ukraine" almost 10 years; during this time they have developed a good collaboration that Tamara treasures, since she really likes the conditions of the loans and the customer service. This time Tamara wants to take out a loan to purchase women's winter clothing - jackets and coats. Thanks to her past loans Tamara has been able to ear additional profits and has purchased new appliances for her home.

loans.use: to purchase women's winter coats and jackets

loans.name: Koisun

texts.ru: Койсун 45 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей, младшей из которых шесть лет. Койсун работает продавщицей в местном магазине, а также подрабатывает санитаркой в больнице, получая примерно 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В 1996 году, в поисках средств к существованию для своей семьи, Койсун начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и перепродаже сельхоз продукции. Койсун использовала стартовую сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, и сумела развить свое хозяйство, с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Койсун обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Койсун планирует увеличивать поголовье  скота.
texts.en: Koisun is 45 years old, married and has four children, the youngest of whom is six years old.  Koisun works as a salesperson at a local store and also works part-time as an orderly at a hospital, earning about 5,000 som (KGS) per month.  In search of means of survival for her family, she started her own business of breeding livestock and reselling agricultural crops in 1996.  Koisun used an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and was able to grow her business to have a monthly profit of about 5,000 som (KGS) now.  In order to further develop her business, Koisun requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase heifers.  In the near future, she plans to increase livestock headcount with the help of the profit from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is married and has two children. 

Francisco is a specialist in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock. In order to support his family, he works on the land and grows corn. He also owns cattle and pig. After harvesting corn, it is smart to use the waste to feed livestock. Francisco wants to obtain this loan amounting to 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer and corn seeds for sowing. He hopes to get this loan and promises to use it accordingly.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Gerel

texts.en: Gerel is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and and his two children are school students. He started his deel (Mongolian traditional clothes) sewing business in 2009. He is a trusted supplier to many shops. However, due to the machinery, his work is slow. Therefore, he is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy sewing machinery. Gerel is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "My business is going well; however, my work is very slow and I'm beginning to lose customers."

loans.use: to buy sewing machinery.

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Mrs. Meach, 51, is a local farmer who cultivates rice and vegetable crops from the Kompong Speu province. She has been engaged in this business since 2000. She and her husband work on the same project. This couple is blessed with seven children. All of them are single and some are working to make a better living. 

With this loan, Mrs. Meach will use the money to buy a pumping machine to provide enough water to her vegetable crops. In this case, she will be able to grow more crops and expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine to provide enough water to her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr. Battulga, 40 runs a newspaper-and-magazine kiosk nearby a crowded market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling these for 5 years non-stop and initially had made his kiosk by himself with iron plates. There are 7 people in his family including his wife and his 5 children, all of whom attend secondary school. His wife has no job and the earnings from the newspaper sales are the main income source of the family. His daily earnings are about USD 30-35 for a whole day and they do not always meet his family's necessities. Therefore, Battulga decided to run another business selling sawdust briquettes at his home entrance/ doorstep. In Mongolia, one of the biggest issues is air pollution from coal fuel usage in every household, especially in the capital city of Ulaanbaatar.  
At first, he needs to build up his business working capital/ inventory of sawdust briquettes. The loan he is taking out will be used to purchase sawdust briquettes for smokeless fuel usage by his clients. It is very useful and important to reduce the spreading of air pollution around the city.

loans.use: To purchase sawdust briquettes for smokeless fuel usage by his clients.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a responsible woman who helps Roque, her husband, in their farming business. They go down to the field every day to ensure they cultivate good crops. She has been in this business for nearly 10 years. Rice farming is the family's primary source of income. Though she encounters some problems in her farming business, especially during a flood season, she still aims to overcome these trials to provide for the needs of her family. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides for farming. 

Through her patience and perseverance, she believes she will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Chimeddorj

texts.en:
Mr. Chimeddorj, 27, is a fireman in the security service of the airport in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been in his job for five years, and his monthly salary usually does not meet his family's necessities. He is unmarried and lives with his father and his two younger sisters. 

They live in a house that was built in early part of 1970. Lately it has became old and difficult to live in because it has been damaged in its all parts such as the roof, walls and internal decoration. He is planning to make insulation in its wall at first due to the cold and heat loss during the wintertime. It is important to warm his house and to reduce further smoky coal usage. Also, he will buy an electric furnace for his house heating. According to his plan, the smoky coal usage of his family will be stopped after these renovations at his home. 

The loan he is taking will be used to purchase the building materials to make adjustments to his house and purchase the electric furnace for smokeless heating.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials to make adjustments to his house and purchase the electric furnace for smokeless heating.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж занимается бизнесом, а сын находится на заработках в России. Сама Гавхар занимается торговлей свадебной национальной одежды. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Gavhar is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  She is 48 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is involved in business, and her son is in Russia for work.  Gavhar in involved in selling national wedding clothing.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 42 years old and has three children, all of whom attend school. Valentina's family members are happy despite poverty. To generate an income, Valentina and her spouse grow rice. After working for five years in this business, they now earn at least 20,000 PHP each harvest season. 

Valentina is now asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides to be used for farming. Profits earned from the last crop were used for tuition fees and electric bills, so this planting season she now lacks the necessary funds to maintain her rice field. Valentina also prays that no calamities such as a typhoon will come to their area. This would highly affect her ability to produce crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to be used for farming.

loans.name: Kayum

texts.ru: Каюм житель района Кумсангир. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. Кредит берет для покупки минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Kayum is a resident of the Qumsangir district.  He is 38 years old, married and has four children.  He has been involved in agriculture for over 15 years.  Kayum is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun is a married woman who has two small children. She and her family live in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She is a local rice cultivator and she is also skillful in making objects from clay. However, currently she makes only cookers because more people need those than any other object she makes. After she makes the clay cookers, her husband is the one who transports the products to sell them in commercial marketplaces. Together, they are able to yield an income of approximately $5 per day. 

Now Mrs. Chhun is taking out this loan from HKL in order to replace some broken parts of her plowing machine. In the future, Mrs. Chhun hopes to grow her business and upgrade her standard of living. Moreover, she plans to send her two children to school next year.

loans.use: to replace some broken parts of her plowing machine.

loans.name: Balbin

texts.en:
Balbin is married with two grown-up children. He is from the village of Carikkikan. Balbin is very dedicated to his work, most especially to his farm business. He has managed a farm for ten years. This is the main source of their income. His spouse helps him manage the farm. 

Balbin is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer for his farm. In the future, Balbin is planning to expanding his farm to provide a nice living condition for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure, for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her raised pigs

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La is a married mother of 6 and she is 51 years old.

La owns & operates a business venture, selling lavalavas ("bottom-half" skirt-like wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has many years of experience in this business. La needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, La joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is La's 1st loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 49 лет. Он женат, у него семеро детей. Его жена работает в школе уборщицей. Сам Хаким занимается выращиванием овощей. В этой области она шестнадцать лет. Целью получения кредита является покупка семян для посева картошки.
texts.en: Hakim lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 49 years old, married and has seven children.  His wife works as a janitor at a school.  Hakim is involved in growing vegetables.  He has been in this business for sixteen years.  The goal of obtaining this loan is to purchase seeds for sowing potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena is married and she's 46 years old with 1 child.

Matalena owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro (a tuber) for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Matalena needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxone.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Matalena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Matalena's 1st loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Razia Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Razia bibi is a 44-year-old, kind, and responsible woman. She supports her husband financially with her embroidery business. She loves doing her work. She likes to create new things in it and keeps herself updated about the latest trends in fashion.  

She crafts beautiful embroidered dresses on-order which helps her to attract more customers. She utilizes the income she earns to manage the household expenses.  

She is the mother of six children and all of them are getting an education. 

Her husband’s economic mainstay is selling hosiery items. He has very good salesman qualities. He sells the hosiery items (socks, panties, caps, etc.) to his customers at reasonable rates. His sales become especially increased in the winter season. 

Razia bibi is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Her husband intends to use this loan to purchase hosiery items in larger quantities for reselling. 

She is very sure that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business and allows him to increase his sales in this winter season as well.

loans.use: To buy hosiery items for reselling

loans.name: Faatagi

texts.en:
Faatagi is 60 years old and married with 8 children.

Faatagi owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro (a tuber) for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Faatagi needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxone.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Faatagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faatagi's 1st loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD."

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, 38, lives with his family in the village of Carikrikan, where he conducts the family's farming activities. Christopher grows agricultural crops, such as rice, on the family-owned 2-hectare plot of land.
Christopher is now requesting a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase fertilizer for his farm. He plans to save earned income to purchase furniture for the house, as the family currently has very little.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for his farm.

loans.name: Penelope

texts.en:
Penelope is 38 years old, married and has five children.

Penelope owns and operates a business driving a taxi. She has many years of experience in this business. Penelope needs a loan of WST 1,000 to maintain her vehicle. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 500 or USD 208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Penelope joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Penelope's first loan with SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is 49 years old. She is a member of An Tap cluster. She has three children. Not only does she grow rice, she also grows sprouted beans to sell in the market. She has had this job for two years. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time, she borrowed VND 8,288,000 and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 9,184,000 to buy beans.

loans.use: to buy beans.

loans.name: Safarkhocha

texts.ru: Сафархоча проживает в районе Кумсангир. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат. Имеет трое детей. У него среднее образование. Он при доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Safarkhocha lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 30 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education.  Safarkhocha has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables for sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Keiana

texts.en:
Keiana is 40 years of old and married, with four children.

Keiana owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Keiana needs a loan of WST 1,000 to buy baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Keiana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Keiana's first loan from SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nurkul

texts.ru: Нуркуль 48 лет, замужем и  воспитывает троих детей. Нуркуль работает медсестрой в местной больнице. В 2003 году, в поисках средств к существованию для своей семьи, Нуркуль начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и перепродаже сельхоз продукции. Нуркуль использовала стартовую сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, и сумела развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день пять бычков, с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме около 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуркуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Нуркуль планирует увеличивать поголовье  скота.
texts.en: Nurkul is 48 years old, married and is raising three children.  She works as a nurse at the local hospital.  In search of means for survival for her family, Nurkul started her own business of breeding livestock and reselling agricultural crops in 2003.  She used an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock and was able to grow her business to currently have five bulls and a monthly profit of about 30,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Nurkul requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase heifers.  In the near future, she plans to increase livestock headcount with the help of the profits from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Tauva

texts.en:
Tauva is 40 years old, married and has 3 children.

Tauva owns & operates a business, planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has many years experience in this business. Tauva needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Tauva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tauva's 1st loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
Ms Than is 43 years old, has 1 child and lives in Ngo noi village. She is a rice farmer and also raises chickens. Joining SEDA's credit program in 2008, she has received 5 loans to invest in expanding her agricultural activities. For this new loan she wants 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for chickens.

Ms Nhi is 44 years old. She runs a woodwork shop right beside her house that makes wooden family equipment. She wants a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong to buy materials.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens

loans.name: Sabiran's Group

texts.en:
Sabiran is 50 years of age, still an active lady in her works. Besides managing her household works, she operates a quilt-making business. She is renowned for her work in her community. She fills the quilts with cotton to make it useful. Many clients come to her from her community to give her the raw material. She prepares the quilts for them and earns a reasonable amount of income, which helps utilizing it in managing the household expenses. 

Sabiran's husband is involved in selling seasonal fruits. He is a very hard worker and goes to the fruit market early in the morning to purchase fresh, good quality fruits for selling. He is a very dedicated and honest person and doesn't sell the low quality fruits to his customers. His customers prefer buying fruits from him due to the freshness of the products and his reasonable rates. 

Sabiran is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. He will intend to use this loan in purchasing fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantity for selling. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will become more profitable after an investment.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit selling business.

loans.name: German

texts.en: German is married and is a responsible father of two children. He is a conscientious and hardworking person. German has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over six years. He grows rice. When he started this business, he had two hectares of land and now he plans to expand his land. He wants to gather a good harvest and maximize his profit. German wants to obtain a loan in the sum of PHP 22,000 to purchase mineral fertilizers for his farm business.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing fertilizer.

loans.name: Tumua

texts.en:
Tumua is 32 years of age, married and has 4 children.

Tumua owns & operates a business, planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has many years experience in this business. Tumua needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tumua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tumua's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is 31 years old. She is a member of AN Tap cluster. She has two children who go to school. She is a farmer who not only grows rice but also sells dry goods in the market such as beans and peanuts. She has been doing this job for one year. She has a monthly income of about 3.500.000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid that loan punctually. This is the 5th time she is borrowing money from SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy more peanuts and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 52 years old and is a married man with 6 children. His children are between 12 and 28 years old. 

Jaime is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is able to support his family through his fishing business. He plans to use his loan to purchase fishing materials such as nets, hooks and baits. Jaime also sells food items to his community. Jaime hopes to have a stable income to sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets, hooks and baits

loans.name: Tereise

texts.en:
Tereise is 48 years of age and is married with 5 children.
Tereise owns & operates a business, selling baked goods in the local community. She has many years experience in this business. Tereise needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tereise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tereise's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Thua

texts.en: Thua is 40 years old. She lives with her family in Ngo Noi village. Her two children are of school age. Her main business activity is running a small grocery shop. It creates 5,000,000 Vietnam dong profit. Being a client of SEDA since 2008, she has always been in a good repayment situation. Currently she wants to borrow 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more new products for her shop to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more new products for her shop

loans.name: Abduhamid

texts.ru: Абдухамид житель района Кумсангир. Возраст, 31 год. Женат. У него трое детей. Его жена занимается шитьем. Сам он занимается торговлей на рынке. Он продает овощи и зелень. Кредит берет для закупа риса.
texts.en: Abduhamid is a resident of the Qumsangir district.  He is 31 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is involved in sewing.  Abduhamid is involved in sales at a market.  He sells vegetables and herbs.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of rice.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emilia is a married woman who has two children. Emilia is 36 years old and resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Emilia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,200.00 doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Emilia has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Emilia wants to make improvements to her house and to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rani Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Rani Bibi is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family: a husband and a daughter. Rani’s days are focused on making progress with her business. She is involved in embroidery works. Her work is home-based. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes. Her excellent embroidery skills enable her to receive good orders from her clients and generate good revenue.
 
Rani's husband’s economic mainstay is selling fruit. He has good selling skills and he is renowned for his business. He has been operating his business for over 8 years. Rani is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He intends to use the loan to purchase fresh seasonal fruits for reselling. She hopes that her husband will grow the business more and improve the quality of services after the loan investment.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rani Bibi”.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for re-selling.

loans.name: Canh

texts.en: Canh is 53 years old. She is a member of An Tap cluster in SEDA. She has participated in SEDA since 2008. She has four children who are married. Mrs Canh has a store. She raises pigs and sells iron nails. She has had this job for two years. She has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnam dong (VND). Previously she borrowed 8.288.000 and repaid the loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy iron to produce iron nails.

loans.use: to buy iron to produce iron nails.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
59-year-old Josefina runs a sari-sari store in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells various items like spices, canned goods and bread. Josefina earns 600 PHP daily. She said she is able to provide for her family's daily needs through her income.

Josefina works hard to support her family of a husband and 3 children. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks and bread. Josefina hopes to expand her store in the future. She also hopes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Chamila

texts.ru: Чамила жительница района Кумсангир. Ей 50 лет. Она вдова. У нее трое детей. Она печет у себя дома самбусу для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для приобретения холодильника, чтобы хранить продукты.
texts.en: Chamila is a resident of the Qumsangir district.  She is 50 years old, a widow and has three children.  She bakes samosas at home for sale.  Chamila has been involved in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a refrigerator, so that she can store products.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 50 years old, married and has 13 children.

Nora owns & operates a business, planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years experience in this business. Nora needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Nora joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Nora's 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score."" loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives

loans.name: Samalaulu

texts.en:
Samalaulu is 57 years old and is married with 9 children.

Samalaulu owns & operates a business, selling baked goods in the local community. She has 2 years experience in this business. Samalaulu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Samalaulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Samalaulu's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has been in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the past 11 years. He is 28 years old, married to Anastacia and they have one child. Besides his motorcycle business, Wilson also has quarry from where he extracts stones for construction.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy another quarry since there is a high demand for building material due to the rising growth rate of Naivasha town and its environs. This has seen many investors establishing huge businesses like shopping malls and tourist hotels. 

In the future, Wilson hopes to establish a stable mining factory and become a renowned construction and building entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy another quarry

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 57-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has had a sari-sari store for 8 years. Lorna sells items like canned goods, softdrinks, shampoo and soap. Lorna works hard to improve her business and her family's living situation.

Lorna requested this loan to pay for school fees and to buy more items to sell like canned goods. She hopes that this loan will help improve her business. Lorna also hopes to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and buy more items to sell like canned goods

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy is 37 years old. She is a member of An Tap cluster in SEDA. She has two children. One of them is married. She grows rice and also makes rice noodles to sell. She has had this job for 3 years. She has a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid that loan punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9.632.000 VND to buy rice to make rice noodles.

loans.use: to buy rice to make rice noodles

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Ms Cuc is 45 years old, with two school-aged children. She is a kindergarten teacher. To save in her free time, she makes rice cake and uses the side product to raise pigs for meat. She has been a client of SEDA's credit program since 2008, and has received five loans and used them effectively to expand her business. Currently, she would like a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnamese dong to buy rice as material, and part of it to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy rice as material, and part of it to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is 39 years of age and is married with 4 children

Mele owns & operates a business, selling food products in the local community. She has 2 years experience in this business. Mele needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2010, Mele  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Mele 's 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tashbibi

texts.ru: Ташбиби готовит пирожки и блинчики для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается четыре года. Она вдова. Ей 50 лет. У нее четверо детей. Двое ее детей работают на рынке. Ташбиби берет кредит для покупки продуктов необходимых для приготовлений пирожков и чебурек.
texts.en: Tashbibi makes piroshki and pancakes for sale.  She has been involved in this business for four years.  Tashbibi is 50 years old, a widow and has four children.  Two of her children work at the market.  Tashbibi is requesting this loan for the purchase of products necessary for cooking piroshki and chiburekki.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en: Perpetua is a 41-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband run a fishing business. Perpetua's husband operates their fishing boat. Perpetua sells all his catch at the market. She also buys fish from other fishermen in her town. Perpetua does her best to support her family. She plans to use her loan to purchase fishing materials such as nets, hooks and baits. She hopes for their business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets, hooks and baits

loans.name: Soonalote

texts.en:
Soonalote is 27 years old, married and has 4 children.

Soonalote owns & operates a business, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. She has 3 years experience in this business.    Soonalote needs a loan of WST $1650.00 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Soonalote joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Soonalote's 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old, and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Susan is a married woman with six children. 

Susan owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000.00 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000.00, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Susan has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Susan hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer.

Primitiva has had a sari-sari store for 5 years. She sells various items like canned goods, noodles, sugar and soap. Primitiva earns about 9000 PHP each month. She works hard to help provide for her family's needs.

Primitiva has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as sugar, coffee, shampoo and soap. She hopes to improve her business and her family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Dilbarkhon

texts.ru: Дилбархон занимается растениеводством. В этой области она шесть лет. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она берет кредит закупа крупнорогатого скота. Она хочет заняться скотоводством.
texts.en: Dilbarkhon is a farmer. She has been growing produce for the last six years. She is 56 years old, married and has four children. Dilbarkhon is taking out this loan to purchase cattle because she wants to start raising livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zambaonga del Sur. She is 24 years old. Alma is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Alma runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many other items. Alma has been in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,600 PHP a month for these activities.

Alma is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 64-year-old, hardworking man from Serem, an upcoming centre in Vihiga County, Western Kenya. He is married to Norah, a housewife, and they have six children.

Julius is in livestock sales, dealing mostly with cattle sales in Vihiga town. He has been in this business for the past 33 years and has wide experience. He makes a monthly income of Kes 36,500. Julius is a long time client of KADET LTD. He is taking his eighth loan which he will use to buy livestock for sale.

He hopes to generate profits which he will use to educate his children and also to expand his business. His long-term dream is to see his business make a good income so as to improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for sale.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 45 years old and married. He has three grown up children. Ronald has been engaged in the farming business for ten years. Farming is his main source of their income. He is a very loving father and husband. He will do everything to see to the needs of his family.

Ronald is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that his business will expand to see the need of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta is a 55-year-old single lady from Suna Ragana in the outskirts of Migori county, Western Kenya.

Greta has been operating a fish selling business for the past twenty two years. She makes a good monthly income of KES.15,000 and is now taking her third loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy stock of fish for sale. Her profits will be channeled back into the business.

Her dream is to see her business expand so that she is able to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 54-year-old man from the Tegere area of Migori county, situated along the shores of Lake Victoria. He is married to Annah and they have six children.

Joseph operates a cereal selling business. Ha has been doing this for the past ten years and thus has vast experience. Joseph, who makes a monthly income of KES. 30,000, is taking his fourth loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more stock of maize. He will plow back his profits and ensure that the business is always well stocked.
