His dream is to improve his family’s living standards by providing them with the basic needs.

loans.use: To buy maize for sale.

loans.name: Misanga Group

texts.en:
Dinah is the facilitator of Misanga group. Dinah and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Dinah takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Dinah had a good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  she was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½  acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dinah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Dinah will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Misanga group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Chacha

texts.en:
Chacha is a 40-year-old, enterprising man from Kegonga area of  Migori County, Western Kenya. He is married to Margaret and they have six children.

Chacha operates a jaggery business (jaggery is a concentrated product of cane juice, without separation of the molasses and crystals, and can vary from golden brown to dark brown in color and is used in the food industry). Chacha has been in this business for the past 10 years. He is an old client of KADET LTD. He is taking his fourth loan which he will use to add more stock of jaggery.

He will use the profits to repay his loan and his dream is to own a jaggery processing plant.

loans.use: To buy more stock of jaggery.

loans.name: Safia Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Safia Bibi is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family: a husband and four children. Besides her one child at home, the others are getting an education.   

Safia’s days are focused on making progress with her business. She is involved in sewing works. Her work is home-based. She sews clothes with perfect measurement. In her working experience, she has never received any complaints from her customers. Her husband’s business relies on providing photocopying services to the people. He has a photocopier machine in his shop. He has been operating his business for over 13 years. 

Safia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He intends to use the loan to purchase another photocopier machine to serve more clients at a time. This will help to generate good revenue. She hopes that her husband will grow the business more and improve the quality of services after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy another photocopier machine for photocopying business.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Mkombozi Liyombo Group

texts.en:
Melto is a 40-year-old married man with eight children. Three of the children attend primary education. He has worked in agriculture growing coffee, maize and beans for 11 years. He faces lots of challenges based on crop diseases and high price of fertilizers.

Melto wants to overcome those challenges by asking for financial support, which can help him to buy insecticides and fertilizers. In five years to come, he dreams of increasing his scale of production from 5 to 12 acres, to buy clothes and a mattress and cover the medical expenses for his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 24-year-old, hardworking lady from Migori County, Western Kenya. She is married to David and they have two children. 

Emily has been operating a tomato selling business in Suna Ragana for the past six years. She is taking her third loan from KADET LTD which she will use to purchase new stock of tomatoes for sale. She will use her profits to expand her business by adding to her tomato stock.

Her dream is to continue doing this kind of business to support her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of tomatoes.

loans.name: Subhon

texts.ru: Субхон открыл собственную аптеку. В этой области он семь лет. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Subhon operates his own pharmacy. He has been running his business for the last seven years and needs this loan to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase drugs

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 51 years old, an elementary graduate who has not had the privilege to finish his education due to poor living conditions. But in spite of this, he has still developed his own family. As of now, he has four children who have already their own families but are still asking assistance from him.

As a father, he cannot resist his childrens' requests, so he must work hard to provide for their necessities. He is a small farmer in their community. He yields PHP19,000 from the harvest, after six months. Renato wants to exceed this profit for his children and grandchildren. For this reason, he is now asking for a loan amount of PHP25,000 to buy corn seeds to plant, fertilizers and pesticides. He hopes that his crops will not be destroyed by any disastrous insect or typhoon. The crops will enable Renato to earn a higher income that can be used for his family's future as well as to save for continuing his business.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds to plant, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete building his rental houses.

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
Sam Ath is a 64-year-old mother who is married with five children: two of her children are dependents who work in the rice field and sell peanuts. Having earned a living as a rice farmer for 30 years, she supplements her income by selling peanuts and cakes. With her current business, she earns around 17 US dollars per day to feed her family. 

Sam Ath has been with VisionFund since 2009. She successfully repaid her last loan with VisionFund. After two loan cycles, she is able to generate a regular income and have a good business. She will use this loan to buy an old motorbike for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her business and earn more income to improve her living standard and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a young 28-year-old married man with one infant. He has been engaged in farming business for three years. Ronald is a very loving and patient father. Ronald is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm business. In the future, Ronald hopes that his business will expand, to provide good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm business.

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace is aged 29 years. She is a single mother of three children, living in Hoima, Uganda. She buys and sells charcoal and has been in this business for two years. She is faced with the challenge of high fuel and transportation costs. Her business goal is to expand to new markets and her personal goal is to educate her children to obtain a degree.
Beatrace needs a loan to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Delilah has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Delilah has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Delilah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long, 55 years old, is a responsible mother of 6 children. She is in the agricultural business. She has a life partner in her husband who provides motorcycle services to the people around Baray district. 

Besides farming work, Mrs. Long has another skill in weaving clothes. But she hasn’t used this skill for a long time because she doesn’t have a loom at home to operate. Now she has decided to look for some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase a loom and other raw materials for the process. She hopes that she will be able to generate more income through this new project.

loans.use: to purchase a loom and other raw materials for the silk weaving process.

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru: Хамрокул предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он пять лет. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Hamrokul has been running a taxi business for the last five years. He is 29 years old, married and has two children. Hamrokul needs this loan to repair his taxi cab.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is 49 years old and a single mother of two children living in Hioma, Uganda. She sells juice and soda and has been in this business for 5 years. She is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital to purchase stock. Her business goal is to expand her business into new markets and her personal goal is to educate her children.

Robinah intends to use the loan to buy juice and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy juice and soda to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman.

Veronica has been engaged in fishing for 20 years. She and her husband now work together to grow their fishing business. Veronica sells her husband's catch and also buys fish from other fishermen to sell. Veronica works hard to improve their income and to continue providing for their family. She requested a loan to purchase nylon, bait and crab traps. Veronica hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase nylon, bait and crab traps.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 37 years old married man with six grown up children. He has been engaged in the farming business for seven years. He is a very responsible and loving father.

Samuel has requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer for his business. In the future, Samuel hopes that his farm business will expand to give the quality of life needed for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, 43, is married and has two children, one of whom is dependent and is not at school. Having made a living as a peasant who plants cassava, she supplements her income by working for others for fees. She has been in this business for three years. In addition, her husband works as a worker at rubber plantation factory. With her current business, she earns around $8 US per day to feed her family.

Living in a village located in the Ponhea Krek district where crop plantation, especially cassava, rubber, etc., is common, Srey is requesting her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy cassava from the villagers for sale in the market.

She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her cassava business and to sell for good prices so as to earn more income to make her living better.

loans.use: to buy cassava to stock for sale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Pamoja Group in Western Kenya! Ruth is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Ruth is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ruth had a good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

 With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ruth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ruth will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

 In 2012, the members of Pamoja group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. They are pictured above with their Field Officer on the far left

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando is 59 years old, a laborious farmer in their community. Disregarding his age, he patiently works in the field. This is the family's primary source of income, where he gets the income used for their every day needs. This causes him to care a lot about his farming business. In fact, he is asking for a loan amount of PHP25,000 as additional funds to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers to improve his business. He wants to yield better crops through this loan as well as adding to his hard work and endurance. Hopefully, he will achieve his desired income so that he can improve his family's living standards and to save for their future use.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр зарабатывает путем разведения мелко - рогатого скота. В этой области он 10 лет. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов мелко – рогатого скота.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is a rancher who raises goats for a living. He has been working with livestock for the last 10 years. Bakhtiyor is 35 years old, married and has two children. He needs this loan to purchase a few more animals for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase a few heads of livestock

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 43 years old, a modest lady from Murumba in the Western part of Kenya and is married to Mark. They have three children .

Everline is a tailor at Murumba shopping center, where she makes dresses and many other clothing. She has been in this business for five years and thus has experience. She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy textile materials for her tailoring and dressmaking business. She will channel her profits back to her business and use some to provide for her family.

Her dream is to open many tailoring outlets within Murumba market.

loans.use: to buy textile materials.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan is a hard-working married man with three children, living in Hoima, Uganda. He sells soft drinks, rice, and sugar, and has been in this business for 10 years. He is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations and inflation. His business goal is to expand his business into new markets, and his personal goal is to build a permanent home.
Evan needs a loan to buy soft drinks, rice, and sugar for sell during the festive season.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline lives in the Coastal town of Malindi. She is married and has two children. Mercyline owns a food stall which has been in operation for three years. Mercyline employs one person in her business. The business is located in an area with low-class people who cannot afford many items and basically depend on hotels for single meals.

Mercyline was introduced to Milango by her friends; she is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 to add stock of vegetables.

Mercyline looks forward to opening a hardware business in the future; her only challenge is the low season which comes in February. This loan will help her save for her children’s future education.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete building his rental houses.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a 61-year-old married woman with four children between 14 and 25 years old. Maxima's husband works as a carpenter.

Maxima has had a tailoring business for 15 years. She repairs clothes and makes dresses. She also makes uniforms. Maxima earns 4,000 PHP per month with this business. She plans to use her loan to repair her sewing machine and buy parts. Maxima hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her children to finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to repair her sewing machine and to buy parts.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 43 years old, a mother of four children and husband to Sylvanus. The family lives in the Murumba area of Kakamega .

Lydia operates a cereal-selling business in Murumba and has been doing this for the last two years. She joined KADET LTD when a need for micro credit arose, and is now taking her second, which she will use to buy maize cereal for sale.

She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business and also to support her family. Her dream is to get more funding to enable her to open a cereal outlet.

loans.use: to buy more maize cereals for sale.

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Rocel has a flower shop that sells grafted flowers. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy fertilizer for the flowers.

Rocel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rocel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the grafted flowers that she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure for her farms and to hire new labor.

loans.name: Elizalde

texts.en:
An industrious man, 41-year-old Elizaldy has been a farmer for five years. Although it is a difficult occupation, Elizaldy has worked persistently to continue to improve it. Now requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy fertilizers and corn seeds and to pay for labor costs, he wants his crops to grow well in order to surpass his profit of P15,000 last cropping season.

The father of five children, Elizaldy needs to work hard to grow enough crops for his family. Hopefully, through his perseverance and patience, he will lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Eileen

texts.en:
Eileen is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Eileen has a shop that sells variety of fruits. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy fruit to sell. 

Eileen joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Eileen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Gadoi

texts.ru: Гадои житель города Куляб. Ему 51 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. По профессии она врач. В этой области она 17 лет. В основном он лечит больных народной медициной, разными травами. Также он занимается развозкой пассажиров по городу. Кредит берет для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Gadoi lives in Kulob. He is 51 years old, married and has four children. He is a trained physician and has been working as a doctor for the last 17 years. Gadoi uses alternative medicine approaches, such as various herbs and supplements. To supplement the family's income he also works as a taxi driver. Gadoi is taking out this loan to repair his taxi cab.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chick feed, as well as baking ingredients.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Dorotea has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Dorotea became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Dorotea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Nanzati Ndanga-Mbinga Group

texts.en:
Melkion is a 30-year-old married man with two children and one attending primary education. He has worked in agriculture, especially the production of coffee, maize and beans for over 10 years while earning a low income.

He wants to increase his income by asking for financial help to buy fertilizers, insecticides and hoes. Melkion believes that in five years to come, he will improve his farming activities from 10 acres to 15 acres, be able to buy a transport vehicle e.g. a motorbike and pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides and hoes

loans.name: Umoja Shg Group

texts.en:
Denis is the facilitator of the Umoja SHG group. Denis and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Denis takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Denis had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Denis was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Denis and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Denis will educate his children and build a house. 

In 2012, the members of Umoja SHG group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Denis is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 22, is married and has two children, of which her oldest daughter is still at school while the youngest son is too young to attend school. She lives in a flat area of the rural village located in the Ponhea Krek district where farming is common. She has been growing cassava for four years to make a living and in addition, her husband catches frogs for sale to gain additional income. With her current business, she earns $11 US per day to feed and support her family.

Channy has been with VisionFund for four years. She completely repaid her last loan with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund helped her to afford a decent house and sufficient food. Now requesting for another loan, she will use this loan to buy cassava seedlings for her farm. She hopes to make more cassava and sell it for a good price so as to earn more income to make a living better and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Tauch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch is 51 years old. She is a widowed woman who has tried hard to raise six children. She is a farmer in Kompong Speu province.  On average she earns $1.00 a day from farming. 

This income is barely enough to cover her daily expenses. In order to generate more income, she is also involved in another business, rice trading. She has now run out of rice, and she is asking for additional capital from Kiva to build up her stock. 

This loan will help her business to be more successful. In the future, she hopes to increase her rice stock and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal stocks of rice.

loans.name: Bidii Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Bidii Farmers Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Daniel as the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. Daniel takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Daniel had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Daniel and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, he will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Bidii Farmers group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mumtaz Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz Akhtar, 48, lives with her family, a husband and three children. Her two sons run a food restaurant, while her daughter is studying. Mumtaz’s days are focused on managing the household chores and taking care of her family. She is a very caring lady and tries to meet the needs of her family.

Her sons have been operating their restaurant in the community for over eight years, their customers community people and friends. They serve good quality food items such as Nan chanay (made with chick-peas and served with bread and salad) and Daal chawal (made with lentils and serves with rice and pickle). Each day they make the dishes fresh and never compromise on quality.

Mumtaz is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons' business so they can purchase ingredients such as chick-peas, lentils, rice, cooking oil, spices, etc. to continue generating good revenue. She hopes that her sons will grow the business more and improve the quality of services after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restaurant business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells snacks like pancakes and rice cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy the raw ingredients she needs to make snacks. 

Evelyn joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
At 53 years old, Reynaldo has just finished elementary school. It took him so long due to his underpriviledged background. His parents made their living through their farming business, and now he also supports his family in the same way. His children have now finished their education. He still needs to work in order to provide for his wife and secure their future in case he is no longer able to work. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides to use in his corn field. He hopes this will make a real contribution to a better crop at the next harvest. He will save his profits so he has some funds in case of an urgent situation, such as a medical emergency - which is more lkely as he and his wife are getting older.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Kudbudin

texts.ru: Кудбудин занимается скотоводством. Он проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 47 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он берет кредит для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Kudbudin raises cattle for a living. He lives in Kulob. Kudbudin is 47 years old, married and has six children. He is taking out this loan to purchase an additional cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Vanilla Rose Group

texts.en:
Ellen resides in Kwekwe with her family. She is aged 36, married, and has five children aged 20, 16, 14, 13 and two. She takes care of two other dependents, who are school-going age. Four of her children attend school. Her husband is self-employed and assists his wife by bringing in additional income.  

Ellen operates from a flea-market at Kwekwe, a small town near Gweru. Her flea-market has been in existence since 2003. She mainly specializes in products like shirts, footwear, suits, jeans, t-shirts, dresses and African attire. She has taken a loan of $400 which she used to purchase 20 pairs of footwear, 10 pairs of slippers, tuckies (sports shoes), clothing and cosmetics.

The main challenge she faces is that of high competition and theft by her employees. With a bigger business, she looks forward also to having her own boutique and saloon. She will also be able in a position to purchase household goods, look after her parents, send her children to better schools and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy shirts, footwear, suits, jeans, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, and African attire.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, a 47-year-old resident of the Philippines, is married and has 10 children. Marilyn has a junk-shop that buys and sells recyclable materials such as bottles, plastics and styrofoam. In business for 10 years, she is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more recyclable materials. Marilyn, who joined HSPFI this year, hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials like plastics and bottles.

loans.name: Sengleang

texts.en:
Sengleang is a 34-year-old divorced mother of three children. Two of her children are still at school while her youngest child is too young to attend school. Sengleang lives in a flat area of a rural village located in the Ponhea Krek district where farming is common. She has been farming on her rice field for four years to make a living. In addition, she started running a small business a year ago selling biscuits, candy, and other foods to gain additional income. Sometimes, she works for other people for additional income as well. With her current business, she earns more than 10 USD per day to feed and support her children. 
Sengleang has been with Kiva partner VisionFund since 2009. She completely repaid her last loan with VisionFund. Her loans from VisionFund have helped her to afford sufficient food regularly and have helped to give her a regular income. She is now requesting another loan, which she will use to expand her business by buying biscuits and other foods for her store. Sengleang hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business and earn more income to provide a better standard of living and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy biscuits and other foods for her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nawab Begum's Group

texts.en:
Nawab begum is 37 years old, she is married and the mother of three daughters and a son. All of her children are continuing their education. Her two elder daughters also do sewing jobs for clients in the neighbourhood in order to contribute financially to the family.

Nawab makes and sells snacks and just loves cooking. The taste of her snacks is very good and she sells a good quantity of snacks every month. Her husband has a job with a low income. 

Nawab has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to expand her snack-selling business. With the loan, she will purchase larger quantities of spices and cooking oil which will allow her to make better-tasting products that she can sell for higher profits. She is an experienced business woman and has been running her business for many years. She is very confident that she will be able to increase her profits as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and spices to make snacks.

loans.name: Bezhan

texts.en:
Bezhan is a 54 years old farmer from the village Kakhareti, Southern part of the country. He is married and lives with his family: his wife Lali and their 23 year old son. The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have milking cows and produce cheese. They sell the products on local market. Along with the above mentioned activities, the family grows corn and various vegetables on their family owned plot of the land. Harvested products are sold locally for cheap price. 

Bezhan has requested credit for purchasing a minibus to transport the family's agricultural products to the capital city of the country. He will take and sell the products in Tbilisi for a higher price. Also, when he has the minibus, he will purchase additional products in the village for resale and, even taking into account the fuel cost, the profit of the family will increase. The family will use their increased profits to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for transporting harvested products to market.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is married and has one child. 
Judith owns a second-hand clothes shop, which has been in operation for one year. She was invited to join Kiva partner Milango by her friends, and she decided to join in order to access credit. She began her business, which has now grown to moderate level, from her personal savings.
Judith is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy new men’s shirts for resale. The main challenge Judith faces in her business are seasonal sales periods and the high cost of goods. She plans to open a second-hand wholesale shop in the future.
Judith will use the extra income from this loan to buy charcoal, which is in high demand in the surrounding areas.

loans.use: to buy new men's shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cellphones and accessories.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a mother of four young children. To make a living, she established a store selling home and beauty products in the village of Alcala. She sells soap, shampoo, lotions, powder, bags and shirts. She operates her store just in front of her house in order to easily do her household chores when customers are not around. She had been in her business for six years and earns about PHP3,000 each month. She usually pays PHP2,000 for a month of allowance and milk formula and diapers for her infant child.

She is now asking for a loan of PHP20,000 to buy more bags, lotions, powder and cosmetics to sell. This additional quantity of items to sell will help increase sales capacity and Joan hopes that someday she can help uplift her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more bags, lotions, powder and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elsa is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Elsa has been farming sugarcane for 12 years and also earns additional income from tricycle transport and selling ready-to-wear clothing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Cecil has a vegetable garden where she grows vegetables, like eggplants & string-beans, that she will sell when it's harvest time. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Cecil has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cecil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for vegetable garden.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Tumaini Group in Western Kenya! Samuel is the facilitator of Tumaini group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Samuel takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, he had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samuel and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. With the income from maize sales, Samuel will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Tumaini group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Ilyn sells grown & matured pigs from her pigpen. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Ilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Odinakul

texts.ru: Одинакул имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии работает 25 лет. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Также Одинакул занимается скотоводством. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Odinakul has a bachelor's degree in education and has been working as a teacher for 25 years. He is now 45 years old, married and a father of five children. To supplement his teacher's salary Odinakul raises cattle for sale. He is asking for a loan to purchase a few more calves for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is a 49-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has 6 children aged between 9 and 21.

Artemio works as a carpenter. He earns about 6000 PHP per month providing carpentry services to his community. Artemio also tills a parcel of land to grow rice crops to sell. He works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and tools for carpentry. 

Artemio hopes to improve the quality of his family's life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and tools for carpentry.

loans.name: Iason

texts.en:
Iason is from the village Sakuneti, Southern part of the country. He is 59 years old and lives in the village with his wife, Dali. The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They grow potatoes, maize and beans on family-owned plot of the land. They also have milkng cows and produce cheese. Cheese and harvested vegetables/corns are sold on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

Iason requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. The family will increase the amount of milk cows, thus they will be able to produce and sell more cheese. It will positively affect the income of the family. Increased income will allow Iason and Dali to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Jonie Chris

texts.en:
Jonie Chris is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Jonie Chris is runs a habal-habal service (motorbike transporting several people). He has had this business for two years. He has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Jonie Chris joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Jonie Chris hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorbike transport service.

loans.name: Golden Mothers Group

texts.en:
Precious is a single woman aged 30. She lives in Kwekwe with her four year old child. She also takes care of her brother.

Precious is in the business of  buying and selling fruit and vegetables. The business has been operating for the past four years now. She has two employees who assist her in selling the vegetables. She was granted a loan of $400 which she used to buy cabbages, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. Her problem is that fruit and vegetables may go bad before they are sold which leads to losses and affects her profits. 

Precious is also a hairdresser thus she supplements her income through hairdressing. She sees herself renting her own saloon thus enabling her to pay fees for her child and feed the family.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, carrots, tomatoes and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 

Jessica has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Jessica joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Vabatana Association Group

texts.en:
Juliana is aged 28 and lives in Kwekwe with her only child, aged 8, and two other dependents. She operates a business from a flea market and a garage, and has been running these businesses for two years now. 
As a single mother it is a big challenge to feed three children and Juliana has been trying very hard to provide for her family. The main challenges she faces are transport problems when orders have been made but cannot be delivered on time. With the loan she has received, she intends to buy clothes for her flea market business. Her future expectations are to own her own shop and operate her businesses on a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Neema Group in Western Kenya! Leonard is the facilitator of the Neema group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Leonard takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Leonard had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest five bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Leonard and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Leonard will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Neema group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 43 years old, married, and has seven children. With four children in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.
Rosalinda runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.
In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Nelia has a shop that sells caned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Nelia joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Nelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Abisunganye Corimi Mgsr Nygtng Sk Group

texts.fr:
Diogène fait partie du groupe Abisunganye CORIMI MGSR NYGTNG SK. Il a 31 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 4 à 7 ans, dont 1 scolarisé, il a 1 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants. 

Diogène est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de suivre tous les conseils donnés par les agronomes. Dans les prochaines années, Diogène voudrait être le fournisseur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en: Diogène is a member of the Abisunganye CORIMI MGSR NYGTNG SK group.  He is 31 years old, married, and has two children who are 4 and 7 years old.  One of his children attends school.  He also supports one additional person.  Diogène is a rice farmer.  He is requesting his second loan from ACB.  This loan will allow him to buy chemical fertilizers for rice production.  To ensure the growth of his business, Diogène is carefully following the advice given by agronomy experts.  In the coming years, Diogène would like to be the supplier for his region.  With the profits, he plans to take care of his children's health and education.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers for rice culture.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy suits for both men and women.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is a young farmer from the village Dertseli, in the southern part of the country. He is 25 years old, married and lives with his wife, Nona, and 2 daughters (1 and 4 years old). The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have 6 milk cows and 7 calves. Nona produces cheese and they sell it on the local market. Also, the family grows potatoes on family-owned 1.25 hectares of land. The potatoes are sold on the local market as well. 

Nodar decided to expand his existing dairy farm. He requested credit for purchasing 2 additional milk cows. Nona will be able to produce more cheese and the family income from cheese sales will increase. Nodar and Nona will be able to create better living conditions for the family, especially for the children.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en:
Buenaventurada is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has seven children. 
Buenaventurada is a farmer. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She works hard to support her family and keep them healthy. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor. She hopes this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Upendo Liyombo Group

texts.en:
January is a 44-year-old father of six children. One child attends secondary school and three children attend primary school. He does well in growing coffee, maize and beans while facing problems of crop diseases and the high price of fertilizers.

January looks for a source of income that can be used to buy fertilizers, insecticides and gumboots. He dreams of buying a maize processing machine and a coffee curing machine and increasing the scale of production from 10 to 30 acres in five years to come.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides and gumboots

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.ru: Умринисо проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Умринисо занимается скотоводством. У нее имеется коровник, где она разводит скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Umriniso lives in Khujand. She is 40 years old, married and has two children. Umriniso raises cattle for a living. She has a big cow barn where she keeps her herd. She has had her cow herd for the last five years and is taking out this loan to purchase a few more calves.

loans.use: to purchase a few more calves

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin has been a farmer in his village for 3 years. Within these years of operating his corn field, he has been able to provide the needs of his wife and one child. But because of a typhoon encountered by his business, he did not earn enough funds for him to lift up his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan amount of 18,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs he needs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticide and to pay for labor costs.

He hopes that he will be lucky to yield abundant crops by this season in order to pay for his obligation. He would then also save for the growth of his family and for their security.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs he needs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticide and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas is a 25-year-old woman and a mother of 2 small kids. She lives with her family in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. She is always at home to take care of her children, while her husband works as a construction foreman, earning approximately 8 USD per day. The purpose of this loan is to purchase construction supplies for her husband. In the future, Meas’ husband wants to be the owner of construction project and to build a construction team by himself.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her husband

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, gas stoves, and chicks.

loans.name: Jowy

texts.en:
Jowy is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Jowy is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 1 year. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Jowy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Jowy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Rusebil

texts.en:
Rusebil is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rusebil is making and peddling snacks like sweet potato and banana cue. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy sweet potatoes and bananas for making snacks. Rusebil has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Rusebil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes and bananas for making snacks

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a widow and has a rope-making business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Vicenta has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business. She has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.
In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Twongere Umusaruro / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Esdras fait partie du groupe Twongerumusaruro. Il a 48 ans et il est marié avec 8 enfants de 2 à 25 ans, dont 3 scolarisés, il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Esdras est cultivateur de maïs. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, engrais chimiques, location des champs et paiement main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de maïs. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences modernes et selectionner. Dans les prochaines années, Esdras voudrait être le grand agriculteur professionnel. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’améliorer le bien être de sa famille et éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ezra is part of the Twongere Umusaruro group. He is 48 years old and is married with eight children whose ages range from 2 to 25, and of whom three are in school. Other than his children, he has one other person to care for. His level of education is three years of high school.

Ezra is a corn crop farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and also rent fields and pay the labor for his corn crops.

His strategy for growing his business is to use modern seeds and select them. In coming years, Ezra wants to become a great professional farmer. With the profits, he plans to improve his family's well-being and educate his children.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, and also rent fields and pay the labor for his corn crops

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Josie has a shop that sells Tupperware products. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of Tupperware to sell. 

Josie joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of Tupperware to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Jenelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jenelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jenelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old, married to Joseph, and has three children that attend school. She sells fish such as salmon and milk fish to the people in her village. She also sells crabs and shrimp. She has been 10 years in this kind of business. She wants to keep making better sales and earn an income for the improvement of their lives. 

She had insufficient funds up to this moment because her profit pays for tuition fees and allowances for her children. She is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy more fish, shrimp and crabs to sell. Additional revenue from the business is used to save for future emergencies.

In the future, she hopes to own a stall in the market for the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish, shrimp and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Huruma B Group

texts.en:
James is the facilitator of the Huruma B group. James and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. He takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to get One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for his family, and, later, to educate them. 

In the recent 2011 season, James had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest six bags of maize on that land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Dashkin

texts.en:
Dashkin lives in the village of Tsurtavi with his wife, Elza. He is 34 years old. The family has rented 1 hectare of land for potato growing. Harvested potatoes are sold, but the main source of the income for the family is selling greengrocery products. Dashkin owns a car, which is used for his business. He purchases fruit and vegetables in the village at wholesale prices and takes the produce to nearby towns for sale. Total average income of the family is 700 Laris per month. 

Dashkin requested credit for increasing his stock in trade. He will use 3000 Laris for purchasing fruit and vegetables in the village and sell the produce in nearby towns along with his own potatoes. He will use received income for covering his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is 31 years old and a married lady. She is an expert seamstress and does sewing to supplement the income for her family. Her work is home based. She is renowned among her community clients and gets regular orders every month.  

Her husband’s economic mainstay is selling potatoes. He mainly sells potatoes. He purchases potatoes in bulk quantity from the vegetable market and sells to customers who require them. Potatoes are one of the vegetables which everybody likes to eat and they are used in most dishes. So he gets good customers which earns him good income.
 
With this loan, her husband will purchase potatoes in larger quantity for re-selling. He has been operating his business for over 15 years and Bilqees is confident that he will be able to improve his business a lot after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years. She earns more income from food vending.
Gloria is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Imelda has a shop that sells vegetables like carrots, bell peppers & cabbages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 1999. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en:
Truphena is 32 years old and single.  For four years, she has been tailoring to earn a living.  She has employed two people to assist her in the business.  

Through Faulu Kenya, she has become more business-oriented because she has been trained in business management and she has gained more business ideas from her group members.

Truphena hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She needs a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Margie has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of AVON & NATASHA products.

Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of AVON & NATASHA products.

loans.name: Magamed

texts.en:
Magamed is a farmer from the village of Nakhiduri, East Georgia. He is 53 years old, married,and lives with his family in the village: his wife, Melukhsa, his 30-year-old son, and a daughter-in-law. The main source of the income for the family is potato growing. They grow potatoes on family-owned 0.5 hectares of land. Magamed sells harvested potatoes in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Magamed requested credit for purchasing potato seeds. High quality seeds will be the prerequisite of good income in spring. Also Magamed hopes that the weather conditions will be favorable for potato growing this winter and he gets a good harvest, which will be sold for an appropriate price and the family will get more than planned in income. Magamed will use received profit for improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married and has a rice retail business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Gina has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years now, and also earns additional income from raising ducks and chickens.
In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Grace runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.
Grace has borrowed and paid back 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.
Grace aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for resale.

loans.name: Merlelyn

texts.en:
Merlelyn is 33 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
Merlelyn has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for three years. 
In the future, Merlelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say, 34, a mother of three school-aged children, is in the business of selling fish from a rented booth in a local market in Baray district. Every day she sells fresh fish that are caught by her husband from the river. She typically earns in the neighborhood of $4.00 each day and tries hard to support her family. On the other hand, her husband is a crop farmer who grows many kinds of crop like rice, beans and vegetables both in the rainy season and the dry season. 

Mrs. Say will use this loan to purchase rice seed, bean seed and pesticides. In years to come Mrs. Say intends to buy additional farmland for farming expansion.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, bean seed and pesticides.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 33 years old, married to Joseph, and has one school-going child who is four years old.
For the last four years, Irene has been operating a boutique and earning a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. She is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner KADET.  She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of dresses, shoes, and trousers for the boutique during high season. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs and to save. Irene hopes to grow her business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, shoes, and trousers for her boutique.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Edita works hard to support her family. She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Edita is borrowing 11,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving.
Edita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 49-year-old married lady who is blessed with four children, ages 9 through 22. 

She has been operating a green grocery to earn a living.  She has engaged in this business for two years.  Besides, she does farming to supplement her income.  Her desire is to own a lorry for transporting fruits and vegetables to the market place where she runs her grocery business. 

Ann needs some capital to start a business selling charcoal.  Hence she has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is married and works hard to support her family. She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines.
Guillerma has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving. She has been in this business for ten years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.
In the future, Guillerma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her business of sewing clothes. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete her orders on time and earn more income.

She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month due to her good quality work. She is very dedicated to her work and loves to do sewing.

Allah is married and has four daughters and a son. Her husband lives abroad and works there.

She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that an investment will help her to make more profits.

Note:  In the photo, the lady who has raised her hand is Allah Rakhi.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Akipa Shg Group

texts.en:
Margret is the facilitator of the Akipa SHG group. Margret and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. She is a mother to two children. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for her family. 

In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest five bags of maize on that land. With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margret and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Margret will build a house and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Akipa SHG group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Lotikaa Lugali Group

texts.en:
Tibilius is a 35-year-old married man with four children. Two of the children attend primary school. He is a good farmer who is dealing with the production of coffee and maize. He lacks the capital to overcome the high wages for laborers and the high cost of fertilizers and insecticides.

Tibilius wishes to earn more income to purchase fertilizers and insecticides and to cover the high wages for the laborers. He is thinking of boosting his scale of production from 8 to 15 acres together with buying an insecticides pump machine in five years to come.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Gemma has a shop that sells vegetables, spices, and fruits like bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fruits, vegetables, and spices to sell.

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and spices to sell.

loans.name: Ziyad

texts.en:
Ziyad, 49, is married and has three sons and two daughters. He has a low pension salary and also has a grocery store. 

Ziyad wants to purchase more groceries for the store so he will have a better collection for sale and will be able to increase his income.  He hasn't enough money to pay for this, so he needs a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Ziyad gets the loan, he will purchase more groceries. This will increase his sales and income.  This will enable him to create better living conditions for his family. 

Ziyad is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his grocery store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. 

Teresita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Haguruka Ukore / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Frederick fait partie du groupe Hagurukukore. Il a 29 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 1mois à 3 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4  ans de primaire.

Frederick est cultivateur de maïs. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, faire la location des champs, des engrais chimiques et payement main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de maïs. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture.  Dans les prochaines années, Frederick voudrait être un grand agriculteur et distributeur des produits agricoles. Avec les profits, Frederick prévoit d’éduquer et améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Frederick is a member of Hagurukukore Group. He's 29 years old, married, and has two children, aged one month and three years. His level of education amounts to four years of elementary school. 

Frederick is a corn cultivator who's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy seeds and chemical fertilizers, and pay the workforce for his corn farming business.

His strategy for growing his business is to use modern farming techniques. In the forthcoming years, Frederick would like to become a big farmer and wholesaler of farm products.

With his profits, he intends to educate his children and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical fertilizers, and pay the workforce for his corn farming business

loans.name: Maria Nida

texts.en:
Maria Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving business. She has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from pig fattening.
Maria Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to her basket weaving.

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Rowelyn has run a shop for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Rowelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Tajir

texts.en:
Tajir is from the village of Zemo Sarali, East Georgia. He is 52 years old, married, and lives with his family: his wife Nazakat, 21-year-old daughter, and 17-year-old son. Tajir is a teacher at a local school. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in his family's farm, which is their main source of income. They own 0.65 hectares of land, where they grow cucumbers, beans, and potatoes, as well as a greenhouse for growing vegetables. Tajir sells their harvest locally. The family's total average monthly income is 650 laris.

Tajir has requested a loan to purchase seed potatoes and a new polyethylene cover for his greenhouse. The existing cover is torn and can’t maintain the required temperature inside the greenhouse. Tajir will grow potatoes in the greenhouse and harvest them early in the spring, when the price of potatoes is at its highest. He will use the additional income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cover for his greenhouse and seed potatoes.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is married and has a mango sales business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Gertrudes has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more mangoes to sell on her food stall. She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from hog raising.
In the future, Gertrudes would like to save enough money to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Gh Ayidote Minawanou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amis et qui habitent le même village. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Benoît est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Benoît est âgé de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Benoît n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Benoît est marié à une marchande du nom de Adidja. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Benoît vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Benoît exerce depuis quarante ans environs, la culture du maïs, du piment, de tomate et de gombo qu’il vend dans un marché du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Benoît fait la pêche. Benoît exerce ses activités dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Benoît sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Gh Ayidote Minawanou group consists of four people who are friends and live in the same village. This is the fifth time that the group has sought financial support from ALIDé, to raise the level of its business activities. The representative of the group, named Benoît, is the one with the raised hand in the picture.

Benoît is 56 years old and lives in Benin. He did not attend school. Benoît is married to a retail merchant named Adidja. The couple has six children, all in school and who are their dependents. In addition to their children, the couple has another child to support. Benoît lives together with his wife and children.

To ensure the various family expenses, Benoît has been growing crops for the past forty years: corn, peppers, tomatoes and okra that he sells in a market in Benin. Secondarily, he is also a fisherman. Benoît runs his business activities in the surrounding region.

Seeking to satisfy customers and increase his turnover and income, Benoît is requesting, together with other members of the Gh Ayidote Minawanou group, a fifth credit loan from ALIDé. The first four loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy vegetable products to grow crops (pepper, tomato and corn).

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Perlita works hard to support her family. She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. 
Perlita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving business. Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Jovelisa

texts.en:
Jovelisa is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jovelisa has run a shop for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Jovelisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a 59-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice for quite some time now. Carmelita works hard to improve her business and support her family financially. She has applied for a loan to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Carmelita hopes that her business will grow. She also hopes to help send her nieces and nephews to school.

loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo is 53 years old and married.  He is a responsible and patient man who lives in Villa Concepcion with his family. He enjoys his work as a farmer, although he encounters hardships in maintaining his cornfield, especially when a drought or flood occurs. He plants and harvests corn to sell to traders in the village. In order to keep producing a good harvest, Rodrigo is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to maintain his crops. He would like to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Evelyn has run a shop for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gh Miwanou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GH MIWANOU est composé de six personnes qui sont des amis et qui habitent le même village. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de James est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. James est âgé de 51 ans et vit au Bénin. James n’a pas fréquenté l’école. James est marié à une marchande du nom de Pauline. Le couple a sept enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. James vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, James exerce depuis dix huit ans environs, la culture du maïs, du piment et des tomates qu’il vend dans un marché du Bénin. De façon secondaire, James fait l’élevage des bœufs qu’il vend dans une ville du Bénin. James exerce ses activités dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, James sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GH MIWANOU, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The GH MIWANOU group is made up of six friends who live in the same village.  This is the fifth time that the group has been requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase their business activity.  James is the facilitator of the group. In the picture, he is the man raising his hand.  James is 51 years old and lives in Benin.  James has never attended school.  He is married to Pauline, a retailer, and together they have 7 children whom they financially support.  Some of their children go to school.  Besides their own children, James and Pauline also support two additional children.  James, his wife, and his children, all live together.  In order to provide for his family, James has been cultivating maize, pimento and tomatoes for about eighteen years.  He sells his produce at a market in Benin.  Additionally, James is also raising cattle (oxen) which he sells in a town in Benin.  James conducts his business locally.
