In order to better serve his customers and to increase his turnover and his income, James (along with the other members of the GH MIWANOU group) is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.  His four previous loans were all well repaid.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce such as pimento, tomatoes and maize.

loans.name: Bongoline A Group

texts.en:
Francis is the facilitator of the Bongoline A group. Francis and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Francis takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to get One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for his family, and, later, to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Francis had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Francis was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Francis and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Francis will educate his children and pay back his loans. 

In 2012, the members of Bongoline A group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Francis is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gf Mahukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GF MAHUKPEGO est composé de quatre personnes qui habitent le même village et font des tontines ensemble. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Victorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Victorine est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Victorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Victorine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Marc. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et quatre restent à leur charge. Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Victorine exerce depuis une quinzaine d’années, la culture du maïs dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Victorine vend des boissons sucrées dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Victorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GF MAHUKPEGO, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The GF Mahukpego group is made up of four people who live in the same village and they operate a revolving finance system know as a "tontine", whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to the different members of the group. It is the fourth time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, with a view to increasing their business volume. The representative of the group, whose name is Victorine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Victorine is 46 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a farmer named Marc. The couple has six children, some of whom are at school and four of whom are dependents. Victorine lives with her husband and children. In order to cover the family's various expenses, she has been growing rice in her region for the past 15 years. As a secondary activity, she sells sweetened drinks in a town in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand while also increasing her turnover and income, Victorine is, together with the other members of the GF Mahukpego group, requesting a fourth loan from Alidé. The first three loans were all repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy corn for growing

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
For five years, Angelina has patiently sold snacks to the people in her village, especially the students. Her business is located in front of her house, which is near the school gate so it is a good location for selling daily snacks. She cooks soup, fish balls, hot dogs, and pancakes. She is proud that, with the profits from her business, she has been able to provide a daily allowance to her only child, who is in high school.

Angelina is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy eggs, hot dogs, fish balls, and chicken balls to sell. In the future, she hopes to make her business more profitable so she can save for her child's college education.

loans.use: to buy snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Altyn

texts.ru: Алтын 41 год, замужем и имеет пятерых детей, младшей из которых десять лет. В 1996 году, в поисках средств к существованию для своей семьи, Алтын начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и полеводстве. В качестве старта была закуплена одна корова и благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Алтын насчитывается две коровы, одни теленок, двадцать пять баранов, и одна рабочая лошадь. Также Алтын возделывает на собственном земельном наделе картофель и фасоль. В сезон, Алтын вместе с мужем переезжает на пастбище, где они работают в качестве пастухов, выводя на выпас скот местного населения. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтын обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2-х телят и 14 баранов . В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Алтын планирует сделать хороший ремонт своего дома и провести паровое отопление в доме.
texts.en: Altyn is 41 years old, married and a mother of five children, the youngest of whom is 10 years old. As a means of supporting her family, Altyn started a farming and cattle raising business in 1996. She started with one cow and because of Altyn's hard work and savvy business skills she now has two cows, a calf, twenty five sheep and a horse. Altyn also grows potatoes and beans on her own plot of land. During the summer season Altyn moves with her husband out to pastures where both of them work as shepherds for the herds of their neighbors. In order to grow her own farming business Altyn has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS). She is planning to buy two more calves and fourteen sheep with this money. In the future Altyn is planning to using the profits from the loan to repair her family's home and install a steam heating system.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 58 years old and blessed with five children. He is a farmer who provides for his children through his farming business. Because of the difficulty of earning money in this occupation, his children weren’t able to finish their tertiary education. But still he hopes to save in order for them to be able to continue their schooling.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. With his perseverance and hard work, he is sure to yield better crops this harvesting season and save for his children's education. He hopes that, before he leaves this world, he is able to see his children succeed.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Gf Mawoudekon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GF MAWOUDEKON est composé de cinq personnes qui sont des amies et vivent dans le même village. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Henriette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Henriette est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Henriette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Henriette est une veuve et mère de deux enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge. Henriette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les diverses charges de la famille. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Henriette mène comme activité depuis dix huit ans, la culture du piment dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Henriette vend de la farine de manioc dans une ville du Bénin. Henriette s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Henriette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GF MAWOUDEKON, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GF MAWOUDEKON Group is made up of five women who are friends and live in the same village. This is the fifth time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Henriette, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 33 years old and lives in Benin. She never attended school. She's a widow, and the mother of two children she has to support. Some children attend school.

Henriette lives alone with her children, and supports her family on her own. In order to provide for herself and her children, she's been growing chili pepper for eighteen years in her region. As a second business, Henriette sells manioc flour in a city in Benin. She buys the flour in her region.

Eager to meet customer demand, and in order to increase her revenue and income, Henriette, together with the other member of the group, is seeking her fifth loan from ALIDé. The previous four loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: To buy peppers to grow and also manioc flour

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old. He is a married man from the town of Cauayan City in the province of Isabela. He and his wife are both farmers. They primarily grow crops of corn to sell. George does his best to improve their business and take care of their children.

At this time, George is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. George hopes to have a bigger farm in the future. He also hopes to help improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase better manure for her farm.

loans.name: Wangnime Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIME est composé de sept personnes qui cohabitent ensemble. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Jeanne est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Grégoire. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jeanne exerce depuis une dizaine d’années, la culture du piment et du maïs dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Jeanne vend des céréales dans une ville du Bénin. Jeanne exerce ses activités dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNIME, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
WANGNIME Group is made up of seven women who share a home. This is the fifth time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.
 
The group's representative, named Jeanne, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 33 years old and lives in Benin. She never attended school. She's married to a cultivator named Grégoire. The couple has two children it has to support. Some children attend school.

Jeanne lives together with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses together. In order to provide for the various expenses of the family, Jeanne has been growing chili pepper and corn for about ten years in her region. 

As a secondary business, she also sells cereals in a town in Benin. Eager to meet customer demand, and to increase her revenue and income, Jeanne, together with the other members of the group, is seeking her fifth loan from ALIDé. The first four loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy sacks of chili pepper and corn

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a 54-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living making and selling "bahalina" (coconut wine). She earns about 4,000 PHP from her business. Catalina works hard to support her family and send her children to school.
Catalina has requested this loan to purchase containers and other materials. She hopes that her children can finish college and that her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase containers and other materials.

loans.name: Ginneper

texts.en:
Ginneper is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Ginneper has a shop that sells vegetables, spices, and food seasonings. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vegetables, spices, and food seasonings.

Ginneper has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Ginneper hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, and food seasonings.

loans.name: Pitadora

texts.en:
Pitadora is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Pitadora has a shop that sells vegetables, spices, and food seasonings. She has had this business for 20 years. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vegetables, spices, and food seasonings.

Pitadora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Pitadora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, and food seasonings.

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru: Кумри имеет троих детей, муж работает преподавателем в художественном колледже. Зарплата у мужа небольшая. Чтобы поддержать мужа и создать хорошие условия для воспитания детей она занимается купле продажей женской и детской одежды. У нее свои постоянные клиенты. Ее товар требуется большим спросом. Она хочет пополнить ассортимент товара с добавлением зимней одежды и праздничными детскими костюмами к Новому году. Она  хочет получить займ в размере 2000 долларов США для покупки товара. Она надеется на вашу поддержку и милосердие. Спасибо за оказанную помощь
texts.en: Kumri has three children and her husband works as an instructor in the art academy. Since her husband's salary is small, Kumri is helping him support the family by operating a clothing store. She sells clothes for women and children and has a number of regular clients, as her clothes are popular. Kumri would like to purchase additional garments for the winter season and children carnaval costumes for the upcoming New Year parties. She wants to take out a loan of 2000 US dollars to purchase these goods. Kumri is hoping for your support and charity. Thanks you for your help!

loans.use: To buy clothing for winter season

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 35 years old and she only finished her elementary education. Now, she has been blessed with four children. She aims to provide a good education for them so that they may find better employment than she herself, who is just involved rice farming. But she is a proud farmer of a two-hectare ricefield. She had been in this business for almost 15 years along with her spouse.   

Amalia is now asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy rice seeds and fertilizer to use in farming. She has insufficient funds now so she hopes this loan will be granted to her to improve her crops and their lives as well.

Someday, she aims to uplift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer to use in farming.

loans.name: Bidii Shg Group

texts.en:
Joseph is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG group. Joseph and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

Joseph takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and to produce quality maize next season. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest six bags of maize on that land. 

With the income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children and save for future use. 

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

The photograph shows Joseph with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Virgie has run a shop for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy detergents, shampoo, and bananas to sell.

Virgie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, shampoo, and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 34 years old, married to Alfonce, and has three school-going children aged between 3 and 14. She operates a retail shop in Tala, and earns a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. 
Rose has applied for a loan of 70,000 KES from Kiva partner KADET, and she plans to use the loan to buy more stocks of maize flour, beans, rice, sugar, and salt for sale during high season. She will save the anticipated profits and also provide for her family's basic needs. Rose hopes to grow her business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, beans, rice, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Lynnie

texts.en:
Lynnie is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

For 10 years, Lynnie has run a shop where she sells used clothing like t-shirts, jackets, and blouses. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of used clothing to sell.

Lynnie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a 56-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in farming for 10 years now. Cirila grows rice and vegetables to sell. Her income helps her to provide for her family's needs. Cirila works hard to continue earning for her family.

Cirila has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Cirila hopes to have a life that improves.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and married with 2 children.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling feed in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Aida has previously borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF. She has been running the business for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Aida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and married with 2 children.

Teresita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has had twelve loans in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a twenty-seven-year-old lady from Ranen in Migori County, which is situated on the shores of Lake Victoria, Kenya. She is married to George and they have two sons.

Anne runs a retail shop selling household goods. She has been in this business for the last four years. She is taking her second loan which she will use to buy more household items to sell in the run-up to the December festive season. Her profits will go towards paying school fees for her children and paying back her loan 

Her dream is to open a wholesale shop and also educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a stock of home products to sell.

loans.name: Jake

texts.en: At the young age of 19, Jake has already married and has one child.  He is able to support his family through his corn farm business. Sometimes, there are problems and complexity he comes across, but through his strong determination, he can survive. Jake aims to cultivate one and half hectares of farm land to plant more corn but he lacks the necessary capital. Thus, he wants to take out a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. He believes that this loan will help him growth his business. He is hoping that he will have a plentiful harvest to support his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. She has a shop that sells used clothing like blouses & dresses. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of  PHP 15,000 to buy more stock of used clothing.

Lalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 28-year-old entrepreneur from Othoo area of Migori County, on the shores of Lake Victoria. He is married to Jane and they have a young child.

Richard operates a motorcycle transport business (locally known as Boda Boda) and has done so for the last two years. He is taking his second loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy a second-hand motorcycle. He will use the profits to carry out repairs on his motorcycles and also provide for his family.

His dream is to own a fleet of motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Gf Djidjoho Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GF DJIDJOHO est composé de huit personnes qui sont des amies et vivent dans le même village. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sidonie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sidonie est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Marcellin. Sidonie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Sidonie mène comme activité depuis dix ans environs la culture du piment et du maïs dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Sidonie vend du riz. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Sidonie s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sidonie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GF DJIDJOHO, un cinquième crédit. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The GF DJIDJOHO group is made up of ten women who are all friends and who live in the same village. This is the 5th time they have asked ALIDé for financial help, so that they can increase their activity. The group's representative, Sidonie, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 36 years old and is married to a farmer called Marcellin. Sidonie lives with her husband and their 6 children. Some of the children go to school, and the couple is responsible for all of them. Together, Sidonie and her husband meet the household's various expenses. To do that, Sidonie has been growing peppers and corn locally for about ten years. She also sells rice. This allows her to easily contribute to the family's expenses. 

Sidonie obtains her supplies at markets in Benin. In order to meet customer demand and to increase turnover and profit, Sidonie, along with the other members of the GF DJIDJOHO group, is asking for a 5th loan. The first 4 have all been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and products to grow (pepper, corn).

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Jeane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 50-year-old man from Migori County, which is on the shores of Lake Victoria in Kenya. He is married to Mary and they have eleven children.

George operates a motorcycle transport business and has been doing this for the last four years. This kind of service is popular in this area due to its availability and low cost. He is taking his first loan which he will use to buy a second-hand motorbike.  He will use the profits to build a house for his family.

His dream is to own a fleet of motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a 24-year-old lady from the Musanda area of Mumias in Western Kenya. She is married to Boniface, and they have two children.

Risper operates a retail shop in the Musanda area, a business she has been doing for the last five years. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of cooking fat, sugar and other goods requested by her clientele.

Her dream is to open many shop outlets in Musanda.

loans.use: To buy stock of cooking oil, flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Enriqueta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 33 years old. She is married and has two children. With two children in school, Genelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Genelyn runs a buy-and-sell dried goods business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Genelyn has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Genelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Yors

texts.en: Mrs. Yors is in two businesses: she is a fish seller and a crop farmer. She is now 57 years old and a widow, living in Baray district with a daughter who is already married. Her daughter always helps her in both businesses. During season, Mrs. Yors usually starts growing dry-season rice crops and bean crops. However, she really needs some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase rice seeds and bean seeds for this project. She is very appreciative to all lenders who support her business. With the increase in income, she will save some money to expand her farmland in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and bean seeds for farming.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом  женат имеет троих детей. Он и его жена предприниматели. Абдусалом занимается предоставлением услуг по замене масла и балансировки автомашин. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается более трех лет. И имеет достаточный опыт  для расширения бизнеса. Он хотел бы получить займ для  закупа масла и автопокрышек для автомашин. Он надеется, получить займ в размере  5000 сомни для закупа товаров. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и понимание. И благодарен тем, кто его поддержит в этот час. Спасибо.
texts.en: Abdusalom is married with three children. He and his wife are entrepreneurs. Abdusalom has been providing services in oil change and balancing of vehicles. He has been in this business for more than three years and has enough experience to expand his business. He wants to get a loan to purchase oil and tires for cars. He hopes to get a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni for the purchase of goods. He looks forward to your support and understanding. And he thanks all those who will support him in this hour. Thank you.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel started to raise crops at the age of 18. At this early age, he used to plant and harvest rice to sell as a source of income. He was not able to go to college and did not even finish his high school education due to lack of finances. Joel is now 20 years old, single, and an industrious man. He lives with his parents at Lanna, Solana, Cagayan.

Joel is now asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy 5 bags of Urea (fertilizer) and rice seeds to grow.

He aims for the progression of his business that will surely lift his family out of poverty. He also aims that someday when he has children, he will strive harder to educate them.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of Urea (fertilizer) and rice seeds used for farming.

loans.name: Minara

texts.ru: Минаре 33 года, замужем и воспитывает одну дочку. Муж работает столяром.  Для того, чтобы покрыть ежедневные расходы семьи, Минара выпекает кондитерские изделия дома и отдает на реализацию в близлежащие магазины. В 2009 году, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Минара начала свой бизнес в разведении скота. Использовав стартовую сумму в 25,000 сом (KGS), Минара смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день две дойной коровы, одного бычка, одну лошадь, для прокорма которых сделаны кормовые запасы в 700 тюков. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Минара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. В будущем, Минара мечтает открыть свой собственный цех по производству кондитерских изделий.
texts.en: Minara is 33 years old, married and raising a daughter. Her husband works as a carpenter. In order to cover the daily family expenses Minara bakes pastries at home and takes it to the nearby shops to sell. In 2009 seeking an additional source of funding for her family Minara started her business by breeding cattle. Using the starting amount of 25,000 soms (KGS) Minara was able to develop the business which today accounts for two cows, one calf and one horse with 700 bales of feed stocks which were made to feed them. In order to further develop her business Minara has come to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to purchase additional cattle. In the future Minara dreams to open her own shop to produce confectionery products.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs such as pineapples, grapes, maize flour, rice, watermelon, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a 29-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family, a husband and six children who are 10, 8, 5, 4, 3 and 2 years old. 

Shamim’s day are focused on managing the household work and helping her husband in his dairy business. She helps him by getting the milk from his buffaloes and taking care of them. 

Her husband’s economic mainstay is his dairy business. He sells his buffaloes' milk to different areas of the community and generates revenue from it. He has a good customer base. He sells 1kg of milk for approximately PKR 50, and he sells almost 8kg to 12kg milk every day. He has been in this business for over 10 years.  

Shamim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy another buffalo to increase the milk productivity and sales. 

She is hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Mapengo W.g B Group

texts.en:
Grace is the facilitator of the Mapengo W.G B group. Grace and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Grace and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Grace had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Grace was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on that land. 

With the income from maize sales, Grace will invest in a cow and then build a house. 

In 2012, the members of Mapengo W.G B group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another vehicle  for transport purposes.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Amy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Dukundane Group

texts.fr:
Stéphanie fait partie du groupe Dukundane. Elle a 36 ans et elle est mariée avec 4 enfants de 4 à 11 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3  ans de primaire.

Stéphanie est cultivatrice de pomme de terre. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, des engrais chimiques location de champs et paiement main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de pommes de terre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Stéphanie voudrait être une grande cultivatrice des pommes de terre dans sa région. Avec les profits,elle prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Stéphanie is a member of Dukundane Group. She's 36 years old and married with four children, aged 4 to 11. Out of them, three attend school. Her own level of educations amounts to three years of elementary school.

Stéphanie is a potato farmer. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva's partner, ACB. She will use her loan to buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, rent fields, and pay for labor for her potato farming business.

Her strategy for growing her business is to modernize her farming techniques. In the forthcoming years, Stéphanie would like to become a large potato cultivator in her region. With her profits, she intends to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, rent fields, and pay for labor for her potato farming business

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino is 29 years old. He has been engaged in his corn farming business for eleven years and he usually earns PHP 17,000 per crop season. He is willing to work hard every single day to lift his family out of poverty. Marcelino is married to Jennifer, who helps him manage their farm. According to him, through the income generated from his business, he is able to support his family’s needs. 

At this time, Marcelino is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain his corn production. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: buy corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Bodjrènou Bertin

texts.fr: Bodjrènou Bertin est âgé de 41 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Célestine. Le couple a dix enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Bodjrènou Bertin n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Bodjrènou Bertin mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année environs, la culture de céréales (maïs) et des légumineuses (piment, gombo et tomate) qu’il vend dans une région du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Bodjrènou Bertin transforme les noix de palme en huile de palme qu’il revend. C'est dans sa région que Bodjrènou Bertin exerce ses activités. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Bodjrènou Bertin sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Bodjrènou Bertin, age 41, is married to a merchant named Célestine. The couple has ten children they have to support, out of which some attend school. In addition, the couple has another child to support.

Bodjrènou Bertin never attended school. The couple covers the various family expenses together. For about ten years, and in order to provide for himself and his family, Bodjrènou Bertin has been growing cereals (corn) and vegetables (chili pepper, gumbo, and tomatoes) that he sells in one of Benin's region.

In parallel, he transforms palm nuts into palm oil that he resells. He works in his region. In order to bolster his business and better meet customer demand, he's seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. He ambitions to bolster his business. His first loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy food products for his cultivation business (chili pepper, gumbo, tomatoes and corn)

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a 42-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business.

Claudia has had a sari-sari store business for five years. She sells various items like bread, spices, soap and shampoo. Claudia works hard to improve her business. 

Claudia has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as spices, bread and canned goods. Claudia hopes to earn more income and help send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as spices, bread and canned goods.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Minda has a shop that retails eggs, salt per kilogram & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy trays of eggs, sacks of salts and beverages.

Minda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy eggs, salt & beverages

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Leny has a shop that makes & sells snacks like cheese cakes & rice cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Leny has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients to make snacks for sale

loans.name: Cyprian

texts.en:
Cyprian is 41 years old, married and has 6 children.  He lives in Hioma, Uganda.  Cyprian deals in charging batteries for vehicles and has been in this business for 5 years.  He is faced with a challenge of theft of batteries.  His business goal is to expand business into new markets and his personal goal is to educate his children.

Cyprian needs a loan to buy distilled water used in batteries.

loans.use: buy distilled water for batteries

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline wants a loan to buy spare parts to resell. She lives in Masindi,Uganda. She is a married woman, aged 31, and is charged with the  responsibility of taking care of her three children. She saved her salary and started this spare parts business. She desires to educate herself and her children and save for the wedding.  Her business goal is to buy to own a wholesale spare parts shop and move her business to a more permanent location.

loans.use: t o buy spare parts to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 32 years old, married and has one child who is 16 years old.  She runs her clothes selling business in a very competitive environment, but she has retained her business because she has good customer care skills.  She thanks Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care.  

Sophia has been in this business for only one year and she hopes to expand her business and open a cosmetics shop.  She has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes to resell.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is 50 years old, married and has two children. As a civil servant, Wilson saved some money and started up a school ten years ago.  He is requesting a loan to renovate his classrooms.   He dreams of educating his children and expanding his business into new markets.

loans.use: renovate the classrooms in his school

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph operates a quarry site in Tala town where he has been mining for the last four years. He earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He is 33 years old, married to Magdalene, and they have four school-going children, aged between 17 and four years.

He has applied for his fifth loan of  KES 45,000 from KADET LTD. He paid back the previous loans fully and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy mining tools.

He will save his anticipated profits to provide basic needs for his family. Joseph hopes to grow his business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy mining tools.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Jocelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 36 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Annabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Annabelle has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, sardines, biscuits, coffee and milk.  

In the future Annabelle would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married and has 2 children. 

Jessica has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Jessica has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Kujitafutia Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the  Kujitafutia Group in Western Kenya! Sifrosa is the facilitator of the Kujitafutia group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Sifrosa takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Sifrosa had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Sifrosa was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Sifrosa and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Sifrosa will educate her children, ensure food security for her family, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Kujitafutia group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize. 

The photograph shows Sifrosa with her group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Célestin

texts.fr: Célestin est âgé de 41 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Odette. Le couple a treize enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants en charge. Célestin n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Célestin mène comme activité depuis trente ans environs, la culture des céréales qu’il vend dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette  activité, Célestin fait la pêche. C'est dans une ville du Bénin que Célestin exerce ses activités. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Célestin sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Célestin ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Célestin, age 41, is married to a merchant named Odette. The couple has thirteen children to support, out of which some attend school. In addition, they have two other children to support. The couple covers the various family expenses together.

Célestin never attended school. To provide for himself and his family, he's been growing cereals for about thirty years. He sells his crops in his region.

In parallel, Célestin is a fisherman. He runs his businesses in a town in Benin. In order to bolster his business and better meet customer demand, he's seeking his fifth loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

He ambitions to bolster his business. The first four loans he received previously were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy products for his farm business (chili pepper, tomatoes, bean, and corn)

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia lives in the coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. She is a single mother of two children. Virginia owns a tailoring shop which has been in operation for ten years.

She heard of Milango from her friends and decided to join in order to access credit for her businesses. She is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 in order to purchase more cloth in preparation for the Christmas festivities. Her main challenge is high cost of materials.

Virginia looks forward to owning more boutiques in the future. The income obtained from this business will help her to purchase more tailoring machines for example an overlock machine (used for hemming and seaming).

loans.use: to purchase more new cloth.

loans.name: Hotamchon

texts.ru: Хотамчон  перспективный семьянин. Имеет одного ребенка. Женат. Он занимается продажей пищевой соли. Товара оптом закупает на  залежах соли (рудники соли) ., и продает на рынке. Он производит расфасовку и упаковку соли для продажи. Он хотел бы получить займ для закупа 1,5 грузовой машины соли. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и милосердие и благодарен вам.
texts.en: Hotamchon is a promising family man.  He is married and has one child.  He is involved in selling food grade salt.  Hotamchon buys his product wholesale from salt mines and sells it at a market.  He sorts it out and packages it for sale.  Hotamchon wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of 1.5 tons of salt.  He hopes to get your support and mercy and is grateful to you.

loans.use: to purchase salt

loans.name: Maharagwe A.w Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maharagwe A.W Group in Western Kenya! Jacklyne is the facilitator of the Maharagwe A.W group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Jacklyne takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jacklyne had a good maize yield, harvesting 6 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jacklyne was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jacklyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Jacklyne will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

 In 2012, the members of Maharagwe A.W group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Elmie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverage. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Elmie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 54-year-old married woman with five children with aged between 19 and 28. Conchita's husband is a farmer.

Conchita got involved in farming seven years ago. She helps her husband till their land and grow rice crops to sell. Conchita also grows vegetables. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Conchita hopes to increase her earnings and be better able to sustain her children's education and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jérémie

texts.fr: Jérémie est âgé de 46 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Jacqueline. Le couple a neuf enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Jérémie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Jérémie mène comme activité depuis vingt cinq ans environs, la culture des céréales (maïs et haricot) et des légumineuses (gombo et piment) qu’il vend dans une ville du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Jérémie fait l’élevage des bœufs. C'est dans sa région que Jérémie exerce ses activités. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Jérémie sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Jérémie ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Jérémie, age 46, is married to a merchant named Jacqueline. The couple has nine children to support, out of which some attend school. In addition, the couple has another child to support. The couple covers the various family expenses together.

Jérémie never attended school. For about 25 years, and in order to provide for himself and his family, he's been growing cereals (corn and bean) and vegetables (gumbo and chili pepper) that he sells in a town in Benin.

In parallel, he raises cattle. He runs his businesses in his region. In order to bolster his business and better meet customer demand, Jérémie is seeking his fifth loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

He ambitions to bolster his business. The first four loans he received previously were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy products for his farming business (chili pepper, gumbo, bean and corn)

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 43 years old, married and has four children.  She deals in buying and selling rice, groundnut and maize.  She is faced with challenges in price fluctuations and inflation.   Her business goals are to buy land to grow crops and to expand her business into new areas.  Her personal goal is to build a permanent home.

Milly needs a loan to buy rice, groundnut and maize for sale.

loans.use: buy rice, groundnut and maize

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Yolanda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Yolanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some cereal products for resale.

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua is 55 years old, married and is a mother of six.  She runs a green grocery to earn a living.  She has been in this business for over twenty years.  She also has rental houses which earn her extra income.  

Wayua has been able to boost her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. Her desire is to open other outlets for her business in five years.

Wayua has requested a loan for 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals, onions, potatoes, tomatoes and oranges.

loans.use: buy cereals, onions, potatoes, tomatoes and oranges

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy soap, sugar and rice

loans.name: Mayette

texts.en:
Mayette is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mayette has a shop that makes & sells snacks like rice & banana cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Mayette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 39 years old, married and has 3 children.  She lives in Hioma, Uganda.  Juliet sells rice, beans and groundnut and has been in this business for 15 years.  She is faced with challenges in price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather.  Her business goal is to diversify the business and venture into farming, and her personal goal is to educate her children.

Juliet needs a loan to buy beans, rice and groundnut for resale.

loans.use: buy beans, rice and groundnut

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr: Estelle est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Vincent. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Estelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Estelle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Estelle mène comme activité depuis quinze ans environs, la culture des légumineuses (piment et gombo) qu’elle vend dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Estelle vend divers articles. C'est dans sa région que Estelle exerce ses activités. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Estelle sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Estelle ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Estelle is 41 years old and is married to a farmer named Vincent. The couple has five children, some of whom attend school while all are their dependents. Estelle did not attend school herself. She lives together with her ​​husband and children, and the couple shares responsibility for the various family expenditures.

To provide for her needs and those of her family over the past 15 years, Estelle has been growing crops of peppers and okra and selling them at a market in Benin. Alongside this activity, Estelle also sells various items.

Estelle conducts her business activities in the surrounding region. In order to strengthen her activity and better serve her customers, Estelle is requesting a fifth credit loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to increase the level of her activity. The four previous loans granted to Estelle have been repaid in full..

loans.use: Buying food crops for cultivation (pepper and okra).

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is married, has two children, and lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She owns a boutique, a business she has run for eight years. She obtained the starting capital from her husband.

She is applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to buy a new stock of lessos (screen printed fabric worn around the waist) and shirts. She learned about Milango from an employee. She intends to plow back the income into the business in order to increase the volume of sales. Her long term goals include purchasing a van for distribution.

loans.use: To buy a new stock of lessos and shirts.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is a 56-year-old seamstress and is married to David, a 57-year-old man. From their marriage, Yuliana and David have six children, they are: Hendrik, 35; Septini, 32; Bertin, 30 and Fortun, 28 - all married; Nona, 24 and Daniel, 22 both still studying at a university.

Yuliana has been involved in her seamstress business for about eight years; she decided to run the business in order to support her husband in generating more income for their family since her husband is only working odd jobs so the income generated is unstable. 

In a week, Yuliana can produce 3 to 5 garments, but particularly in December Yuliana always gets many orders from customers. Yuliana always works hard to complete the orders and she is grateful for the assistance of her children in completing the orders. 

Yuliana has an empty room to be rented but it should be renovated. She also plans to produce curtains but she should buy the fabric as the basic material. Unfortunately, Yuliana does not have enough capital to do so. She is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000 to purchase fabric for her business and building material such as cement, sand, etc. Yuliana is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for her business and building material such as cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
In the photo is Wilson, 32, a father of two children, aged 5 and 7.  He sells clothes and shoes to earn a living for his family.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person.  

Wilson has managed to expand his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  His desire is to grow his business for more income generation.  He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shoes to resell.

loans.use: buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Mapengo W.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mapengo W.G Group in Western Kenya! Beatrice is the facilitator of the Mapengo W.G group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Beatrice takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had a good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children and pay back her loans.

In 2012, the members of Mapengo W.G group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Beatrice with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Zebra Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a thirty-three-year-old hardworking man lives in Masindi, Uganda. He has a retail shop which he has operated for five years. Price fluctuation, taxes and high fuel and transport costs hinder his business. He hopes to enhance his children’s education.His business dream is to diversify and expand into new markets. 

Joseph is a member of Zebra group, where members guarantee for each other in order to access a loan.  Joseph wants a loan to buy sugar, rice, soap and salt to resell.

loans.use: buy sugar, rice, soap and salt

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old and had three children. She is widowed and stands as both father and mother to her children. It is important for her to maintain her business because it is her only source of income. Her children cannot help her because they are still studying. 

Grace has been selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her village for almost 10 years.  She puts up the business outside her house. 

Grace is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy onions, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes to sell in her food stall.  She aims to give a better quality of life to her children and keep growing as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: buy onions, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Tuvemubujiji /rbv Group

texts.fr:
Spéciose  fait partie du groupe Tuvemubujiji. Elle a 45 ans et elle est mariée avec 5 enfants de 11 à 25 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6  ans de primaire.

Spéciose est cultivatrice de maïs. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, des engrais chimiques,location de champs et paiement main d’œuvre pour son agriculture des maïs. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Spéciose voudrait être une grande cultivatrice des pommes de terre dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser ses enfants
texts.en:
Speciose is part of the Tuvemubujiji group. She is 45 years old and married with five children aged 11 to 25 years, of whom four attend school. Her own level of education has been six years of primary school.

Speciose is a corn crop farmer. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. She will use her loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, rent fields and pay labor costs for her corn-farming activity.

Her strategy to expand her business is to modernize her crop farming. In coming years, Speciose wants to become a major potato farmer in her region. She plans to use the profits to provide schooling for her children.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, rent fields and pay the labor costs of her corn-farming activity.

loans.name: Finagnon Mathias

texts.fr: Finagnon Mathias est âgé de 51 ans et est marié à une vendeuse du nom de Célestine. Le couple a quinze enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants en charge. Finagnon Mathias n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Finagnon Mathias mène comme activité depuis quarante ans environs, la culture de céréales (haricot) et des légumineuses (piment et tomate) qu’il vend dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Finagnon Mathias fait la pêche. C'est à Cotonou que Finagnon Mathias s'approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Finagnon Mathias sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Finagnon Mathias ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Finagnon Mathias is 51 years old and married to a saleswoman named Celestine. The couple has fifteen children all of whom attend (or have attended) school, and live under their care. In addition to their own children, they care for two other children. Finagnon Mathias has not attended school himself. The couple shares responsibility for all household expenditures.

To provide for his needs and those of his family, Finagnon Mathias has been cultivating beans, peppers and tomatoes over the past forty years, which he then sells in the surrounding area. Alongside this activity, Dossa Mathias is also a fisherman. He resupplies in Cotonou.

In order to bolster his business and better serve his customers, Finagnon Mathias is requesting a fifth credit loan from ALIDé. His ambition is to increase the level of his business activity. The previous four loans granted him have all been fully reimbursed.

loans.use: Buy food crops for cultivation (beans, peppers and tomatoes)

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza. He owns a business where he sells and fixes washing machines.  He hopes that through this loan he will be able to build an attic for his store and to buy new washing machines. He hopes that once he builds the attic he will be able to have room for storage. That way he can bring in a large number of wash machines and will have a place to store them until they are fixed.

loans.use: build an attic and buy new washing machines.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha lives in the coastal town of Kongowea, Kenya. She is married and has two school-going children. Tabitha operates a secondhand clothes shop which has been running for the last seven years.

She was invited into Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase a stock of secondhand clothes for her business. She looks forward to establishing a wholesale clothes shop in the future. 

The high inflation being experienced in most areas is her main challenge since it has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. The extra income obtained from this business will help her raise the standard of living of her family and provide better education.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of secondhand clothes for her business.

loans.name: Clément

texts.fr: Clément est âgé de 31 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Aïchatou. Le couple a quatorze enfants dont certains scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants en charge. Clément n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Clément mène comme activité depuis trente ans environs, la culture des légumineuses (tomates, piment et gombo) et du maïs qu’il vend dans une ville du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette  activité, Clément fait la pêche. Clément s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Clément sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Clément ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Clément is 31 years old and married to a trader called Aïchatou. The couple have 14 children, some of whom attend school. They are raising 2 other children, as well as their own. The couple share the household expenses.

Clément does not have a formal education. In order to be able to meet his, and his family's, needs, he has grown vegetables (e.g. tomatoes, pepper and gumbo) and corn, for around 30 years. He sells his produce in his local town in Benin. He also fishes.

Clément gets his supplies in his local area and is requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé so that he can invest in and strengthen his business, and better satisfy customer demand. He would like to increase his level of business activity. His 4 previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy crop-growing products (for peppers, tomatoes, gumbo and corn)

loans.name: Shikhwenyi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Shikhwenyi Group in Western Kenya! Harun is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Harun takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Harun had a good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Harun and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Harun will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

 In 2012, the members of Shikhwenyi group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en:
Johnbosco is a boutique owner who wants a loan to buy clothes for resale. Aged 28 years, he is the father of two children. He wants to see that they get a good education. 

He started this business with the money he acquired after harvesting and selling his maize produce. He faces a problem of price fluctuations. 

His business dream is to expand his business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Munasih

texts.en:
Munasih is a 34-year-old lady, married with two children namely: Lin, 13, studying in the 2nd grade of Junior High School; and Dwi, 10, studying in the 5th grade of Elementary School.

In order to assist her husband in covering her family's needs, Munasih commenced a small business selling fruit ice – made of papaya, water melon, pineapple, avocado, melon, jack fruit, syrup and coconut milk. Munasih also sells “rujak” (fruit salad with pungent dressing). She has been operating the business since 2001. 

Munasih is grateful for the income generated from the business that helps her in covering their needs and the educational fees of her children, as well as paying the house rent.

Currently, Munasih is thinking to sell fried rice in the evening. Therefore she is seeking a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000. The loan will be spent on business equipment i.e., plates, spoons, a stove, a frying pan, etc. Munasih is hoping that TLM will be willing to provide her with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase business equipment i.e., plates, spoons, a stove, a frying pan, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 29 years old and married with three children. She lives in Hioma, Uganda, where she runs a retail shop selling soap, sugar and salt. She has been in this business for three years.

She is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations and inflation. Her business goal is to expand her business into new markets, and her personal goal is to educate her children.

Judith wants a loan to buy soap, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt and sugar for sale

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en: Desideria is a 46-year-old married woman with 9 children. The oldest child is 17 years old. She works hard to help feed her family 3 times a day. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. She also desires to send all her children to school. She plans to buy clothes for her children with her profit.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона не замужем, ей 21 года. Она умная и целеустремленная девушка. Она желает всем добра и хочет, чтоб все женщины были счастливыми. Четыре года назад Фарзона начала свой бизнес. У нее свой салон красоты. Постепенно она стала предоставлять услуги по макияжу невест к свадебным мероприятиям, прокат свадебных нарядов, а также оформление машин для свадьбы. Фарзона хотела бы получить займ в размере 3500 Сомони для покупки свадебных платьев.
texts.en: Farzona is 21 years old and not married.  She is a smart and goal-oriented young woman.  She wishes everyone well and wants all women to be happy.  Farzona started her business four years ago.  She owns a beauty salon.  Gradually, she started to offer makeup services to brides for wedding events, wedding dress rentals and coordinating cars for weddings.  Farzona wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3500 Somoni to purchase wedding dresses.

loans.use: to purchase wedding dresses

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 31 years old and married with two children. She buys and sells rice and has been in this business for four years.

She is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. Her business goal is to expand her business into new markets, and her personal goal is to educate her children.

Annet needs a loan to buy rice for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice for sale

loans.name: Sèho Vincent

texts.fr: Sèho Vincent est âgé de 54 ans et est marié à une agricultrice du nom de Estelle. Le couple a douze enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants en charge. Sèho Vincent vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Sèho Vincent n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Sèho Vincent mène comme activité depuis trente cinq ans environs, la culture des légumineuses (piment et patates douces) et des céréales (haricot et maïs) qu’il vend dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sèho Vincent fait l’élevage des bœufs. C'est dans sa région que Sèho Vincent exerce ses activités. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Sèho Vincent sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les trois premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Sèho Vincent ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Sèho Vincent is 54 years old and is married to a farmer named Estelle. They have twelve children, some at school and all living at home. As well as their own children, they have three other dependent children. Sèho Vincent lives with his wife and children. Sèho Vincent did not attend school. The couple cover the family's expenses between them. In order to meet his own needs and those of the family, Sèho Vincent has, for approximately thirty five years, grown vegetables (peppers and sweet potatoes) and cereals (beans and corn) which he sells in a market in Benin. In addition to this activity, Sèho Vincent also raises cattle. He does all this in his local area. In order to strengthen his business, and to better meet his customers' needs, Sèho Vincent is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDé. His ambition is to increase the scale of his activity. The three loans previously taken by Sèho Vincent have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy food products for growing (corn, beans, peppers and sweet potatoes).

loans.name: Natanel

texts.en:
Natanel, 43 years old, is married to Diana, 31 years old; they are blessed with two daughters, namely Bernida, 9, and Restina, 6, both studying at Elementary School.

Natanel and Diana are farmers; they cultivate bananas, cassava and yams. After the harvest, Diana sells the crops at the nearest market. In order to earn more income for his family’s living, Natanel bought pigs to raise. He initiated the business in 2007.

Natanel is planning to raise more pigs but he requires more money to do so. Therefore, Natanel would like to request a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 7,500,000, to purchase pigs and feed for them. He also wants to buy more agricultural products to resell. Natanel really hopes that he will get the loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed and more agricultural products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paints, ink and pens to use in his printing services

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
To make a living, 42-year-old Charles operates a small cornfield in his village. He has been in this business for two years, and he supports his three children and his wife through his farming. 

He does not want his family to suffer from financial difficulties, and he wants to improve their standard of living. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy seed corn, fertilizers and insecticides for his cornfield.

Hopefully, the corn will grow well for a good harvest. He plans to save the income from his crops to support the education of his children as well as to secure his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy seed corn, fertilizers and insecticides for his cornfield

loans.name: Shamwenya Group

texts.en:
Margaret is the facilitator of the Shamwenya group. Margaret and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margaret and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Margaret had a very good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Margaret was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Margaret will educate her children and pay debts and other bills.
